description:
Food - 4/5
Staff - 5/5
Cleanliness- 5/5

Food: Great neighborhood, family-friendly, Italian restaurant. Highly recommend their pasta, 5/5! We ordered the special chicken Park and unfortunately wasn't to our liking. Stick to the pastas and house wine. Great value for its price and the tiramisu was fantastic.

Staff: Professional and friendly. Great timing with bringing out our courses and superb service overall.

Cleanliness: Immaculate. Again, a great neighborhood vibe and friendly atmosphere.

Overall: Highly recommend the fresh pasta. Some of the best pasta in town.
author: Thomas H.

description:
This isn't a five star, fancy Italian place.
It is a solid neighborhood restaurant with delicious food. Guests are treated like friends. 

I always get the Vongole - heaping plate of spaghetti with real clams...not the canned stuff. My husband always goes for something on the daily special menu, and it is always good. 

Parking is sometimes a challenge in West Portal but it is 2 mins walk from the West Portal station.
author: Mimi T.

description:
The food was absolutely delicious, and our server, Michelle, was incredibly kind, helpful, attentive, and prompt. She facilitated our 12-person group for a wedding and birthday celebration, and there was not a single hiccup the whole night.

Not to mention, the atmosphere was perfect. It was intimate yet fun, great for friends, family, or a romantic date. 

I got to try the chicken parmigiana, the salmon special, and the tiramisu. I'd recommend every last one!
author: Christian S.

description:
Yes, This is the place to come to. 
I have always come in to a smile and how can we help you. Never thought too much about it until today. I thought to myself that this is the way you should treat people. 
We came rather early around 4:45 so not too many people which was the plan, I hate having to wait for a table, or having too much noise you can't hear what the person across the table is saying. Not a problem here because even when it does get crowded the clients here seem to like a quiet cozy meal. 
You start off with the fresh bread and tomato cream spread. 
The food was perfect and tasty no matter what you order. 
Note don't fill up on the food because you wouldn't want to miss the tiramisu . Delicious. light and airy. 
Thank you for another delicious dinner .
author: Jesse S.

description:
Back again, this time for a Saturday lunch. I brought the family.

Had the pear salad...the pears were a bit under-ripened, but the dressing and greens mitigated matters, and all was fine. I ordered the Pappardelle lamb--Yum! Others at the table ordered the Ravioli Pollo Pesto, Capellini Pomodoro, Minestrone, Fettuccine Gamberoni, and Pepperoni Pizza with spicy Italian sausage.

For wine, the house Chianti. For dessert, the Tiramisu and the Chocolate Mousse Cake.

The service was excellent as was the vibe (as it was previously). The traffic on West Portal Avenue was non-existent, as they are repairing the tunnel, which means it's easy to get in and out.

Enjoy!
author: Reyn J.

description: I was impressed with Spiazzo. The staff were nice and the ambiance was very Italian like. The food was the highlight; I ordered the bruschetta and tricolore pizza and everything was delicious. My only small complaint is the reusable napkins that they have at the tables are full of dust and when I opened my napkin to place it on my lap, a flurry of dust went all over my food and drink.. I will still come back and give Spiazzo another shot.
author: Brandon M.

description: We had a wonderful meal. It is solid normal food. We sat in a booth and each had some wonderful fish. Great service. This is the sort of place I will always return to because it is the sort of restaurant I miss. A proper lunch place and a great meal.
author: Evan A.

description:
We were warmly greeted and seated right away. Food was well seasoned and service was attentive and fast. Excellent wine list. If you're in the West Portal area and wanting great Italian food and excellent service, come here! 4-stars only because I wasn't a fan of the bread they served in the beginning or the orange colored spread. Some ciabatta with butter or olive oil would have been better.

Update 7-30-15:

Forgot to mention, we had the Spaghetti
author: Roger E.

description: Really good food! The lasagna was amazing. It was super cheesy and the marinara sauce tasted great. The customer service was also good. First time I went to this place and something I would recommend to people coming into town.
author: Samantha D.

description:
I came on a Sunday for dinner with my friend. I had the Spaghetti Alla Vongole, and it was delicious. Pasta was cooked al dente. The sauce was rich, not too salty, and not overwhelmed with garlic.  Overall, very well and balanced flavors.  I even had some leftover for the next day.

I look forward to bringing my boyfriend here for date night in the future :)
author: Erica M.

description:
Nice old school Italian restaurant with good food and Italian waiters.

Ravioli ricotta and the thin crust pizza were yummy. Great service...especially because the waiter said I was good looking. The ego is a powerful thing.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Anything less than 5 stars for this lovely restaurant would be a lie for the amazing lunch we had today. It was busy but we were still able to be seated immediately. The service was
Impeccable! I wish I had caught the waitress' name.. she is truly a shining star! The menu was overwhelming for me as we had just arrived in the city after two flights and a business meeting.. I could have eaten anything but three dishes caught my attention. I asked our waitress for her assistance. She recommended the ravioli stuffed with chicken with a pesto cream sauce. From her description of this dish, my husband ordered it as well. We pretty much thought we had died and gone to heaven!  Thank you so so much! This was a truly amazing and memorable lunch. We enthusiastically recommend this restaurant!
author: Laura L.

description:
Everything was delicious, but we ordered a special, the Ravioloni Di Zucca Alle Noci and it was AMAZING!  The sauce is a walnut sauce that has a really special flavor I haven't tasted anywhere.  Super rich and velvety!  I highly recommend it if they are serving it that night.

Giuseppe, the owner is also the nicest - he really cares and wants to make sure your meal is special!
author: Colin D.

description: My friends and I decided to go out for dinner and it was also my late birthday since I was almost ready to give birthday any day. When we arrived we got seated right away. The restaurant is very small but looks like many families like to eat here. Parking can be a bit hard, there are alot of metered parking outside, but it depends on time of day, it gets busy as there are other popular restaurants near by. For starters we ordered calamari, and clams. I was not able to eat the clams but my friends loved it, but we were not too impressed with the calamari. Maybe it was the way it cooked, it was just fried and topped off with veggies, with a spicy sauce. I ordered penne pasta with chicken and veggies, and my husband orders the seafood pasta. I was not too impressed with my pasta, the sauce tasted water down, and the chicken was cut in chunks. It was really nothing special to me, but the seafood pasta looked pretty good, only that there were only a few pieces of it. All in service was great, but the food was not that great. Unfortunately I probably will not come back as its pretty expensive and I didnt really like my pasta or the way it was cooked. If it is your first time by all means try it out, it was just to my liking I did not like it.
author: Tiffany K.

description: What a cute place to go to for lunch if you're ever in the West Portal area. Great food, great service and the best part was the dessert. I had a group of 14 and they were able to accommodate us and provide excellent service. I will definitely be returning.
author: Alicia M.

description: Very nice restaurant. Customer service was great all around! The food was delicious as well. I felt a nice environment, the place was full of great customers and employees. Very good impression for a first timer! Remember to check them out!
author: Erik S.

description:
The food is amazing! The pear salad, salmon, pizza, handmade pumpkin ravioli, and bread are incredible. They were very busy with a line out the door, but our gorgeous waitress still made time to take care of us. We were allowed to bring in our own bottle of wine too! 

The ambiance is alright, it's chilly by the door. It's not a sexy, romantic place, but the food is off the chains. 

Alissa P
author: Ivory B.

description:
Yeah. You should totally go here.

Healthy portions, friendly staff, nice atmosphere. 

Got the special calamari antipasto - which was very large. calamari where quite nicely fried and the sauce that comes with it was just the right of spice and not balance for me (I'm at the medium spice tolerance level). 

Also got Eggplant Parmigiana antipasto. The eggplant was thinly sliced and stacked instead of thick slices - which I think I prefer thick slices, but my husband apparently prefers thin slices, so he was stoked - he usually doesn't eat the eggplant but he did here. I will note that the inside of it was a little cold - so that's a ding. 

Special pesto and chicken ravioli were solid. They tasted very much like pesto, although they came in a light cream sauce which I quite enjoyed. The sun dried tomato and mushroom paired nicely. The chicken maybe was a little dry? (or maybe I just don't really like chicken?).

Gnocci were definitely fresh. The sauce was very simple - and therefore not a good choice for me (but that's why I didn't order it) - but I think it's what my husband was looking for. 

Bread comes standard (important feature). It was French bread - as a bread snob I was unimpressed - but the tomato dip that comes with it is quite nice. 

Came in on Sunday night around 6:30 and got a table for two without reservation, but it did look like those that arrived just after us had to wait a few minutes.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Not normally a pizza or pasta person, but this place had some bomb pizza AND pasta.

We got the Pizza Margherita to share as an appetizer. The pizza was light and not overpowered by cheese, but what really got my attention was the dough. I typically do not like the crust but I finished the crust for this. The pizza was literally cooked for the perfect amount of time and heat. I was only able to get one slice, but I wish I could've gotten more.

For my entree, I got the Fettucine Con Gamberoni (egg fettucine, fresh tomato garlic, white wine, basil, prawns, and green onions). I love how light this dish was. Usually pastas are drenched in oil, but this one wasn't. Yet, it was still very tasty. The green onions definitely added extra flavoring to the dish, but in a good way. The portion was the perfect size and for a small eater like me, I was able to take half home for dinner.

I highly recommend this place! Delicious pasta and pizza, and your glass of water will never be empty. The server was extremely attentive -- took away the used plates when we were done, filled our waters before it got half empty, etc. Very impressive!
author: Julian Y.

description: We came here for my friend's birthday dinner.  Parking in West Portal is never easy & with the construction going on, I was afraid it'd be horrific.  Fortunately we were able to find parking a block away.  The crowd was definitely older, but not a deal breaker.  Although service was ok, we were brought out flutes and wine glasses that appeared unclean.  I was hoping the food would be something I could write home about.  Unfortunately, the food was just mediocre as the pasta was bland.
author: Candice H.

description:
I'm a little biased against mid market Italian places because lots of them seem like they sell pretend good food but it's actually dressed up pizza hut pizza or spaghetti Os with clams.

Anyway, the guy running this place is really nice and they try really hard.  

After I had half of my greasy, salty, overpriced pizza and gave up, the manager or owner brought out a slice of cake for my mom's birthday.  That's nice.

I think if you want okay Italian food at decent prices this place is a good choice. If there's anywhere better in the Sunset/West Portal area I'm open to suggestions.
author: Asper K.

description:
Unimpressed and pricey! A friend and I decide to have lunch here around 2pm because there was nothing else open and it was Father's Day and we did not want to wait anywhere else that was open. Spiazzo has no wait and was open. 

We were given dried up and hardened foccacia bread with a romesco sauce. Meh. Nothing special. I would have rather had soft fluffy bread with butter. We ordered the salmon penne pasta and tortellini each costing at $18. Portions were small and taste was mediocre. 

Service was horrible. Not once did they fill our water cups or ask if we were alright. I had to make awkward eye contact with someone passing just to get their attention. I ended up paying around $40 for the meal not including any drinks, appetizers, or desserts. Not worth it. Go elsewhere this place will not satisfy your pasta cravings.
author: Marie N.

description:
Pasta and parking... already makes for a decent meal in SF. 
I guess that while it may convince you to check it out, it's not very helpful so here is the full review.

Spiazzo is a cozy Italian restaurant nestled in the restaurant row of West Portal. It's mostly traditional, not hip like Delarosa and not exorbitantly expensive like SPQR. Think of it as a more intriguing, non-chain version of Olive Garden.

The menu is expansive, with a wide selection of apps ($15-20), pastas (~$17), pizzas (~$15), and entrees ($15-25). There's also an extra page for specials, which are a tad more pricey (~$19 pasta and $23 risotto) but also more interesting. While there isn't really anything mind-blowingly unique, the options are solid and you're bound to find a dish matching your carvings. Although I'm a fan of simple pomodoro pastas, I would suggest getting a meat one since the vegetarian and seafood pastas only differ by $1-2. 

I tried the pappardelle with lamb... because pappardelle and lamb are my weaknesses. The chunks of lamb were tender and juicy, the pappardelle consisted of extra-wide ribbons of pasta, and both held together seamlessly with the hearty tomato sauce. The pastas are huge (even the raviolis are giant size), and we all got boxes. 

We also shared a calamari appetizer, which was also a large portion size with satisfying assortment of lightly battered calamari, octopus, and tiny shrimp. The complimentary bread was decent too, warmed and with a nice crisp to the crust.

Service was excellent; the server was very accommodating and offered to help us move to a roomier table when we found out there would be more people joining our group. He also took one of the dishes to keep warm while someone in our party took her kids to the bathroom. 

Overall, the dining experience at Spiazzo was classic and on-point. 
I guess pasta and parking in SF never really could go wrong after all.
author: Edna C.

description: Pretty authentic Italian food! I loved the atmosphere. It was very nice and homey if you will. The wait staff was amazing and I loved the Italian beer. The food was pretty legit too.
author: Jason S.

description:
This is literally my go to place when I feel like having some Italian food.  The food is good and the neighborhood is nostalgic for me.  I'm impressed by the consistency of the food quality and great service.  

Was here on a busy weekend Friday.  We received two glasses of water immediately upon sitting down.  It was exactly what I wanted.  Perfect!  On top of that, my water was constantly refilled by the waiter running around even though I kept drinking it empty (was so thirsty that day).  Our waiter Tairo gave excellent and honest recommendations that we were extremely happy about.  The Scampi & Capesante he suggested as one of his personal favorites and now mine too !  The important part was that the seafood was cooked just right and the angel hair was made perfect. Not too soft and not too tough.  Best angel hair I've ever had! 

The finishing Tiramisu is just as good as always.  My only regret is not having enough space at the end of the meal to order my own Tiramisu.  

I've brought friends here a few times and all there ever was to say were always positive comments and most are impressed with even simple dishes like lasanga and pizza.   I will be back again, and will bring other friends to try.
author: Juila L.

description: This is hands down the best italian restaurant in San Fransisco if you consider price, the food, and service together. The service is fast and the wait staff actually remember you even if you only come once a month. The food is flavorful without being overly salty and oily. It is one of the few places that does a good gnocci. The gnocci just melts in your mouth and balances well with the sauce. Their pasta is also superb. I loved their butter squash ravioli. It was very flavorful and had a hint of sweetness. I was most impressed with the sauce. Most of the taste and creaminess comes from the squash instead of added cream. Would highly recommend this place :)
author: Diane Z.

description: The chicken Parmesan tasted like plastic - frozen chicken? Mentioned to nice waiter and he said response from kitchen (?)was that it was not frozen. Bread was awful-like a poor organic grain-not what one would expect from Italian!
author: JJ L.

description:
After a rough week at work, there's nothing quite like the comfort of a good pasta dish. Despite not having the best experience at Spiazzo last time, I gave it another chance...opting for to go because I actually just wanted to put my feet up at home, be lazy, and start my weekend.

I ordered the Spaghetti Portofino and found it to be excellent. Upon arriving home, I lifted the lid and found my dish still steaming and warm. There were generous portions of medium prawns and bay scallops, which were cooked nicely and each hugged with that delicious white wine garlic cream sauce. It was also a plus that the seafood had a bit of that briny flavor, but not so much so that it was overbearing (as in the case from my last experience here).

I easily cleared the plate and still wished I had more.
author: Elaine Y.

description: Deeply disappointed in this restaurant.  I've heard good things about this place so we checked it out the other night and the food was not what I was expecting.  I ordered the trout and my spouse had the fillet mignon. The trout was cooked too long thus it was dry and it was rather scrawny.  I like small portions but this was beyond small.  Then the fillet mignon my spouse ordered was to be cooked medium but came back well done.  The one redeeming quality of the plates were the veggies, they were decent.  As far as the ambience, it was nice and quiet and the service was decent.
author: Mike S.

description:
A group of us got together at Spiazzo to celebrate a friend's birthday. He made a reservation for dinner on Saturday, February 25th at 7pm for a party of 8. This restaurant is tiny and it was super busy, so we had to wait a bit for our table. We were seated around 7:20pm.

*Burrata E Prosciutto: fresh mozzarella shell and stracciatella, with 12 months aged prosciutto and kalamata olives + EVOO ($16.95) x2
*Fried Calamari: calamari, baby shrimps, zucchini deep fried with arrabiata sauce, spicy ($18.95) x2
*Insalata Alla Cesare: caesar salad ($8), add Anchovies (+$3.50)
*Pizza Tricolore: 1/3 Margherita with fresh tomato and basil, 1/3 Four cheeses, and 1/3 Pesto and Mozzarella ($16.95)
*Sangiovese Pasqua ($34)
*Barbera d'Asti ($36)

We all shared appetizers and wine. I enjoyed the burrata and prosciutto. The burrata was creamy while the prosciutto added a nice meaty saltiness. I adore anchovies so I ordered the caesar. It satisfied my veggie craving, but it was over dressed. I also could have used more anchovies! The pizza was a nice way to try a couple different pies, but it seemed like it was only a half and half versus a sampling of three pizzas. I thought the calamari was average. It was a pretty big portion though. The wines were moderately priced. I liked that we could get decent reds for under $40 a bottle.

*Gnocchi Romoletto: italian potato dumplings with fresh tomato, basil, mushrooms and secret spices of the chef ($16.95)
*Spaghetti Alla Vongole: spaghetti with fresh clams, garlic, white wine, a touch of chili peppers in a tomato sauce ($17.95) x2
*Spaghetti Portofino: spaghetti, prawns, scallions, white wine + garlic sauce ($19.95)
*Fettuccine Con Gamberoni: egg fettuccine, fresh tomato, garlic, a touch of chili pepper, white wine, basil, prawns and green onions ($17.95)
*Ravioli Con Pesto E Pollo: large ravioli, pesto and chicken filled, in a light cream sauce, sundried tomatoes, mushrooms and spinach ($19.95)
*Filetto Alla Dolce Vita: grilled grass fed filet mignon with mushrooms, prosciutto in a marsala wine sauce ($27.95)
*Garretto Romanesco: braised lamb shank with mushrooms and green peas in a tomato wine sauce served with risotto ($26.95)

I ordered the filet since I'm a big meat eater. It was cooked rare and I adored the mushrooms, but it was a little too sweet for me. And the prosciutto didn't seem to go with the wine sauce. I'm not a big pasta eater, but hands down, my favorite dish was the ravioli. So creamy and comforting. Mushrooms and spinach are two of my favorite vegetables, so I adored them in this dish!

*Tiramisu ($7.50)
*Creme Brulee ($7.50)
*Chocolate Mousse Cake ($7.50)
*Zanze's Cheese Cake ($7.50)
*Graham's Tawny Port n/v ($7.95) x2
*Graham's 20 Years ($12)
*Harveys Bristol Cream n/v ($7.95)
*Vin Santo di Toscana ($12.95)
*Coffee ×3

Birthday celebrations always ended with dessert and drinks. Now, I'm not a huge dessert person, so I only sampled most of the desserts. My favs were the tiramisu and cheesecake. Both were light, creamy, and not too sweet.

Fun place for a birthday celebration. Although the restaurant isn't really equipped for bigger parties, they made it work. Overall, I think the food was pretty average. I would really only come back for that ravioli. And of course, their wine prices.
author: Elena N.

description:
The food is absolutely amazing, all three pasta dishes we ordered tasted great! Wine and desserts recommended by the owner was really good too.

Very busy and crowded in the restaurant, but overall pleasing to dine at.

Service is great, but something to watch out for is when we reserved through Yelp, the restaurant actually didn't reserve seats for us. For some reason the Yelp reservation is offered but not implemented at the restaurant. My wife talked to the owner and he did his best to make it up, so we are grateful for that.

Pricing is reasonable.
author: Oscar K.

description:
Lovely Italian with very authentic artisan Italian food.

The past is fresh and made from scratch.

The the  bolognese and caprese salad.

My only problem was the buffalo mozzarella was not fresh like it is in Italy.  That is super picky and realistically not applicable unless they had it flown in from Italy twice a week.
author: Michael C.

description:
Four stars for food, and another for ambiance and service.

I've been coming here since I was younger and this place is always a go-to for solid, delicious Italian food. Personally, their best dish is the calamari spaghetti with a great balance of seafood and sauce. The risotto is delicious as well. They can be heavy with the cheese so make sure to ask them to adjust it to your preference when ordering. The portions are big as well and the complimentary bread is so yum. 

We are always greeted and served with a smile that adds to the homeyness of the restaurant. This place is a great neighborhood staple and I will be coming back for as long as they're around :)
author: Melanie W.

description: I was lowkey dying when I came here with friends and not hungry at all but the waiter was one impeccable dude who always checked up on me and made some good suggestions on dishes that I might have liked. The atmosphere was warm and welcoming, I loved seeing the everyone chatting together and the brightly lit interior made me cheer up a bit. My 2 hours of sleep self decided to get the soup, as it happened to be the cheapest item :P Unlimited bread sticks has been a staple carb diet for me, so I got some even though I'm trying not to get fat. I'd come here again just because of the nice service, not so sure about the food though since I wasnt in a very sane state of mind :)
author: Leo W.

description:
Came here for the first time on a Monday night with a few friends and we will definitely be back!

Their menu has a great selection of dishes.
I had the Ravioli Con Pesto E Pollo that was delicious! Ravioli was perfectly al dente and sauce was creamy, but not too heavy. My friends had the Penne Al Salmone, Spaghetti Alla Vongole, and Fettuccine Con Gamborini - all seafood pasta dishes. They all had a generous amount of seafood in their pasta and enjoyed their dishes. The bread they served before the meal was also really good, fresh and soft!

Good thing I had made reservations on Yelp beforehand. They were busy even on a Monday night. Service was wonderful! Our server was attentive and funny. She helped my friends surprise me with tiramisu for my birthday. *See picture, she said the red dot was a kiss for me. :P
author: Anna L.

description: Solid food, great family vibe, upbeat atmosphere, very friendly and helpful staff.  Great meal with my daughter.  As always, we will be back for more.  Thank you.
author: Leo S.

description: We have been here 2 times. It is our favorite place to eat in the city. Staff is very polite and friendly. The food is simply amazing. It has a relaxed atmosphere. We can't wait to go back more!
author: Hicran K.

description:
The food is good here, fairly solid and reliable with decent portions, tasty flavors and adequate pricing.

The one pet peeve I have with San Francisco restaurants (so not specifically unique to Spiazzo) is that they also charge a surcharge fee to pay for their employees health insurance, so you're paying for food, tax, insurance and are also expected to tip for service too!).  My rant is this.  It should be the company's (restaurant business owner) responsibility to pay for their employees benefits, health insurance included.  If a restaurant is unwilling to pay for their employees health insurance it's the employees responsibility to secure their own either through their own paycheck (revenue from tips included) or to find another job or career where insurance is covered if they opt not to buy into paying for their own health insurance.  Alternatively, if the bleeding heart liberal community of SF really wants the customers to pay for employee's health insurance, I'd suggest the more digestible method is to have restaurants just increase their prices by 5% behind the menu and closed doors so it's not so blatantly a "here's the lower price we charge, but here's the bigger price you have to pay" - - sort of like how some airlines charge for baggage or hotels that charge for parking or resort fees - - if they just rolled those desired revenues into their base price fee you'd not get so many customers rolling their eyes and protesting in anger.   Rant Over :)

So, back to the review.  I like this place.  The service was nice. There is No A/C (air conditioning" inside, which was the only drawback when we visited during the 2017 Labor Day Heatwave (reaching high 90's!).

Parking in this area is getting tougher, but is still one of those situations of karma, timing and luck or the willingness to walk a biit if you can find residential parking in the adjacent neighborhood. 

The pizza was good here, as was the complimentary bread.
author: Rick S.

description:
The place kind of smelled old and utensils were dirty. 

The spaghetti wasn't even good; very bland. The people were nice but honestly, I think for the price you should find a different place. I was craving authentic Italian, but this is not the place for me.

Disappointing, but they were somewhat friendly.
author: Anna D.

description:
We ordered: pumpkin ravioli, gnocchi romoletto, and the spaghetti portofino, in order of my fav to least fav. 

The ravioli was homemade and the chewiness was perfect, and the gnocchi was smooth and pillow-y. 

My rating was ultimately determined by the texture of the spaghetti portofino. Since they used boxed/dried pasta, it becomes so important to make sure to cook to al dente, but the spaghetti was a little too overdone, which brought the rating down to 3 stars for me. 

The flavors were generally up to snuff for classic Italian cooking. The seafood had a slight fishiness to it, like it had been sitting around for a day or two too long. Other than that, it was an enjoyable dinner.
author: Sheewon B.

description: Been here with family many times and tonite was ok. One word of advice, if it's cold outside stay far, far away from the front door or the path into the restaurant from the front door because it gets really cold in the breeze blows in and really is quite noticeable. I had an ok meal of scampi along with the burrata salad as well as Apple tort and decaf coffee tonight. It was OK. Tonight was Valentine's Day and the place was packed with people waiting for their tables. It's ok
author: Kevin F.

description:
Ever since the Manor Coffee Shop fancied itself up into The Manor, Jamie W. and I have been hard pressed to find an alternative, just a place for good, old-school eats, but sure enough, there is a place just down the street that fits our requirements and with an Italian accent. We've passed by this ristorante in the past without giving it a thought, but the thought of a plate of pasta sounded just right for Sunday supper. Fortunately it wasn't very crowded at about 7:30PM, and we got a table right away surrounded by bottles of wine on their dining room divider (photo: http://bit.ly/2gA2x5s). The menu was chock full of items that sounded like comfort food for paisans like us. OK, we're not real paisans, but you know what I mean.

We were first handed quite a bread plate with huge slices of rustic goodness accompanied by a creamy tomato sauce (photo: http://bit.ly/2gc49z7). We tried to control ourselves for the carbs to come but to little avail. The Bruschetta seemed a tad pricey at $9.50, but we understood why the moment it arrived. The toasted and buttered garlic bread slices were as big as rice paddles and topped with Kalamata olives. Two were piled high with fresh tomatoes and basil in the traditional way, and the other two were spread with pesto and piled high with sliced mushrooms marinated in olive oil (photo: http://bit.ly/2gtSJcx). Really delicious, especially the unexpected mushroom bruschetta, and their abundance made us second-guess our soon-to-arrive entrees.

Jamie went for a pizza as is his natural want, and it was the $16.95 Pizza Capriciossa topped with prosciutto, artichoke, mushrooms, mozzarella, and just a smidgen of tomato sauce (photo: http://bit.ly/2fiBSYd). All the ingredients were tasty, and the crust was not too bready. However, a bigger ladle of tomato sauce would have been welcome to lubricate the gullet as it went down. I was in a seafood mood, so I ordered the $16.95 Spaghetti Alla Vongole, a heaping plate of thick spaghetti pasta with fresh clams, garlic, white wine, chili pepper flakes, all of it in a light tomato sauce (photo: http://bit.ly/2fJsXzW). It was frankly just what I wanted even if it wasn't a culinary masterpiece. Neither of us could finish our entrees, so we had enough for our respective lunches at work the following day. These paisans will return soon. Yeah, I'm talking about me and Jamie.

FOOD - 4 stars...old-school Italian, well executed and certainly plenty of it...just more sauce on the pizza, please
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...nothing remarkable and a tad squeezed when it crowds up like on Saturdays
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...pretty reasonable though not overly friendly here
TOTAL - 4 stars...now we gotta place to eat like paisans...mangia!
author: Ed U.

description: Found this place on yelp. The staff was lovely, the food was so authentic and delicious, and the wine pours were great. We were seated and served quickly. Everyone was attentive and we were out in time for our movie.
author: Emily V.

description:
Great bruschetta!
The location is terrible for parking and it's usually a pretty tight cramped experience I highly recommend if you do decide to eat from this restaurant you do it with takeout. 
Or you could choose a time to go that they're not so busy and maybe take an Uber to get there
author: Kitty G.

description:
Ok. New waitress - she tried hard but suggest another career. 
Salad sub par. Chicken Marsala was worthy.
author: K H.

description:
Do not go to Olive Garden. 

Say it - "I will not go to Olive Garden" 

Ok - chains serve a purpose. I understand that because I live it. However, Panda Express isn't Chinese Food and Olive Garden - well...

Pasta from mom and pop restaurants are better quality while remaining the most affordable items on the menu. 

The pasta here? Get it. Save up your carb day calories, weight watcher points, and cheat day meals for the pasta here!

Al dente, perfectly salted (because it's boiled in salted water the way it's supposed to be) and dressed in delicious well balanced sauces. 

I have had so many dishes here from pastas to chicken, seafood, and even breakfast! 

The prices are reasonable, the wine list is good, the desserts make my sweet teeth happy, the service is attentive and friendly...yes, this is an easy choice for me to return again and again. 

Do not go to Olive Garden. Come here. Order the pasta. Taste the difference. 

Support your local small businesses. 

Your wallet, waistline, and community will be the better for it!
author: Jennifer C P.

description: Me and my girls went out to dinner this Friday night and the food here was incredible. I ordered the spaghetti portofino, which had spaghetti with scallops, prawns, and a white wine sauce. The waitress (Michelle) was also very nice and the experience was splendid!
author: Kelly I.

description: This was an amazing find out in West Portal. The service was amazing, I'm pretty sure the owner was the one taking our orders and serving us. We didn't wait too long for a table, even on a Saturday night as the amazing staff works with such efficiency and diligence. Had the bruschetta (pictured) and spaghetti bolognese, very delicious and full of flavor. Will be coming back with a larger group to feast and try different options and the extensive wine list. Can't wait to come back!
author: Edward A.

description:
The service is good and they pour a generous glass of wine. I loved the $9 house Pinot.

The $10.95 Insalata Di Spinaci with green apples, onion and a pancetta pine nut dressing was light not over filling. The $7.50 Minestrone Bowl with fresh grated cheese was wonderful and not overly salty.

At $27.95 the Palombo d' Alaska - Sautéed Halibut with capers in a light lemon sauce was delicious and flakey. An assortment of veggies, roasted potatoes and some very sweet cherry tomatoes made this dish!
 
At $15.95 the 12-inch pizza wasn't really for me but might be just right for you. To me it was not really a "thin" crust, and it was quite doughy and soggy.  It had a decent amount of pepperoni and a lot of cheese.

At $7.50 the Tiramisu was fluffy and layered with a cake center as one would expect, very, very nice...thank Lupita you were just great.
author: Caesar A.

description: Food was good, waitress was very nice, prices were decent. Overall I'd have to say though that it looks better in the pictures.
author: Will T.

description: I made a reservation several days prior to our visit for my fiancées birthday. When we arrived, we were seated quickly. but it was as if we were seated at a 4 person table that was separated by 6 inches to make it 2-2 person tables. We felt like we were seated in the middle of the aisle. We were ducking servers and bumped into constantly. It was very difficult to have a conversation, partly because we were seated so close to the next table and we were right next to the kitchen. The food was great and our server was great, but I feel like if you make a reservation and you let them know that it's a special occasion, you should at least get a table where you can talk to each other.
author: Amy B.

description:
SPIAZZZOOOOO. OH OH OH YOU ARE SO GOOD. Affordable dishes, casual atmosphere, great and fast service, Spiazzo is a perfect dinner spot. 

If you like seafood, their seafood pastas are one of the best and do not skimp on the seafood. From past experience, their four best seafood pastas are: 

+Penne al Salmone - the salmon is just so flavorful this is a must get. 
+Spaghetti Al Vongole - not as flavorful as the other pastas but lots of clams.
+Spaghetti Portofino - buttery texture with a tasty white wine sauce. The scallops are a great touch. 
+Fettucini Gamborini - MY FAVORITE DISH. Very underrated but the noodles packed so much tomato and garlic flavor! Highly suggest getting this. 

End your meal with their Tiramisu. Probably one of the moist and soaked tiramisus I have had. You must not leave without trying this! Overall, the servers were very nice and fast about service. Definitely a great spot for a casual dinner!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description:
I tried to push our online reservation by 30-minutes a few hours before, but the restaurant appeared to be booked solid.  When we arrived, at 5:30, there were only four other people in the restaurant...?  Many more people arrived while we were eating, but the room remained quiet (which I appreciate as someone who enjoys conversing during a meal).  Service was excellent.  Our waitress spilled my husband's dish on the floor and herself, but...shit happens.  It certainly didn't impact our experience there.  

The food *looks* promising, but it doesn't taste great.  The menu offerings are pretty standard fare, and nothing we ordered (Caesar salad, pumpkin ravioli, clams in red sauce, spinach) would inspire us to return to this place.  It's all sort of muddy.

And, for ageists like Candice H., you might have to sit next to....gasp...someone over 30, so prepare yourself for that horror.
author: Kris L.

description: My husband and I have been eating at Spiazzo since we moved to San Francisco in the mid 1990s. It is a nice convenient location when you get off the MUNI train at West Portal Station. I love the risotto, tortellini soup, angel hair pasta and the margarita pizza. Now that we live in the East Bay, we still go to Spiazzo and bring our kids along a couple of times a year. They love it too. The owners are very nice and the food and service is always good. I highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Purlie C.

description: We came here after a long day of driving down the coast only looking for a quick bite - we were truly impressed by both the quality of the food, and even moreso, the exceptional service! Very warm, attentive and inviting staff left an impression on us, particularly Lupita (according to our check). Thank you for such a good end to a long day!
author: Jessica F.

description:
This is a review about service, not the food. 

I made reservations to eat here Valentine's Day at 8pm, and called to confirm the reservation around 730. When I arrived the hostess told me there would be a one hour wait, because the restaurant "messed up their reservation system." 

Needless to say this was quite the disappointment on Valentines Day of all days. No apology, no real explanation...granted the hostess was dealing with many upset couples who had all made reservations. 

Might be best to stay away from this restaurant on busy nights.
author: Ronak S.

description:
A group of us had come here to celebrate a friend's birthday recently and although I'm very familiar with the West Portal Avenue neighborhood, I can't recall coming here before. The wait on this Saturday evening wasn't bad because we had reservations however there were several groups waiting on the curb in front of the restaurant. Once seated, I could see that the restaurant(roughly medium sized) had every table filled with customers enjoying themselves. It's a festive, fun atmosphere here.

We decided to order a bunch of appetizers to share and then each order an entree. Out of all the apps, I really only enjoyed the Calamari and Burrata. Both I could eat by myself. The calamari had a nice black pepper kick and the Burrata was creamy and fresh. For my entree, I went with the Spaghetti All Vongole(spaghetti with fresh clams, garlic, white wine, in a red tomato sauce). I thought my dish decent however not extraordinary. The tomato sauce was a little on the sweet side for me and could have been fresher. The clams were plumb and fresh enough. We then ordered a bunch of desserts to share(Tiramisu, creme brûlée, Zanze's cheese cake, chocolate mousse cake). Out of these, I especially enjoyed the Tiamisu. The lady fingers weren't too mushy and overall it was light and not too sweet. I would definitely order the tiramasu again.

Our waitress provided good service throughout our long dinner and she was nice and sweet. Overall, I enjoyed the experience.
author: Angela L.

description: Great staff. Very well attended and gracious when we mentioned having tickets to the movies. Food was well prepared and portioned. The ravioli with walnut sauce and the gnocchi were top notch. I had the venison ragout and sampled the seafood risotto. Which both hit high marks. The fried calamari was fresh hot and not "fishy". Overall well worth checking out again and working my way through the menu
author: Frank S.

description: We don't live in town but came to sf to eat for Valentine's Day and it was amazing. It was packed in there but they got everyone seated in a timely manner. Food came out so fast. Seafood Taste so fresh. The only reason I give it a 4 stars cuz it was super small and everyone who was waiting was standing around awkwardly.. but fast service forsure . We all definitely be back. Ps please make a bigger restaurant
author: C R.

description: We wanted to try a new Italian restaurant and we loved this place!!! The food was AMAZING! And best of all the service was spectacular! They were super fast and super nice. Hard working people that make sure their customers are more than satisfied with their meals and experience as soon as they sit down. This was on a busy night! Thank you so much Spiazzo Family.
author: Cheh S.

description: I've tried most pasta dishes here but there really isn't much to remember or write home about. The saucing is bland, and the pasta tends towards the limp side. The cooking tastes like the semi-fancy trattoria fare of the Main Streets of Anywhere USA. It's fine! but I think 4 stars is a misrepresentation.
author: Ken H.

description:
This is a charming, clean and welcoming restaurant in West Portal.  Service was genuine and very, very good. We were immediately brought the most delicious breads (two kinds) and a tomato/red pepper sauce for dipping.
 I so wanted to love the food because I pictured myself coming back regularly as soon as we were seated. 

Starters:
1. Brodetto Di Vongole, sauteed clams with garlic, white wine and a touch of red pepper flakes served with garlic crostini $11.95   
The broth was not good.  It completely filled the bowl and was tasteless--sorry to write this.
2. Eggplant Parmigiana (Special that night) $11.95  
This was ok.  The eggplant was thinly sliced and covered in a nice tomato sauce.  I was expecting it to be breaded and fried first but, - it wasn't.  I prefer the fried version.

Mains:
1. Pollo Imperatore, Free range/no antibiotic chicken breast stuffed with mozzarella, prosciutto and spinach in a marsala sauce with mushrooms $20.95  
Not good at all.  The chicken was so dry that it fell apart with just a fork.  It was confusingly tasteless too.  How could this be with prosciutto, mozzarella, spinach, mushrooms etc??  
2. Peperoni Ripieno (Stuffed Pepper-Special that night)$ 22.95
This large red pepper was densely stuffed with ground sausage and chicken and covered in a spicy sauce.  I asked for Angel Hair pasta instead of the risotto that it usually comes with.  It presented well but, again the flavors were off--you could only really taste the spiciness.  

We didn't finish any of the dishes.  I am hoping that we just ordered the wrong things.  Their menu is extensive and there are also quite a few wood-fired pizza options.
I will definitely give this restaurant another try.
author: Thomas D.

description:
Excellent experience!! Service was STELLAR, our server, Michelle was knowledgable with the menu & her wine  recommendations! 
The menu was a little overwhelming, we had lots of questions & with a few recommendations from our server and other patrons sitting next to us we had an amazing dinner. a personal favorite was a pasta dish with pesto sauce on the regular menu, our server suggested that we add  sausage &  the lamb shank on the Specials was delicious. Portions are very generous, pricing is more than fair. we will definitely be back VERY SOON!
author: Madeleine St. Claire K.

description:
This place doesn't do it for me, frankly. The portions are large, but I'd rather substitute half that food for quality. We were a large group, so we ordered a variety of dishes and desserts. The finesse is just not there, and I'm talking beyond presentation, which clearly isn't a focus. Not a single dish brought out flavors for me. The risotto, where I substituted clams for scallops, was perhaps the most disappointing, as the rice was mushy and the scallops rubbery. For near $30 a plate, while I don't expect my mouth to sing, I at least want, say, a hum. 

Our attendant was okay, but he really didn't do anything besides take the orders and pop and pour the wine. Like the food, he lacked life. Just blah. 

The wine display in the center is awkward. And, actually, the overall ambiance is bleak and gloomy.
author: Paulina F.

description: Best ravioli in town. Couldn't beat that. I enjoyed every bite. Absolutely amazing quality will definitely be back again.
author: Alexander K.

description: Great little trip to Italy in West Portal, a great walking neighborhood.  The food is consistently outstanding, hot (not from a microwave), plentiful, and generous in flavor.  Definitely worth ordering, calamari antipasti, either risotto, and any pasta and seafood dish. The house made tiramisu is sinfully delicious. Great wine list too.  Owners, host/manager and wait staff are terrific. Been there many times and never a bad meal!
author: Erica C.

description: Very delicious food ! Came with our family for the first time , service and food is excellent . Will def be coming back
author: Gret C.

description:
Came here after a team retreat since it was one of the few places that could accommodate a party of 12 for dinner when I looked for available online reservations that same day. And for that I already love them!

Here's why I love them even more:
1. The dipping sauce/spread that comes with the complimentary bread is tomato-ey goodness with a kick! And you can keep asking for more!
2. The pork medallions we ordered were perfectly tender and went well with the creamy porcini mushroom glaze. The side of mashed potatoes seemed to also be mashed with carrots, and it was also a hit!
3. We also ordered the gnocchi per yelpers' recommendations and they did not disappoint. Fluffy and bathed in a delicious tomato sauce.

Portions were pretty hefty for an italian place and prices were also very reasonable. I'd definitely come here again to try more of their extensive menu!
author: Derick N.

description: Just ok. Service and wine selection needs a lot of help. The way the busser and server reach over you is UNREAL. I seriously thought it was a sick joke by the end of the dinner. I guess they have never heard of serving to the left and clearing from the right. I will not be going back.
author: Nicole S.

description: Four of us had dinner here last night--three of us had been here before, and the fourth was trying it for the first time.  Our waitress was super-patient with the newbie who had many questions, and we all had a delicious meal and experience! The busboy was attentive, too, and the owner even came over to take our picture for us! If you like authentic, fresh, Italian food ( with cheese actually grated on top!), make a reservation, and try Spiazzo's! We got there at 5 and it was packed when we left at 7 (on a Monday night, no less)!
author: Heather H.

description: Amazing food!!!! Fresh! Homemade! Delicious! Wonderful service and comfortable ambiance. I highly recommend this great Italian restaurant!
author: Janene F.

description:
Wonderful filet mignon. Cooked perfectly with a delicious mushroom sauce so tasty.  The shrimp scallop spaghetti in garlic white wine also leads of flavor.
Great that food here is not over salted.
Only bad is the sliced bread.. dry, crumbly but came with decent dipping sauce. Better bread would have been a perfect meal.

Servers were pleasant and attentive, even those who weren't our server. 

Nice that it's a very friend atmosphere.  Will be back. .. hmmm.. can I bring my own French bread?  :)
author: Nan W.

description: Expensive , Crowded And LOUD . Not The Place To Go For Intimate Conversation. Pasta Was Ok , The Best Thing Was The Warm Bread . And Roasted Pepper Dipping Sauce ...The Margarita Pizza Was Deliciousness Overload! However The Carprese Salad & Minestrone Soup Were Quite Less Than Satisfactorily Presented ...
author: Gregory P.

description: Came here today for lunch with two friends and two toddlers. Parking is plentiful at this time. The service is great. I felt bad the kids made a mess which we tried to clean the best we can (we did do a bit over 20% tip for the mess... We have been in the food business so We understand). My friend also keep asking the poor waiter for things one at a time instead of asking all at once lol, the waiter was still very nice and accommodating especially for kids. Yes chef Mai you are picky saucy person lol, glade you enjoyed it here. The food is really good. The penne with salmon and risotto was my favorite. I definitely recommend this place. I would like to come here for dinner without kids and enjoy a bottle or two of wine.
author: Christy V.

description: I ordered the pizza margherita and it was delicious. Although I wish the basil was spread out more. I also ordered the Ravioli Natural, it was yummy. They also give unlimited bread with this tasty sauce!
author: Kristi A.

description: Amazing. I forget the name but its on the speciality paper. Its a pumpkin ravioli its to die for! Got the pot de creme. Its pretty good, kind of chalky but delicious.
author: JeSsica H.

description:
I love this place because of the worker. He is so sweet and funny.

About the taste, though, I think this place is just an okay place not an amazingly great place. It's not bad. 
And inside of the restaurant, it was slightly cold. It might be because I was at a table right beside the window.
author: Katie T.

description:
Class, service,fantastic food and more. This was a wonderful experience.
Originally we had made reservations for four in a booth. Ended up only two of us and they still gave us a large beautiful booth. 
My dear friend was parking but they sat me immediately. 
Waitress came by to introduce herself to me and let me know they can adjust the menu to anything we like. 
Waters delivered, bread two kinds homemade white and wheat came.
Friend came and this was her pick and she said everything is excellent and whatever I order I will love. She was not kidding,
I ordered salmon in light pink sauce with fresh peas over penne, wow, fabulous., she had cannelloni with fresh ricotta. 
We both had ice tea and just took are time and enjoyed. 
We were not having the full dinner or ordering wine or desert, but treated as we did...I felt cared for and pampered start to finish without being overbearing. 
If you are ever in the area of west portal...stop by and enjoy. I sure did.
author: Ann L.

description: I love the Risotto Alla Lucana along with the warm service that we always receive here. Give it a try!
author: Tim F.

description:
Spiazzo Ristorante is a great example of a cozy Italian restaurant. Nestled almost immediately outside of the West Portal MUNI light rail station, Spiazzo is a combination of great food, service and ambience.

I had recently been here for my birthday, and my parents, who can be very picky about food, really enjoyed their choices (well, my choices based on what I know about them). The star of the show was the dipping sauce for the deep-fried calamari, a spicy tomato dip. For me, I am not a huge seafood fan, so I ordered the ravioli con pesto e pollo. Amazing dish. Well balanced meal - spinach and mushroom with the ravioli were perfect.

I would say the general sense is good balance. As the sun was setting, one of the staff gently lowered the shades very carefully at the windows. 

Our waiter was very polite, and even knew that I was about to order the scampi e capesante. Just a great experience and highly recommend it!
author: Michael C.

description:
Came here to try an Italian restaurant, and the reviews are on Yelp were stellar. Wasn't very crowded on a Monday night, and we were excited to see the menu.

Our first waitress wasn't the most excited person in the world, so I was a little leery about the great customer service, but the second one was really great in helping us out. Her recommendations were the Chicken Parmesan (on the specials), the Mushroom Chicken (on the menu), and later the Tiramisu. We decided to get everything she recommended, and everything was pretty good!

They brought out starter bread which was alright, but the red cream tomato dipping sauce was very tasty! We also got a Portobello Mushroom Salad which was pretty good.

The Chicken Parmesan came with really crispy potatoes, and the chicken itself was cooked well. The cheese was really good on top, and overall a solid choice.

For dessert, we got the Tiramisu and the Chocolate Pot de Creme (something like that) - the tiramisu was light and delicate, though our table thought there was a bit too much cream. Probably more personal preference though. The Pot de Creme was really tasty - a chocolate ganache and a must for chocolate-lovers :)

Overall, a great meal and a great experience!
author: Greg G.

description:
3.5 stars.

Bread was great. Got meatball and spinach sides, and both were good.

But spaghetti Bolognese was just average.
author: Jenny B.

description: If I can give this place a zero star I would! First off, the food did not impressed me and the price is expensive for Italian food. The customer service was great, but the quality of food was poor. First and last of trying out this restaurant. Go to Tratorria instead, price was okay but preparation of food is quality.
author: Sib K.

description: The food is mediocre, and given that the entrees cost $20-30, it's really poor value for money. And they tried to sneak in extra charges onto the bill. Not cool.
author: M T.

description: I ate here with my boyfriend for dinner, it was so good. It was really empty when we went but that's fine. I loved the atmoshpere and I felt comfortable. My boyfriend is half Italian, so what he wanted wasn't something he could easily get at home. Instead, he got the lamb racks. He loved it. While I got the lobster and scallop pasta. Honestly, I could of used more scallops but it was good overall. I enjoyed the place. Definitely a place to come again.
author: Ann N.

description:
We had dinner here and were pleasantly surprised.
My partner had the angel hair pasta with shrimp and scallop while I had the fettuccine with pesto sauce. We also had bruschetta as an appetizer.
Everything was wonderful and we finished everything.
This ristorante is worth visiting again
author: Philip C.

description:
I had omelette with salmon and potatoes and it was very good. I mean, it's a very basic egg filled with salmon and all that good stuff inside. I wasn't disappointed. The only small downfall was they use a lot of oil to fry the egg. I could literally see oil dripping from the egg.. idk if they added extra olive oil but I didn't like that very much.
 
My friend got the vegetable egg pancake (I'm pretty sure it has another name but I dont remember lol) and she also got a tomato soup. She said the soup was very good. Veggie pancake was alright..

Overall, I had a good time in here and the waiter was very kind and making sure everything was ok.

I'd def come here again (:
author: Kathy D.

description:
This food is literally haunting my dreams. On a day trip to the city, this was our last stop before hitting the road. My dad wanted a place that served seafood, and I needed a place with gluten free options. Yelp reviews did not disappoint. Our friendly waitress was able to pair a wonderful red wine for my dad's pasta/seafood dish. 
I ordered the roasted duck and mushroom risotto; and now can die happy. This was my first time eating duck, and was not disappointed. More so though, the star of the dish was the mushroom risotto. Creamy, mouthwatering and haunts my dreams! It even managed to travel well back to Fresno, where my leftovers are taunting my boyfriend. Definitely will be returning, and possibly making a special trip just for the risotto!
author: Alexis H.

description: The food at Spiazzo has been delicious every time we ate there as well as when we get their food delivered through Amazon. Today we ordered through Amazon and their delivery driver was really late. Giuseppe called me and said he would personally deliver the food to my house...how sweet is he?! And can customer service get any better? Luckily the Amazon driver showed up just as he was about to deliver it. Thank you so much! And the food was great!
author: Angela F.

description: Seated right before the dinner rush on wed. Food came out a bit slow compared to other tables that ordered after us, but otherwise food was great and so was the service!
author: Jj W.

description:
Took my mom here for saturday night dinner. If you come at 6, you can probably snag a seat. I actually did an opentable reservation and it wasn't hard to book. It's not a big restaurant and so it gets quite busy one you hit 630-7. 
Mom and I split the gorgonzola pear salad. It was pretty good. We had asked them if we could share a salad and we were charged an extra dollar for splitting. FYI
I got the lamb paparadelle. It was good. The lamb meat is tender and soft. The sauce is definitely flavorful.
My mom got the portofino pasta. It comes with scallops and shrimps. The scallops were cooked perfectly and were not chewy. 
The portions are definitely huge so you leave full. However, the pasta was not as al dente as I would like it to be. But still good pasta!
Mom and I fell in love with their tomatoe sauce that comes with the bread at the beginning of the meal. She even took some home.
author: Jessica H.

description: Service was fast and we were able to get a table as a walk-in. The food was a disappointment though. We had the fried calamari as an appetizer and it tasted bland. The sauce had hardly any flavor. Tasted like a bowl full of olive oil and blended tomatoes. Then I got the pesto pasta and it swung the other way and was completely over salted. Really wanted to like this place but probably will not return.
author: SFA M.

description:
We had my husbands BD there about 18 people and were very pleased with the service as well as the food. Their duck and lamb chops are amazing. All entrees were great because everyone ordered different, but these two were absolutely perfect. I would only comment on the carpaccio which was surprisingly thick and sort of chewy, i wouldnt order it again, but everything else was fantastic. Great ambiance. Planning to go there again this week with family.
Enjoy
author: LOVEMYKIDS L.

description: Great food, great service. Had the spaghetti with prawns and scallops. Excellent sauce. Comfortable dining environment, we were never rushed.
author: Jorg R.

description:
Great Italian place with authentic tastes and good wine pairings.
Can be busy at peak times so call ahead to check on open seating.
author: R L.

description: Amazing Italian food! I was visiting the area and decided to stop in for a bite. Wow! Couldn't of been more satisfied. I ordered the lasagna, as well as appetizers! Great food for a great price!
author: Jen W.

description:
We have been here so many times. It is our favorite place to eat in the city. I have tried their Bruschetta, Calamari, Ravioli Pesto e Pollo, Pollo Imperatore, and their Eggplant Parmigiana and none have ever disappointed. The desserts are also a must every time. The creme brulee is among the best I've ever had. 

The wait can be long and the dining room can be crowded, but it is well worth it. All authentic, all delicious.
author: Anna P.

description: What a cool little restaurant in West Portal. You'd think the location alone would be enough to draw regular customers, but then they make great food with excellent service...you've got a packed restaurant with people standing around in the small lobby waiting for a table. Our server was really nice and attentive. I ordered the spaghetti portofino, but substituted spaghetti with capellini ($17.95). There was a dinner special with jumbo prawns and scallop, but the price jumps up to $24.95.  Got my dish piping hot, and the Angel hair was cooked perfectly al dente. Nice firm bite. Generous amount of shrimps and scallops too. The ambiance is nice, a little dark, but cozy. A good date place. I'd definitely come back.  Oh, make reservations!
author: Barnaby W.

description:
Always passed by, finally got to try it for the first time a while ago! Their lunch specials menu is affordable. If you eat their warm bread with their roasted tomato dipping sauce (which is delicious, by the way), you would have enough to bring home too. I really like their portobello mushroom panini and the sauce on their fettuccine on their lunch specials menu.

Since then, I've been there a few times for lunch and also have gotten take-out from them. Even if you get take-out, they give you some bread and their dipping sauce with your order.

Service is great, servers are attentive and nice. Atmosphere is great, clean and quiet.
author: Courtney S.

description: Tasty food, good service. Consistent restaurant that has all the traditional Italian favorites.
author: Michelle R.

description:
Very good food and excellent service accompanied by a annoying party adjacent to us.  We arrived on Sunday about 1730 hours and were seated at a cozy spot for 2 in the corner of the restaurant by the front window.  The bench seats were comfortable and the restaurant was clean.  However, it was chilly seated there and the hostess was wearing a jacket and scarf.  Our server was a charming young lady who seemed genuinely appreciative of our business.  Some bread was brought over and we were just a bit disappointed.  I was expecting some quality french bread with butter or olive oil.  We were given some slices of soft brown and white breads with a tomato like spread.  It wasn't that bad, just unexpected.

We shared a crisp Cesar salad ($8+$1 for splitting). Afterwards we had a petrale sole (~$25) and a scallops and shrimp mixed with capellini noodles (~$29).  These entrees were ordered off the special dinner insert.  The house chardonnay was $9 per glass. Both entrees were excellent in presentation and taste.  Afterwards we split a scrumptious chocolate mousse cake (~$8).

So why are we giving it just 4 stars instead of 5.  Well a party of 3 women, two men, one toddler, and one baby was seated next to us.  The mother brought a couple of huge diaper bags and laid them on the bench seat essentially pinning us in.  The adults were loud and the toddler was playing with a smartphone and kept throwing it on the floor.  At one point, he nearly tip their table over and spilled water.  These people certainly know how to ruin the dining enjoyment of others with their self-centered behavior.  I think if this were to reoccur when we are dining there, we would ask to be relocated to another part of the restaurant.
author: Robert J.

description:
A long standing local restaurant with a menu full of options.
The beets in the salad are substantial in size. Standard menu items are reasonable with the dinner special menu on the high end.
Service was friendly and efficient.
The appetizer courtesy bread is a sizable portion so don't eat too much.
Dinner portions are hearty and generous.
Prawns and scallops cooked perfectly. Clams are not the tiny variety but medium and full bodied.
Sauces are light and Pasta of good texture and substance.
Love the bits of sliced garlic throughout the dishes to give a nice zing to the meal.
Definitely a place to eat. Buon Appetito!
author: David H.

description: I really enjoyed my dinner tonight! The service easily earned 5 stars from the great hospitality to the delicious food. Our server, Michelle was so friendly and knowledgeable of the menu, she made our experience very pleasant. We were too excited to eat our food that we didn't get any pictures but we will for sure come back!
author: Ashley W.

description: My boyfriend and I decided to have an early dinner here yesterday. When we arrived there was a fair amount of people already dining. We ordered the clams as an appetizer - good if you love seafood like me, but mediocre if you're like my boyfriend who needs more substance. To put it simply, it was literally clams in broth. 2 stars for the lasagna my boyfriend ordered, it was delicious. However, the ravioli con pesto e pollo I ordered (which many others seem to have loved) was extremely salty. It's saving grace was the spinach. Now that I'm writing this review I realized not only was my dish extremely salty, I didn't get a bite of chicken. Unless the chicken was finely ground into a powder, I'm fairly sure they forgot to add it. I may come back to try another dish. Their complimentary bread and tomato dip was very good. Our waitress boxed my entree and the leftover bread together sans dip :( I suppose I could use the bread to dip in the salty ravioli sauce.
author: Kimmie N.

description: I came here on a whim with family members and I thoroughly enjoyed it. I felt that you got what you paid for; my portion was a huge amount that was almost too much but it was delicious. I feel like this place is underrated and I would highly recommend it!
author: Liv T.

description: This is our second kitchen.  We love the hosts and workers who all have come to know us, the food and wine is steller, and food quality is consistently great.  The noise level is good when we eat earlier, and later when it is really busy it is still ok, and I am hard of hearing so I do not like noisy restaurants.  Great Place!!
author: Michael G.

description: We have been eating here for many years. We just purchased 80.00 worth of food; spaghetti, meat balls, lasagna, two orders of garlic bread. We got the food delivered via Door Dash! We could not eat any of it. The meat balls had a horrible after taste, the spaghetti was dry and uncooked, the lasagna was all cheese, no meat. We threw the entire 80.00 order in the trash. Something has change and not for the good!
author: Kathleen T.

description: The service was somewhat slow, I only tried the margarita pizza and the crust was good but other than that pretty basic.
author: Amanda P.

description:
I eat at this restaurant at least 2 times a month, sometimes more.
The food is Excellent and always Consistent.

The Service is Superb and Efficient, every wait person I have had knows the
Menu and can explain each and every item into detail.

It is one of the most efficient places I dine, and if you don't make reservations they
will try and get you seated, but reservations are best, because you might have to
stand in line. The best thing is to get there around 5 PM.
author: Jerry W.

description: I have been here a few times and enjoyed it both times.  The raviolis and pizzas are especially good.  I would recommend it.  You may not need reservations if you go early, but it's fairly cozy so if you are going later on (7 or so) then reservations may be a good idea.  They are on open table.  I'm sure we will be back.  The pizzas are big enough for 2 kids for sure.
author: Kirsten B.

description:
We ordered dinner takeout from Spiazzo and it was just we needed being jet lagged from an early morning flight from the east coast! The restaurant had our food ready in a prompt manner. Good portions, great food, and fantastic gluten free options for my friend. 

Note: if you are ordering gluten-free, the lasagna is not able to be made as such. I think it's an error on yelp's end and the restaurant was very responsive and called us to let us know right away with substitution options. 

Highly recommend this restaurant and this neighborhood!
author: Ellen J.

description: Really liked this place. The only ding is that tables are shoehorned together so you will be an active participant in conversations around you. The food was magnificent and the service was friendly. We'll absolutely be back.
author: Brian B.

description:
I've been looking for an Italian restaurant for a long period of time. It's been quite hard looking for a place which mimicked the Italian restaurants of my younger days. Foods used to taste so fresh, flavorful and made with quality ingredients. NOW....I've found it! This place has wonderful and delicious food! The pastas are made in house and the flavors Mmmmmm. I ordered the tortellini and asked it be prepared with alfredo sauce (my fave dish of all time) and of course lots of fresh grated Parmesan cheese. The pasta was fresh, soft and exactly the way pasta should taste and feel in your mouth. The ingredients inside the tortellini was delicious and wholesome. The alfredo sauce was thick and creamy. I ate my dish so slow to savor the flavors in my mouth. I will definitely patronize this establishment as my go to Italian restaurant from now on!  
My friends ordered the 1. gnocchi in red sauce and also so very delicious and the gnocchi so fresh! 2. Steak with veggies and also so very delicious and cooked right! They really enjoyed their meals.
The service was great as well. Our waitress was awesome and very attentive. 
Thank you Spiazzo for a wonderful dining experience! See you soon!
author: Jennifer C.

description: Our favorite neighborhood Italian spot for years. Spiazzo never fails to please with its varied menu and superb food. We feel like family at every visit.
author: Ami G.

description: Was so in the mood for Bolognese and it was just ok.  Lots of pasta and just little bolognese. Bread was weird definitely not Italian style.  Service was ok.  Nothing to write home about and probably wouldn't go back when there are so many choices in the area.
author: jennifer m.

description: Really bad atmosphere and service. The waitress did not understand English I think! Won't come here again ever!
author: Hanrui S.

description: I. AM. ABSOLUTELY. IN. LOVE. This is my new favorite place ever now! I am coming here any excuse I can. Every holiday, birthday, anniversary, and special occasion. Their food was fantastic, the service; phenomenal. Everything was perfect to the last detail. The deserts were incredible (gelato flown in from Italy). The staff were well educated and efficient and warm and inviting. Everything was perfection. I am obsessed!
author: Niña E.

description:
Came here to celebrate my niece's bday.  It's a small, neighborhood joint that serves decent sized portions of food.  It was a Friday night and there was a line of people waiting to get in.  Being small and most likely family owned, the kitchen was having a very difficult time getting the main entrees out in a timely manner.  They ran out of one of the items we had ordered and only informed us when most of the dishes were brought to the table.  Another guest didn't receive her meal until 15 or so minutes after most of us received our meals.  Another guest of our table did not receive her side order of grilled chicken breast until we were pretty much done with our meals.  Perhaps the kitchen needs to be beefed up during the demanding times (ie weekend dinners, etc.) or they need to reduce the number of guests they can serve at any one time.

So, why the 3 not 2 stars?  Our server, of course!  Michelle tried her very best to accommodate us through the tough time.  It all started out well, though.  She took our drink orders, got the bread with their delicious tomato based dip served, took the appetizer order, got the appetizers delivered quickly, gave decent suggestions, and was attentive to all of our needs.  You could tell, she was getting pulled from all directions but that did not deter her from keeping her cool or smile!

Food wise, everything was good and traditional.  They even made a custom dish for the wifey (fettuccine alfredo with prosciutto and peas).  Though everyone was happy with their respective meals, I was a bit disappointed.  The sauce served with the Duck special of the day was overly sweet.  That, combined with the richness of the duck made it difficult to really enjoyed.  I ate about half the meal and took the rest home.  The next day, I looked at the leftover and decided to throw it away.  I would have preferred a tart sauce to balance out the richness of the duck.  I remember when Il Fornaio offered a duck with a tart sauce that I really enjoyed.  We capped off our meal with 4 different desserts (chocolate pot de creme, creme brulee, apple tort, and tiramisu).  All but the pot de creme were very good.  The pot de creme was too thick and very concentrated.  One could not eat much of it unless they wanted to go into a chocolate coma!
author: Gene D.

description: Yummy gluten free pasta with marinara sauce. Husband said the pesto is yummy. They made a aglioli with mushrooms that is really good, too. Servers are really nice and the lady in the front desk (Giselle) is very nice. If you don't have reservations, be ready to wait for 20 minutes. It's worth it!
author: R. M.

description: Neighborhood joint. I love this place. It's one of my go to Italian restaurant. I love their spaghetti portofino (spelling?). The portion is great and they're not stingy with the shrimp/clams. The service is always great. Oh and their tiramisu is delicious. This Italian restaurant always hits the spot when I'm craving Italian :) parking can be a hit or miss
author: Vickiiieee V.

description: Solid Italian food with a varied menu. Terrific service - friendly and attentive. Love the warm bread with the red pepper dip. Love the fact they have Zanze's cheesecake for dessert. Yum!
author: Fern W.

description: Came here for a birthday party. I'm giving this restaurant a one star because of the food. The waitress was great. I had a seafood pasta. The noodles were not cooked all the way and very dry. The shrimps were over cooked. Personal I had better dishes at Olive Garden..
author: Jackie B.

description: I had a lovely experience at this restaurant. I took my 75 year old mom with me after a lovely afternoon at the SF Zoo. I was hungry! I started with a salad of field greens & beets which was seasoned well. I enjoyed Chicken Piccata, one of my go-to dishes. It was delicious! But why do I really like this place?? My mom ordered calamari, and it came out a little salty for her taste, but she didn't say anything. When the maitre de (who may have been the owner; I don't know) realized she had not eaten her meal, he came over to speak to us! He said to always let him know if something is not exactly to our liking, because he wants us to leave happy. He took the calamari off the bill and was very gracious and kind to my mother. I really appreciate this kind of care and service; I live on the east coast, but my mom and brother live here in SF, and they will be returning to this restaurant because the food is tasty and fresh, and the service exceeded our expectations! Neighborhood restaurants like this deserve our patronage!
author: Gia L.

description: Came here after years of looking from afar. My friends and family just never interested. Came for lunch with my sister. We were pleasantly surprised. A young woman was both greeter and server and was very welcoming and very professional. While we reviewed the extensive menu and lunch specials sheet, she brought bread, both white and wheat ...I think homemade, but dry. My sister loved the puréed red pepper spread and told me it would make the bread less dry. I loved the spread, but the bread was still dry. My sister had the Spaghetti Portofino which was perfectly-cooked al dente pasta with huge prawns in a light cream sauce. Mmmmm. I had to take a bite of hers before taking a bite of my own Spiazzo Salad. The salad was also pretty good. Thin slices of chicken breast, sautéed mushrooms, and halved hard boiled eggs over a Caesar salad. The salad was huge and very fresh. The dressing was amazing. Creamy and lots of it. The salad would have been better with anchovies. Also, when the chicken was still warm, it was tasty. I only ate two slices because once the chicken cooled off, the dryness factor set in and became inedible. I left them on the plate. I ate all my greens because their romaine was fresh and crisp which was a perfect bite with the dressing and crunchy croutons. We will definitely be back and I plan to get the Spaghetti Portofino....and a plain Caesar salad .
author: Carrie W.

description:
I got the pappardelle with lamb. I asked for the lamb to be medium rare but they said it comes in the sauce? So that's something to pay attention to. Luckily the lamb was tender and not overlooked in the sauce. It would be nice if the dish were some pappardelle with those small lamb chops around it with the sauce on the pasta. But ! My food was good. The service was great! The only thing is we made a reservation for 6 and the call was made when there was a few of our family in the room so we heard the reservation was made but they didn't have us down! We were lucky because they could make some seats but minutes after we walked in there never would have been room because it was super packed! 
Also another reason it's a 4 is because the desserts quite frankly are not good! Stick to the dinner menu! We got a creme brûlée that was really chunky and runny which is odd for a creme brûlée. It tasted heavily like egg and thus seemed more like a flan. In this case they were lucky again because I love flan. (But I ordered a creme brûlée). All in all if you live in the neighborhood and don't want to stray far, you can come here for decent dinner food.
author: Karin U.

description:
4 girls, 2 pastas and 1 pizza http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/spiazzo-ristorante-san-francisco?select=6SOVV7QT603pRWdLiWPMvA#6SOVV7QT603pRWdLiWPMvA. Lots of food or maybe I wasn't that hungry.

Pizza Con Salsicce O Pepperoni, Mozzarella, Italian sausage or pepperoni and tomato sauce 13.95 + 3.50 since we decided to do half pepperoni and half italian sausage.

10.50 Fusili Fantasia (lunch): this was cork screw pasta with meat? not really sure but nonetheless delishh.
