13.95 Fettuccine Alla Genovese, Fettuccine with pesto sauce, wild mushrooms and cherry tomatoes: this was THE best thing we got. we didn't have any leftovers.

This place was not busy at all on a Sunday around noon. I'm glad we were seated right away. I'm not sure what dinner is like, maybe a bit more crowded. 

All the food was delish, I will definitely come back.
author: Kylie L.

description: Really enjoyed the entire meal. Ceaser salad, homemade tortellini and tiramisu. I was really craving some pasta and it was a nice place to go even by myself. Everyone was super friendly too!Looking forward to come back and trying some new things!
author: Kali S.

description:
Celebrated my friend's birthday dinner on a Sunday evening and we were a party of eight. The restaurant was quite small and probably best accommodates parties no larger than five to six people. The tortellini that I ordered was good, but it could have been better. I think I just didn't enjoy the sauce as much. We got seven out of eight plates to our table within 15-30 minutes, but my other friend's plate came to the table about 10 minutes after. 

At the end of our meal, our waitress cleared the table off and placed candles on the cheesecake we brought for our friend to sing happy birthday. 

I'm willing to try this place again and choose some different dishes!
author: Pamela G.

description:
I love that they have outdoor seating and are pretty quick to get the food to me when I'm on my lunch break.

The service is excellent and the food is decent.  Their lunch specials are written up on a chalkboard on the sidewalk and change regularly.
author: Jennifer L.

description: SUPER SUPER in a word UNBELIEVABLE SERVICE AND FOOD both outstanding!!!!!  We ordered to go and they they pack their to go orders is awesome!!!  Food did not disappoint at all,  We ordered veal saltimbocca, veal piccata, lasagne and a sausage and pepperoni pizza (suggestion here is yo offer more meat options as toppings for a better variety)   had to save some of it as leftovers and they heated up just great the following day.
author: Tim R.

description:
I really wanted to like this place. I chose this place for my husband's birthday (3/6/17 is the day we went around 5pm) based on all of the positive reviews, but unfortunately i had a very different experience than most of these reviews. I will start off with the service - it was basically rushed and dismissive. Tonight was supposed to be a special night for my husband, and service was definitely lacking. Our waitress never asked us if we needed our drinks or wine refilled. I had to try to get her attention, and was unsuccessful at doing so. I finally caught the attention of a young waitress with short, dirty blonde hair and politely asked her if she could refill my soda. She seemed very bothered by this simple request, and when I thanked her she didn't acknowledge me with a smile or a simple "sure" or "welcome ". She simply ignored me and slammed the glass on the table. After my husband and I had ordered our food, I went to the back to ask the waitress if a happy birthday dessert could be arranged, and she quickly dismissed me saying someone else will help me (right when I was talking she talked over me). The girl that helped me arrange the dessert was the same girl that refilled my drink. She could of asked my husbands name if she knew they would be singing happy birthday to him, (since when they were singing happy birthday to him they didnt know his name, and it felt very impersonal and rushed). We also didn't get any napkins when given dessert. Again,  it was impossible to flag someone down. She seemed very bothered by my request, and lacked any personality - no smile, nothing. For a restaurant with such high prices and after reading all the positive yelp reviews I seriously expected a lot more. 

Throughout my meal I constantly felt uncomfortable as the kitchen cook or whoever he is kept staring at me the whole time. Everytime I turned around he and another cook would stare. It was quite rude and extremely unprofessional.  

I also called the restaurant earlier today and asked if the birthday dessert was comped, and the guy on the phone told me they don't do such a thing, yet I just saw in another review that the owner said this is something that is frequently done. Strange...

In regards to the food, everything was oversalted, and lacked flavor. There was not one thing I enjoyed besides my sprite. The food we got wasn't even worth 1/4 the price we paid. 

I'm summation, this restaurant could of gotten 3 or 4 stars, but due to the cold service I gave it one star, and will not be back.
author: Emily G.

description: Usually get a great salmon penne dish here but very disappointing this time - hardly any salmon and really dry- no sauce at all on the dish. Expensive mistake!! Perhaps they changed the chef or cut back on product..
author: Eileen M.

description:
This is a decent pasta place. Its a little hype and overpriced but i could see the appeal. 
The starter bread and tomato sauce was poignant-my friend didnt like the smell. I tried it & it was ok
The pasta/spaghetti was ok. Mine was not cooked all the way (and i prefer al dente so im not being too biased). I liked the sundried tomato and the olive tho!
I liked our server. Then, halfway through our meal, our server, a busboy, and maybe another server started to pay "extra attention" to us like dude no im not done w my salad and yes we are still working on everything lol i kno we were laughing and having a good time but we aint drinkin and we aint sittin in a quiet restaurant either so quit trippin! They were overstaffed too..it wasnt busy at all..3 or 4 people at a time stood around at the open kitchen entrance and stared at customers while theyre eating. 

I think all the eyes made my pasta shrivel. 

I made a comment about the attentiveness as I was intrigued, and our server made a comment back that could have been sarcasm. I took it as a genuine statement and proceeded to give server a tip, regardless of their intention. When server saw the tip amount out of the corner of their eye, server was nice again. Hey if i gotta wave around a few bucks to have a fun dinner w my friends...god bless tipping in America! It should be called "bribing" makes me feel like a $baller$
author: Rose M.

description: A lover of Italian food I was very disappointed with the food.  It was mediocre to say the least for the amount of money we spent on food.  The atmosphere was enjoyable along with exceptional wait staff.
author: Dawn T.

description:
+ Food generally was good
- Very loud atmosphere. Difficult to hold a conversation. Acoustic tiles would probably help.
- Service was rushed. Dessert menus were given out while some were still eating our dinners.
author: Greg S.

description: My family and I have been coming here since I was a little kid and the food has consistently been so authentic and delicious. The owner and manager now recognize us because my family and I come here all the time! They have amazing service. We always order salads, anti pasta, pizza, pasta, seafood, lamb, and all the desserts and they never have a problem with us bringing our own bottle of wine. Spiazzo has been a staple for my family since since we've lived in San Francisco nearby for the past 20 years. Every time I'm in the area I always make it a point to stop here. Thanks for the comfort, and family and local vibes - good wine, delicious specials, and smiling faces.
author: Stephanie W.

description: From the service to the food, this place is great! Staff is very polite and friendly and the food is simply amazing- so authentic and fresh. The bread with the dipping sauce they serve in the beginning is just as good. When I'm visiting from SoCal again, I'm definitely coming back here. The gnocchi is mouth-watering, a must-try!
author: Shareen D.

description: We ordered for take out for Mother's Day. The food was delicious and on time. Only thing we didn't like was the loaf of bread they gave us. Besides that, we couldn't complain.
author: Jim C.

description:
The delicious, fresh bread and roasted pepper spread that greets you shortly after being seated was lovely. The subsequent mushy lasagne bolognese was, however, very disappointing. But perhaps worse was there wasn't an apology nor an offer to bring me something else. Insulting. My tone was polite in letting the waiter know that the pasta sheets were really mushy and it was inedible. No apology. Clearly this colored our opinion of this restaurant. Dining isn't only about the food. 
The petrale sole was pan-fried and done to perfection although the ice cream scoop potatoes on the side were not. 
We also ordered the tortellini in a cream tomato sauce that was very good; the pasta was al dente and the filling creamy and well-seasoned.
I and my family however won't be back nor will we recommend this restaurant to anyone. We are locals living in this neighborhood for over 50 years. I expected more, but when a restaurant can't be humble enough to apologize for a dish not executed well and offer something, anything, it's not a place that appreciates our business.
author: Peddie A.

description: A little place in West portal, it's a must try with a good atmosphere and friendly environment. The pizza was to die for and best of all was the service from our waiter. I cant recall her name but she was the young blonde one. She made our stay very pleasant and im definitely coming back!
author: Jocelyn T.

description: I randomly came here with my family and it was amazing. The service was excellent, great wine and one of the best prawn pasta I've ever had. I will be coming back for sure.
author: Jeni S.

description: When asking for the best Italian and seafood around Portola Ave, Spiazzos is where Yelp brought me. Not only was this restaurant a great find, but I also discovered W Portal. What a great street of shops like what you would experience in the Rockridge neighborhood in Oakland. Spiazzos had a European feel making the most out of their space. On a Tuesday night, it was busy yet we didn't have to wIt for a table. The Scampi Lido and the Spaghetti with kalamatas and spinach were great. I wish I was a regular visitor to SF because I would be here all the time.
author: Kyle S.

description: Went in today for the first time and left super impressed! My boyfriend and I agreed it was the best salmon we have had since moving to San Francisco. We both had the salmone fantasia, delicious! Will definitely be making a return visit :)
author: Rachel F.

description:
Awesome Italian! My two friends and I came here because I wanted to eat around the West Portal area and everywhere looked good but we were trying to stay around $15/person so this was our pick. We sat down and were immediately given our waters and bread very shortly after. Before I even talk about what we ordered, I'd like to give praise to their bread because it was DELICIOUS. It was obviously homemade because you don't get bread that soft and warm store bought. There was also this, I believe, sun dried tomato dip/sauce for the bread, and it complemented it so well. We all expected and wanted butter, but we killed our first serving of bread and sauce and they brought us another serving willingly (: 

So we ordered and I got the fettucine alla genovese, and my friends got the fettucine con gamberoni and penne alla campagnola. My dish, the genovese was good! It had pesto and cherry tomatoes. It should've came with some mushrooms, but I personally can't eat them so I asked for them to be excluded. I enjoyed my dish because who on earth doesn't enjoy pesto&pasta? I feel like the mushrooms would have definitely elevated the dish, but I still enjoyed mine. The penne alla campagnola was solid. Our busser told us that was his favorite when we finished, but I thought it wasn't very special. I will commend the chicken in the dish, though, because it was super juicy and tender which was surprising. Last was my friend's fettucine con gamberoni, which I dipped into QUITE a few times. I think it's tied with my genovese, but it was in a different category since it was seafood-ey. 

Looking back on the dishes, they were all really good, but no more deserving than a really solid 4 stars. Spiazzo is authentic; they make their own bread & pasta, and actually grates you cheese from a block. They have more than kind and friendly service with above average food, but not deviating far from it. I would have definitely overhyped and gave it way better accolades if I didn't reflect on it just now because we went to eat here on beyond empty stomaches, which made everything taste better. I will still stand by the bread, however, because I kept eating that after our plates were taken away. Solid 4 stars!
author: Holly P.

description: Better to get your reservation ahead like  30 minutes before your arrival time. They have one of the good custemer service and good foods.
author: Team M S.

description:
We went to the restaurant today after my daughter's show. We invited a family friend with us. Although we live quite near to this restaurant and we read on Yelp about it for many times, this is our first time to walk by and eat hear. The service is Ok. But unfortunately, the prawns in Shrimp Scampi were not fresh - at least two of them are not. We were felt so sorry that our friend felt sick on her way back home. I tried one of them myself. I am so lucky I did not have the symptoms of diarrhea, but I also felt the taste was not that fresh. 
I 'd like to believe this is an accident. And I'd like to try this restaurant later. Because other dishes we ordered tasted good. But we will sure ask for fresh shrimps in Scampi before we place the order.
author: Leon Y.

description: Feel bad writing this review - maybe it's just a first time thing? Asked the server "how are you doing?" she says "eh, okay" and she is lackluster (she was friendly enough with a couple of friends who came in). My partner had the steak - overdone despite asking for medium rare. I had the duck, which okay. Not the Best Ever. The risotto was good. For the money, I've had better, especially in West Portal which is Italian Restaurant Row.
author: Mi M.

description: Worst food ever... microwaved stuffed bell pepper ... absolutely horrible !  Waiter payed no attention to our table...Too busy talking with other employees...STAY AWAY ! One star cause I feel sorry for this joint...
author: David R.

description:
We had a very wonderful experience at Spiazzo.  We made reservations for a Saturday evening, and showed up about half an hour early.  They were still very accommodating despite having a large birthday to attend to.

Our waitress was fabulous and exemplified great customer service.  I wish I remembered her name to give her a shout out.  We ordered two fish dishes, the salmon and the sole.  The salmon wasn't to my liking, but my bf liked it (a little fishy).  The sole was great; it wasn't grilled though, it was made in a batter.  

I had a glass of the sauv blanc and my bf had a glass of the pinot noir.  The sauv blanc was on point, but the pinot noir was served really warm.  I think it should have been chilled just a bit more.  

The dessert was the chocolate pot (forgot the actual name) and it was AMAZING.  It was a mix between fudge and a pudding.  I like chocolate, not chocolate-flavored things, but this was very delicious.  

Also to note - they serve Zanze's cheesecake here!! Would have gotten that, but they were fresh out.
author: Ghizal A.

description: Real Italian food here it was so good! Willing to come back again also the service that they gave us was really nice. Not expensive then I thought it would've been.
author: Andrea C.

description:
The customer service here is the bomb.com

The waitress was extremely busy but super attentive.  Also, the hostess was uber nice as well and very accommodating. 

We came during a pretty busy time on a Friday night at 7pm but there were only two of us so we were seated in only 10 min! 

I ordered the jumbo prawns.  They came with veggies, and these orange mashed potatoes that were very yummy.  Not sure why they were orange though. heh.  The sauce on the prawns was sooooo flavorful and buttery.  The prawns themselves were juicy and amazing as well, but the sauce definitely made the dish. 

Bf ordered the seafood spaghetti dish, it left much to be desired in terms of flavor.  The sauce was super underwhelming, although the seafood was cooked fine, the dish did nothing for either of us. Would not reccomend. 

I enjoyed my time here, would totes come back.
author: Christina L.

description: Mother's Day dinner.  Place is extremely crowded and busy, so one might expect some kinks and delays in the service.  However, this is the first time I have ever had a restaurant simply substitute a dish because they ran out of what was ordered.  Now the waiter said that the cooks simply didn't fill the order when they ran out of the rack of lamb, and that he was never informed until we asked when our dishes were coming (an hour after ordering). But then instead of asking what we would like to substitute he said that the cooks would substitute filet mignon for the lamb.  Really?  Without asking whether that is acceptable?  And when the dish came, it actually looked more like flank steak, which is probably why we got charged for the flank steak dish (CA-Tagliata).  I accept the fact that everyone makes mistakes. But it's how you deal with those mistakes to paying customers that reveals the character and training of a  restaurant. These guys really fell down on the job and left a sour taste in our mouth.
author: JJ L.

description: Great for date night! The atmosphere is pleasant and the food is just right for the price. Portions are huge which is a plus and the spaghetti portofino was delicious. Only downside is the duck, since it's cooked in one piece, is rather dry but that did not put a damper on the night!
author: Jessica W.

description: The food here is exceptional, I tend to head here whenever I crave some pasta. The portions are decently sized and the pricing is average for pasta. The pasta, ravioli or anything I have ordered is always, flavorful, colorful and delicious. The only things that I dislike about this restaurant are having to ask for balsamic vinegar and oil with my bread. Most Italian restaurants serve you these things without having to ask for them. The other problem is the atrocious parking situation. If you are able to find street parking, you are quite lucky.
author: Natalie N.

description: Superb dining. I recently stopped by West Portal after going hiking with a couple of friends and boy was I hungry! I was craving some Italian food, one of my friends recommended this place, so I decided to stop by. I felt very welcomed, the hostess greeted us with a warm smile and we were shown to a table promptly. Our server was a young blonde waitress, I believe her name is Ally if I am correct and she was very well informed about the menu. She recommended  the Spaghetti Portofino, which was very fantastic and satisfied my appetite. We also were recommended wine, we bought a couple of bottles, and let's just say we left there very happily. So, case and point, if we are every back in the West Portal neighborhood Spiazzo will have to be a must.
author: Thomas B.

description: Such a friendly staff, probably the nicest in San Francisco.  This restaurant has such a homey vibe to it.  Delicious food, the lasagna is the best thing on the menu in my opinion.  I have been quiet a few times and tried many different things and have never bee disappointed, the food is always delicious.
author: Natalie D.

description:
We found our go-to Italian spot! Why? Because of Michelle - our amazing super server! I seriously have never experienced such superior service as hers. We were celebrating my mother-in-law's birthday last Saturday and had 2 kids and 1 toddler. She completely catered to them. She saw our every need before we even thought of them. She must be a mom, but boy did she make what could have been a stressful dinner a relaxing one! Michelle was wonderful the entire time - from start to finish, and constantly checked up on us to see how we were doing. Half of the family decided to do family style with the kids, and to make things easier, she brought over larger flatware to eliminate too many dishes taking over the table. Told you she's a super server!

Oh and of course, let's not forget about the food. Everything was delicious! Husband fell in love with the mushroom bruschetta. We can't wait to go back for more! 

Thanks for a wonderful dining experience, Spiazzo!
author: Ang L.

description:
Food - pretty great, especially homemade pastas
Drinks - small glasses of wine
Service - depends who you get (some are pretty good, some bad)

West Portal has a few great Italian restaurants, sometimes this is one. Maybe we hit it on an off night tonight.
author: Max M.

description: The food was so good. We came a few times during lunch and each time I came, I always ordered different things. The last time we came, I ordered the penne pasta with smoke salmon and the dish was delicious. My coworker had the seafood linguini (?) and he told me to order that next time. Will definitely go back and try different items on the menu.
author: fenny g.

description: Our party of four had an excellent dining experience this evening at Spiazzo Ristorante.  The food was delicious, I absolutely loved my penne portofino with prawns and scallops.  Our server Cullen was excellent.  For all diners with dietary issues, such as myself, having a knowlegible server, is critical.  Cullen was a rock star, knowing exactly how their food was prepared and what I needed to stay away from.  Much thanks Cullen.  My wife and I look forward to dining there again.
author: Tommy L.

description:
Upon returning to this fine establishment it reminds me why I hold Spiazzo to a higher standard than most restaurants. And every time I visit they live up to their elevated level of quality, decadence and service. 

Recently they have added house made breadsticks to their welcoming bread sampler accompanied by their unique tapenade. The breadsticks aren't Olive Garden-esque doughy, nasty breadsticks but also aren't a traditional hard as a rock, pretzel-like breadstick. They're a slightly crispy well seasoned addition to their happy welcome. 

Cannot say enough tremendous things about their specials menu. It's quite large without being overwhelming with too many options. And it changes seasonally which is the mark of a restaurant on top of utilizing the best ingredients available per time of year. 

One of my favorite dishes is the cold seafood salad. The seafood is precisely cooked to maximize the fresh seafood flavor without being too robust or fishy. It's well dressed with a mustard, garlicky based sauce and pairs well with the bruschetta. 

The Eggplant Parmesan is stacked with such grace and elegance that one would think the chef graduated from MIT. Not overloaded with marinara sauce and cheese, it allows the eggplant to breath and sing into the mouths of its diners. 

The aspect I appreciate the most of Spiazzo is the ideology that the customer should be pleased with everything they order. If you request extra sauce, additional meats, no meat, extra cheese, pink sauce - even if it's not on the menu, they make it happen. The servers treat you like royalty and don't give you a nasty look if you ask for something outside of the normal realm of spaghetti and meatballs.
author: Rosalyn W.

description:
Great customer service and an overall solid Italian restaurant in the West Portal area. We initially picked the place because it was one of the few restaurants in the area with an acceptable health score rating (seriously, outside of this place and calibur, it's pretty grim in West Portal). The dishes are ample in portion and tasty. It's not La Ciccia, but it's not the Olive Garden either. 

It's not particularly hip or trendy and I suspect the reason the score isn't higher is that the regular clientele here are sort of the older-non-yelping crowd. That being said, If you're in the area, looking for food, it's one of your best options.
author: Baron C.

description:
My mom and I grabbed wine and an appetizer here one friday night and it was great. We were seated at a small table in a corner so it gave us a chance to catch up. I had a glass of moscato and my mom probably had a chardonnay. I think each glass was $6-8, which is reasonable. We shared a plate of calamari and given a basket of fresh bread with some vinegar dip. Everything was very tasty and the service was attentive. 
I can't speak for their entrees but it looked like a place for a fancy date or a birthday.
author: Casey B.

description: This restaurant is incredible. The food was absolutely delicious. The service was impeccable. We've never had such wonderful Italian food. Everything is freshly prepared and cooked to perfection. The folks who run this restaurant enjoy what they're doing and aim to provide the best of experiences. It has a relaxed atmosphere. We are fortunate to have this quality in our neighborhood.
author: Kathleen H.

description: Veal Saltimbocca is to die for, I haven't had a good dish for a long time until this place. The waiter's recommendation on the wine is very good as well. I would def come back to this place. This place has a small family feel where it is very welcoming and friendly to enjoy wonderful meals.
author: Adam J.

description:
Food isn't bad, but it isn't good. Just decent, very bland. I got the pesto pasta with wild mushrooms, I needed to add salt to get a taste out of it. My roommates got pizza, which is baked in a brick oven, they had really no complaints other than it was too doughy. They also don't serve liquor other than wine and champagne. 

I will continue on my journey to find the best pesto pasta in SF.
author: Teal M.

description: Dumb pasta with heavy tomato sauce and too much salt.    Nice decor, pleasant host.  Too bad the food is so dumb.
author: B W.

description: One of my favorite places for pasta! The noodles are a perfect consistency and prices are pretty reasonable for west portal area.
author: Kristen T.

description: Chicken parm was absolutely delicious. Seated quickly even on a busy friday evening. Reasonably priced and good wine selection. Would definitely come back.
author: katherine p.

description: Had a fabulous dinner with great service. Ravioli exceptional and good tiramisu. Not busy and felt so welcome would recommend. Additional parking in lot behind
author: Kathy H.

description: Tight quarters, quick and efficient service, good portions and tasty food. Also, easy parking! Had a reservation with my husband on Saturday, easy parking and our table was ready right away. Seating is a bit tight but everyone was friendly and we didn't mind talking to our neighbors.
author: Lori C.

description: Used to go here while growing up with my best friend LOVED IT all bday parties were here ! This was the spot
author: Claire F.

description: We have lived near this neighborhood restaurant for 20 years. We use to come every week for years with our daughter. Over time, we didn't make it here but about once a month because we didn't eat out as much and our daughter became picky and a vegetarian. But they remember us and always give us great service and somehow find us a seat on busy holidays, like Valentine's day. The food is terrific. I love the salmon with capers, artichoke hearts and lemon sauce, and the mashed potatoes with carrots. All of the salads are so good. My husband loves the rack of lamb. A really homey place with first class food and service.
author: b z.

description:
Back in the day, my friends and I used to pass by Spiazzo on our way to the MUNI station or to watch a movie at Empire.  I had always been curious about the place, but never enough to make it inside.  It wasn't until a couple of my friends put some serious limits on where to go for dinner one night that Spiazzo even came to mind.  Italian in this area of the city that's not Olive Garden?  Who knew Spiazzo was just one of a couple of places that could fit the bill?

Walking in, I liked the feel of the restaurant - a little nicer than other casual, Italian joints but with a relaxed, neighborhood type of vibe.  We were able to snag the last free table, and I was moderately impressed with the assortment of dishes the menu had to offer.  I ordered the Minestrone and Spaghetti Portofino, and I was able to try the Beef Carpaccio my friend ordered for the table.

- Minestrone (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/NWu1cDtYArkjWw2F8PzU9Q?select=obS63fHpNd1fFiUVVaeRZg) - the portion was larger than I expected, but that's about it.  Pretty average considering you can find the same at a lot of other places in SF.  
- Carpaccio di Manzo (Beef Carpaccio) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/NWu1cDtYArkjWw2F8PzU9Q?select=67HuoK9sKfUvtMiuNbUmYw) - the beef was okay, but I liked the shaved parmesan and the argula.
- Spaghetti Portofino (Spaghetti with Prawns and Scallops in a White Wine and Garlic Sauce) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/NWu1cDtYArkjWw2F8PzU9Q?select=iEQuYUx3tf2fzcnkYxK9gA) - not too shabby.  I didn't like the prawns, but the scallops were okay and I liked the sauce.

Even though I don't usually care about the bread a restaurant serves, Spiazzo's seemed a little weird.  Typically, fresh bread has a soft and fluffy core, but this one was dense and "chunky" (no other way to describe it).  Also, the service left me a little mixed - "cold but efficient" as my friend described.  Our waiter wasn't that friendly and didn't say more than he needed to, but he didn't mess up and was pretty quick.  Hard to complain when he didn't make a mistake.

Even though it didn't really bowl me over, I can see why people might like Spiazzo.  For me, it's kind of like how Il Borgo was for me - fine if you're in or live by the area, but not somewhere I would go out to specifically.
author: Mike L.

description:
Wonderful service, and the food was heavenly. I had the gnocchi and the texture was spot on. 
Decent parking, depending on the time of day. A little on the pricey side, but worth it. 
The servers really know their stuff, so trust their pairing recommendations.
author: Anna B.

description: I had a great dinning experience at this restaurant,  the food was delicious and the service exceptional!  We'll definitely be back!
author: Betty A.

description: Yum!  We had such a great dining experience here!  The pumpkin ravioli and roasted duck were fabulous. We finished a delicious meal with home made tiramisu and chocolate pot de creme ... All was tasty and well prepared. The service was excellent and a shout out to our outstanding waiter Tairo!  Tairo was knowledgable on the menu items and offered us his recommendations, which did not disappoint. We will be back!
author: Denise L.

description: I would give it zero stars.I was there with two guests on a Thursday nite at 6 o'clock.I was so embarrassed.The waiter was rude and really rushed us.The food was served cold and frankly inedible.
author: Victoria S.

description:
I visited here with my family. The food was excellent and the service was very personable. It is a relatively small place and fills up quickly, so come at a time when you can either wait or when it's not typically busy.
We are vegetarians, and there were sufficient options.
I would certainly recommend this restaurant.
author: Nakul S.

description:
I hardly ever take the time to review places, but Spiazzo has become my go-to restaurant for when my grandparents are in the City. It's incredibly tasty, the service is great (the older Italian gentleman is the best!), and while it's usually busy on weekends we've never had trouble getting a table w/ more than a 10-15 minute wait.

I especially like the Chicken Parmesan and Chicken Marsala, and while I'm not a wine connoisseur of any kind, the house red wine is usually pretty solid.
author: Brendan L.

description: This place is amazing! Great service, fantastic food, the people are friendly and the restaurant is clean. I recommend coming here if you want great Italian food. I will definitely recommend and come back to this place.
author: Kyle M.

description: Authentic Italian food. We called in on a Thursday night, it was busy but they accommodated us fairly quickly. Great service.
author: Crystal G.

description:
We walked in at 9:30pm with only half an hour til the kitchen closed but were welcomed very warmly by our excellent server Oscar. They brought out bread with individual butters and their house made dipping sauce which I believe is roasted veggies with a definite hint of bell pepper.
Off top, I knew I wanted the polenta with Italian sausage (u can order with or without meat). This is the dish that keeps bringing me back to this place. You haven't tasted polenta until you've had it here with the generous portion of sausage and meaty mushrooms. It's also served with a whole head of roasted garlic on top that literally "falls off the bone" for lack of better words. Each clove comes out with ease and compliments the dish well. We ordered it as an appetizer but it can very well serve as a small meal.
For the main dish, I ordered the prawns with angel hair pasta (cappelini). To my surprise it also came with scallops! I didn't read that far into the description on the menu, I just stopped at jumbo prawns and ordered. Ooh wee, lemme tell you, the dish was so delicious, as we say in Hawaii, "it broke my mouth"! Both the scallops and the prawns were huge! No skimpin on the scrimp here!! I usually like to squeeze a lil lemon on my seafood, but didn't even have to here. The lemon, garlic, wine sauce was balanced to perfection.
The Mister ordered chicken marsala. You know it's good when the table is quiet. He didn't say a word except to offer me a bite. I kindly declined as my dish was all I needed and it was delectible.
The champagne comes in an individual small bottle and was cold and bubbly. Got my fix.
Though there was limited time left, Oscar never rushed us, and made sure we received superior customer service regardless of the fact that they would be there cleaning up after us after closing time. This restaurant is cozy and comfortable, yet lightweight elegant and is definitely authentic Italian cuisine- Oscar relayed our order to the chefs speaking full blown Italian. They executed the order promptly and they perfectly pleased our palettes. Left a $20 tip for a $77 check. With the food, service, and ambiance, it was worth every penny.
author: Tiffany A.

description:
This place "use" to be good. My first time was maybe a little over 6 years ago and each time I go it seems to be falling apart. The complimentary bread now just taste weird, similar taste to cookie dough& the spread is not good at all.
Does not match the bread, maybe a side of Garlic butter would be best. The spinach pasta was wayyyyy to salty with pancetta already in there. My boyfriend got spaghetti and clams which was bland. Although the service and staff was so kind, this place is not worth it anymore. Sorry
author: Camille B.

description:
Came here twice once for dinner and once for lunch.

Service and food is so-so. I ordered the spaghetti calabrese with pesto and teammate had the penne alla campagnola for dinner the first time we were there.

For lunch, I had the chicken ceaser salad and teammate had one of the pastas.

Everything was alright, nothing really surprised me. Probably won't be back. Service was also slow.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
Great Italian restaurant with relatively reasonable price. I like their Risotto and clams and prawns, always perfectly cooked. They food are no doubt one of the best in the area. I always enjoy eating there. 

The one and only one complaint might be the Tiramisu. I'm a all time Tiramisu freaky fan. And after look at the yelp picture I was very excited to order that, even with a full stomach. Maybe I'm on a Friday nite so something, it came out not even looks like a piece of cook. It just mashed and I can't even see the square shape at all. It also doesn't taste very good, too sweet and you can only taste sweet that's all. The Chocolate Pot de Creme, on the other hand, is super delicious. Very smooth and creamy and full flavor of chocolate. 

Overall, went it comes to Italian restaurant, this place is still my favorite.
author: Jason L.

description:
The worker here is super funny and kind. I'd love to come here again to talk with him!
The day I went there, it was seated smoothly and the service was pretty nice! 
The food is nice! Not the best but it's nice :D
author: Satoe Y.

description: Such a great dinning experience.  The menu is vast with changing specials.  The service is top notch, no rushing or requesting water BS.  Just old school manners, cleanliness and respect. Caprese Salad was a great way to start and had a delicious pesto accompanying it as well.  Went with the Scampi Lido for the main.  A very generous portion of big juicy prawns perfectly cooked with that hard to reach harmony of lemon & butter.  Everything is affordable  and portions are plentiful.  Not many places left like this is SF!
author: Chelsey G.

description: Good Italian comfort food. The portions are generous so be prepared to share the food with family and friends. We usually start with the antipasto platter and a bottle of wine. There is also quite a variety of good entrees - so I am never worried that I won't find something I like. The seating can be kind of tight, but it's a small restaurant.
author: Angelito R.

description: I came here the other night with my boyfriend, and had a very nice experience.  There was about a 10-15 minute wait to get a seat (on a Saturday night around 6:30).  Once seated, we were promptly provided with complimentary bread and tomato spread.  We chose a bottle of wine and split two pasta entrees.  The meal was very filling and enjoyable.  I especially liked the red sauce that covered the cheese ravioli.
author: Katie E.

description:
The staff was great and kind. 
As for the food, I wasn't impressed. Having tested Italian food in Italy and Europe lots of time, I do not know but this did not taste as authentic Italian food. It was too bland, generic and without life. 
 My friend ordered salmon, and it came just on itself on a plate with some beans separately without any additional side sauce, vegetables... I am sure you know how Italians do it. Italian food is an art in terms of both appearance and richness of flavours. 
I had a chicken with mushrooms cream, it was really bland. I had to add salt in order to add some flavour to it. (as far as I remember this was the very first time I had to add salt in expensive restaurant dishes). 
It did not impress me. You know the feeling when you do not desire to go there again and pay for that food.  Maybe our choices were not that good, no idea. But our food was really below average.
In general, the atmosphere and the ambience is great but food was below average and I was not impressed (especially for that level of prices = we paid 102$ for three person's main dishes, two salads, one soft drink and one dessert).
author: Milenko P.

description:
Back in the 1990s and early 2000s I ate at this establishment a lot. As in at least 3-4 times per month for about four years. - This evening some friends of mine and I ate there again for the first time since 2002. - What an utter disappointment. 

Food - One Star (Overly salty, uninspired, boring. And their "bread" at the beginning of the service may very well have been the saddest example of bread I've ever seen. Italians would be ashamed. )
Service - One Star (Untrained, *very* rude food server with no idea how to pace a table or treat customers.)
Wine - One Star (Cheap local fare, nothing worth note.)

Sadly, I will not be returning there. I guess it was kismet that I stayed away as long as I did.
author: David P.

description: Spiazzo's is great! The food was delicious. The service was on point. It's a great neighborhood Italian restaurant. I tried the gnocchi and the carpaccio. Both exceeded my expectations, and I will definitely be back!
author: Mike L.

description: We came here to celebrate our friends birthday. When we first sat down, we told our waitress that we would wait to order until the birthday girl arrived. She was nice and offered to have a dessert ready for her at the end of our meal. When the check came, I noticed she did not charge for the dessert which we thought was nice. Most restaurants do comp. desserts so we didn't think anything of it. I handed her my credit card and said thanks for the dessert! She said your welcome but when they returned with my card, I noticed the amount was different. She charged for the dessert after the fact and didn't even say anything to us about it. It's one thing if you made a mistake and forgot to charge us but you could have said something! We were all pretty upset and thought that was shady business. I've never been to a restaurant that charges your credit card a completely different amount after presently the bill bc they forgot an item. Too bad bc we did enjoy the food...but won't be back.
author: Ada W.

description: This place is terrible.  Just ordered a sausage pizza, spaghetti, and meatballs through OrderAhead.  Pizza crust tasted like frozen pastry dough, sauce that was bland and tasted like it came from a jar.  The sausage on top of the pizza was very very salty.  The "bolognese" sauce on the spaghetti was terribly bland as was the sauce on the mostly breadcrumb meatballs.  I'm not sure anything was freshly made. Money wasted!
author: Colleen M.

description: First off, we randomly chose this restaurants while walking around West Portal and were pleasantly surprised.  We had a baby with us and they were super accommodating, willing to make whatever she needed since she has food allergies.   They were super attentive and best of all - the food was great!   Definitely would come here again.  Nice neighborhood gem.   Thanks!
author: Edgar C.

description: We had a party of 8. Everyone loved their food. I had the chicken Marcella. It was excellent. Service was fast and pleasant. Our bill came to $300. With appetizer and wine. Not too bad.
author: Jerrie V.

description: Came in here yesterday on a date. Everything was really wonderful from the generous helpings of bread to the attentive staff and great wine, it was perfect. I give the most kudos to our server, a funny brown haired girl with glasses, who guided us through the menu and was super patient with my myriad of questions. I ordered the Scampi Lido which was perfect, the prawns were so big, tender and full of flavor. My date ordered a pizza, which was also surprisingly delicious; an elevated and upscale pizza if there ever was one!
author: Nicole B.

description: Food is good but I felt like our server was pushing alot on me and my family, like I get it your doing your job, but dam let us decide what we want , I have been here several times and this is the first time anyone has tried so hard pushing  wine and dessert and this and that like dam calm down the food is good but not fucking gold....
author: Valeriana L.

description: 1st time here, great food, service beyond expectation. Definitely a great restaurant. Will be back again.
author: Theresa M.

description:
We were on our way to the symphony and decided to have some Italian in the local neighborhood.  It was busy for a Friday night and therefore noisy too.  The decor was warm, with yellow interior walls.  We sat in the middle, where there were lots of wine bottles, adding to the decor.  Eight of us sat down.  Space was a little tight.

We ordered 
Lasangne, looked really flat and covered with sauce.  Couldn"t see the layers of pasta and meat and dish lacked flavor.
Pesto fetticinni was a little salty
Ravioli did not have enough tomato sauce
Tomato pasta was a bit bland
Tiramisu was good but had better elsewhere.

Overall, I felt the service and food seemed a little too rushed and probably due to being a busy Friday.  The pasta dishes were ok, nothing memorable.
Most likely will try try other Italian restaurant before returning to Spiazzo.
author: Elaine Y.

description: We loved this place.  Very quiet and cozy. My sister and I went for a nice but casual dinner. The pasta was delicious! Portions are big enough to split--especially if you have a salad and/or appetizer. They bake their own amazing bread and serve it with this yummy red pepper creamy spread. Our waiter was very nice and unpretentious. We were too full to try the tiramisu but will save room next time. I totally recommend this little neighborhood gem.
author: Julie B.

description: My husband and I had read great reviews of this place and were pleased we could get a table on Valentine's Day. The food was simply meh. There was no great depth of flavour in any of the dishes and vegetables were overcooked. The highlight was our sons pizza. Understandably it was a very busy night, however the restaurant was ridiculously cramped making it almost impossible to get up to use the restroom. The staff was friendly, but the lack of flavour in the food really let the place down
author: Erin D.

description: Went here for a birthday. Had to wait until my whole dinner party was here to be seated. The wait was about 30 minutes. When everyone finally arrived we were seated 15 minutes after. Not the most thorough planning on the part of this place. A reservation was made so figure it out ahead of time, right!!! The dinner was good. The menu was intense. Looking to take yo lady to some place nice on a Friday night or Sunday afternoon this is the place. Casual dress.
author: Robert F.

description: Great place to go for tasty Italian food. Can be crowded at times but they move ppl in and out quick enough. The staff is very friendly and the food is well cooked. Hats off to the owners!
author: Jeffrey L.

description:
I have fond memories of coming here as a teen and as an adult for date nights. It's always a warm atmosphere and comfortable in there. People that work there are beyond friendly and accommodating. My favorite is their creme brûlée which I had for the first time in this restaurant years ago.

I haven't been back in years but just did recently. Everything is still very much like it was except we were disappointed by the food this time. We came in about 30minutes to closing and sort of got the look of death from one of the chefs. I could've been imagining it but he didn't look happy that we came in close to closing. Unfortunately the food that we got was all lukewarm. The bread was warm on the outside but ice cold on the inside. Literally refrigerator cold. My plate was also cold. Only my husband's was hot but that's probably because it had to be fried up. Though the food was tasty and seemed fresh, I really couldn't enjoy it like I would have liked. I didn't want to send it back since the kitchen was already looking like it was closed and I didn't want to be that jerk that comes in at closing time to raise hell. Hope it was just bad timing.
author: Carol A.

description: Great environment to the restaurant with a friendly staff. They honored our reservation with 10ppl on a Friday night. The food was amazing, as we all selected different dishes from pizza, tortellini, salmon penne. Wine selection is good and definitely get the cheesecake! It's the best cheesecake i've had in a very long time and i'm from NYC.
author: Akshat D.

description: I'm really really surprised about some of the bad reviews. REALLY surprised. I used to come here all the time with my parents over a decade ago. The food was delicious then, and it's even better now! The service was top notch and the little place is so cute! Love love love it. Give it a try, you won't be disappointed!
author: Marianna Y.

description:
I really like this restaurant, which is conveniently located in West Portal just a few steps from the muni station.  

They have a lot of good choices on the menu, but my favorite is the chicken with mushrooms in a creamy sauce.  The sauce is amazing and can't be beat.

The tiramisu is like homemade.  Excellent.
author: J M.

description: My husband and I love Spiazzo Ristorante.  Great service and wonderful dishes.  I recently enjoyed a 15th century recipe for Ravioli in a cream sauce for lunch that was absolutely fantastic.  Besides the delicious food, it is nice to be in a restaurant where you can have a conversation and you never feel rushed and their prices are reasonable.  Forget the intensity of Original Joe's in Westlake and the noisy Boulevard Cafe and support a family run local business in West Portal.  Spiazzo's is open seven days a week which is really nice and the seating is comfortable and the atmosphere relaxed.  I always suggest  to my friends that we eat at Spiazzo's and as a result they have come to enjoy and support this restaurant as well.
author: Joan V.

description:
I have been going to spiazzo for 19 years now. It has never failed to impress me for almost two decades. I have celebrated various milestones in my life and family's life and will continue to do so for a very, very long time.

Their tiramisu is to die for. Other favorite dishes I have at Spiazzo are: risotto luccana, puttanesca (vegetarian pasta with mildly spicy sauce/comes with fettuccini but I get with spaghetti noodles), penne al salmone, lasagna, bruschetta (mushrooms and tomatoes), insalata con pere (pear and gorgonzola salad), creme brulee, grilled salmon, calamari appetizer with arabiatta sauce, shrimp scampi, as well as goat cheese with eggplant appetizer.

Check it out. I guarantee you that you will not be disappointed. I can personally testify as to Spiazzo's consistency in providing excellent service and delicious and mouth-watering food. 

In terms of excellent service, I would like to give a special shoutout to Oscar and Edwin, who have been so welcoming, highly efficient, and always delightful through the years. Spiazzo would not be Spiazzo without these two individuals. They are outstanding and deserve to be commended. Guiseppe, one of the owners, is an excellent hands-on manager and is always making sure Spiazzo's customers are satisfied.

In terms of food, I have travelled extensively throughout Italy, and Spiazzo still remains at the top of my list of favorite Italian restaurants of all time. I do not say this lightly.

Spiazzo, you are simply amazing!!
author: Vicki G.

description: We have eaten there a couple of times a couple of years ago and thought it was ok. Went there last night, all dishes were heavy with cheese and butter not made with a lot of thought. The calamari was ok. The salmon Penni pasta had no salmon just cheese and butter. The veal was maybe previously frozen with cheese on top. I won't return for that price.
author: Milton L.

description:
It was my girlfriend's birthday and I wanted to treat her to a special meal at a place we'd never been before.  I picked her up from the train station after work and we walked down the street to a cute Italian restaurant called Spiazzo Ristorante.

We started the meal with some fresh bread served with a tomato-based sauce.  It was a nice departure from the norm and we were excited for our dinner.  I forget the name of the appetizer, but it was sort of like a stacked ratatouille which was delicious!  It was easily both of our favorite dish of the evening.  The entrees however, were a different story.  My risotto was kind of pasty and wasn't smooth like it should have been.  My girlfriend's shrimp pasta was extremely overcooked, almost mushy, and the shrimp were firm and rubbery.  Definitely wasn't as good as the appetizer and we didn't actually finish either dish.

I had high hopes for Spiazzo especially on this occasion.  I think we were both a little disappointed but we made it up with boba for dessert at the reliable Tea Way.  Service was pretty good, and my water was never empty.  The ambiance was really nice and I liked the open kitchen feel.  Unfortunately the food didn't measure up and I don't think we will be back.

Food: 6/10

Service: 7/10

Price: $$

Atmosphere: 8/10
author: Joe M.

description:
food was good, enjoyed the pear salad, pasta vongole and prawns.

Would have given it a 4 star if it wasn't for the odd question from the waitress.  
I went yesterday with my elderly husband who uses a walking stick and he is also hard of hearing. He has a bad knee from 50 years of hard down hill skiing and recently sustained a very bad fall. As I was enjoying my dinner, the waitress came and asked me out of the blue if he has a stroke. I replied that he does not have a stroke and had a bad fall.  She proceeded to say she works with stroke patients and he has the symptoms.  Health issue is a private matter and I don't understand why she was questioning what I said plus I felt I do not need to explain it to a total stranger.
author: mary w.

description: We had to take a trip to West Portal and I decided to check out restaurant reviews in the area.  We ventured into Spiazzo because it looked peaceful and relaxing.  The staff was very attentive.  The chef was incredible.  He made the most amazing meal for us.  We started with a homemade blended dipping red pepper and tomato sauce served with fresh bread.  Then progressed onto enjoying "The Insalate Mista Con Barbabietole"; Organic spring mix with Organic beets and tomatoes in a balsamic vinaigrette, delightful.  For the main course, we decided to try the perfectly grilled trout and Dover Sole with a yummy lemon sauce.  They both came with roasted rosemary potatoes and perfectly cooked medley of vegetables.  The dessert was an amazingly light lemon sorbet.   We are looking forward to visiting the restaurant again.in the near future.
author: Holly L.

description: All right, I've been meaning to write this review for awhile.  I absolutely love this restaurant.  The atmosphere is warm and cozy, the staff are incredibly friendly and the food is amazing!  I've never been disappointed.  I love the stuffed eggplant appetizer, and my absolute favorite item is the penne al salmone.  I almost died it was so good.  I'm always impressed with the service, but I've been served by Esme several times and she is my favorite.  She's so accommodating and always remembers me, and helps me select the best dishes when I feel like straying from my usual penne al salmone.  It's a great place to take a date.  It's nice and feels upscale but doesn't break the bank.  I love you Spiazzo.
author: Nicholas P.

description: Their bread is warm with an amazing spicy red sauce for the table. Their Malbec is very reasonably priced and very smooth. My favorite entree is the tortellini salsa rosa! So delicious! The staff always makes us feel like we are family. Very well run restaurant... I've been here several times and as a SF food critic I give two thumbs up all around!!
author: Lauren C.

description:
My mom, sister and I came here for a nice lunch before heading down to the San Francisco Ballet on a girl's date. I can't rave enough about how amazing the food and the service was. 

We came in for lunch service and it wasn't too crowded. I have seen this place with a line down the street for dinner service before so that's why I was eager to try it out. Being 8 months pregnant at the time I was catered to by the wait staff to make sure I always had enough water or if there was anything else I needed. Along with being huge in size I had a huge appetite to match! The portions were not disappointing. To this day, this is the BEST lasagna I have ever had in my life.

I really can't wait to enjoy many more meals here.
author: Andy S.

description: You can taste the care and effort they put into their food. Super fresh ingredients and great service! Will come back again for sure.
author: Eric K.

description:
Came here yesterday for my birthday dinner with my mom, as I have for 10 or 11 of the past 12 years. I am a creature of habit and always get the same thing at every restaurant I go to, and I come here for scampi lido. It. Is. So. Good. But this time as I opened my menu it looked different, and to my shock it wasn't on the menu anymore! Now, I'm not a dramatic person, but since my favorite pizza place (Paradise) down the street was recently sold and has already gone a little downhill, I was really worried the same was happening here (it's not - phew!). I asked the waitress with what I'm assuming was a horrified look on my face if they've changed the menu and she said they have a little bit. I asked if it would be possible to get the dish still and she said it should be fine. It came out and was really good, as always. At the end of our dinner she let me know that whenever I came in again it would be no problem to make it for me.

This might seem like something small, but I really, really appreciate you guys going out of your way for me when you didn't have to. This is why Spiazzo's is and continues to by my favorite restaurant. Thank you for once again making my birthday a happy one!
author: Melissa C.

description:
Came here for a late night dinner. Was surprised by the amount of people that were there at 9:30 on a Tuesday, but didn't have to wait. Right away was greeted with a bread and marinara sampler, it was good. I ordered the eggplant appetizer-DELICIOUS! I got it with a side of alfredo pasta and put it in my creamy red sauce that comes on the eggplant-SO SO GOOD. My boyfriend for the tri-tip. It lacked flavor, was chewy and over all disappointing. The best part about it was the balsamic salad dressing that they put on top of the steak and the vegetables.

What's the old saying....When in Rome...Well-- GET A PASTA DISH HERE, or try the amazing eggplant app. You won't be disappointed. (note to self-don't eat the eggplant skin)
author: Britt S.

description: Food was very rich and very filling! The bread they give you was warm and soft! I ordered the penne allow salmon in a creamy tomato sauce. The sauce was thick and had a smoky flavor. Will come again definitely. The BREAD is AMAZING
author: Crystal R.

description: Came here for lunch and I was very impressed. The waiter was very polite and the kitchen staff were very kind. The food is AMAZING!! I had the Calamari Spaghetti for lunch and it blew my mind. I really recommend this place!
author: Billy N.

description: We came from out of town and landed here by accident, as my son simply wanted spaghetti and meatballs. They start you off with two types of homemade bread that is exceptional...warning...dont overload!  Its great, but you dont want to get too full!  The portions are big, the food is amazing, and my family absolutely loved the food.  If we get back to SF, we're definitely coming back to Spiazzo!
author: Ken H.

description: A couple weeks ago, we came here to celebrate my sister in law's birthday. The service and food were absolutely amazing. We are so grateful we chose this place. They were attentive, kind and very catering for a large group with children. My parents loved the food and everyone has an amazing time :)
author: Winnie L.

description:
Hands down, one hundred percent, best Italian restaurant I've been to..
AMAZING service: the waitors and waitresses are always smiling, friendly, AND willing to help me pronounce things on the menu. :)

Appropriate pricing for such a great experience with the family.

The bread and vinegar and that special sauce they serve you upon seating is SO GOOD!!! I'm pretty sure it's not just me that gorges on those... lol. Ok maybe just me

MOVING ON... 

Appetizers: The bruschetta and caprese salad are so amazing and fresh. Get those! 

Main course: I always get the Dinner Special stuffed red pepper risotto. It's around $26, but it's all worth it. The salmon pasta is not that good, I'd skip that next time. The clam linguini is also not the best. 

Overall, very great service, ambience, and food. Coming again soon!
author: michelle w.

description:
Not too shabby at all!

Came around 6ish on a Friday night and was seated right away.  A booth cleared soon after and I asked if we could move but they would not let us... that wasn't nice.

We both ordered pasta dishes which cost around $15.  Each was a red sauce both with seafood and both different flavored and delicious.  The flavor of each sauce was spectacular and unique.  You could tell it was well thought out and made with quality ingredients.

We want to go back next time we are in the City.
author: Lydia K.

description: Lovely place. Pizzas and pastas seem original.    First time trying pizza with salmon. Staff was a really decent nice guy. It was not crowded and noisy so I and my friend could relax. I'll go  again and try other dishes.
author: Lisa I.

description: I love this place! Great pasta and they have Italian soda in just about every flavor. Plus great service and parking.
author: Demi W.

description: The service is great. Very friendly workers. Food is also delicious and large in portion sizes.
author: Ali H.

description: We started with the Antipasto Misto. Then I had the Petto Di Pollo al Funghetto with a side of Risotto. Both were fabulous!! The staff was very knowledgeable & informative of every item on the menu. The wine list had excellent choices.  Our waiter gave us a few suggestions & he did a great job! We finished with desserts that were delicious. We will definitely go back.
author: Sue N.

description: Small place, manager was friendly greeting customers with a smile. The pesto was fresh and maintained a dark green color, the place wasn't packed but the bruschetta was standard, no fresh cheese tho, the wild mushroom bruschetta was an interesting cold mushroom, marinated. All around I would say it was a good visit.
author: Nathan B.

description: Always very friendly and attentive service; prices are reasonable, with a decent number of options on the menu to choose from.  Looks and feels more open & spacious than it actually is -- it's actually quite cozy, but the large windows give it an open feeling. It's a good place to eat, relax, talk (and actually hear what is being said.)  And a surprisingly consistent experience, since it's such a small operation -- at times, perhaps just the owner servicing all the tables -- but the people who *are* there, are experienced, and I guess that explains it.
author: michl ..

description: This longtime, West Portal restaurant has gone through it's ups and it's not-so ups, but right now it's flying high. Very good fresh pasta, amiable staff, and cozy, neighborhood feel. Go before the movie that's playing up the block at the Empire or after an author's chat at West Portal Bookstore. We had the POLENTA di CASA and the FETTUCCINE CON GAMBERONI, also a side of spinach and a bowl of minestrone.  No room for dessert because we ate it all up. Thanks, Spiazzo, for always being there.
author: Na m.

description:
Went on a Thursday night without reservations and the five of us were quickly seated.  Water and bread with a tomato based dipping sauce immediately brought to the table.  Bread, similar to a foccacia, was heavy and lacked flavor.  You will need the sauce.

For appetizers, we had the carpaccio and the clams (7 to 8 clams) in a garlic/parsley/lemon broth.  The carpaccio was good while the clam broth was a bit to salty.

Five entrees ranging from specials to pizza were ordered and none stood out.  Tri-Colore Pizza was average, Lamb Meatballs with Risotto sounded better than it tasted and meatballs were dense.  Seafood Pasta in a tomato sauce was large dish with clumpy pasta, Half Duck with Poached Pears and Risotto was a bit too sweet with the duck smothered in the sauce- I still have it in my fridge two days later...Veal In a Piccata type sauce was salty according to the sig other.

Ordered Tiramisu and Tartuffe...liked the Tartuffe more than the Tiramisu.

Food is average while we had excellent service.  Waitress was kind of funny as when she greeted us, we asked how was she doing and she answered she is "normal".  Interesting answer...  The place is nicely decorated which appealed to us rather than the pizzeria a half block away...looks can be deceiving.  Noticed the Owner/Manager is a bit intense as he was animately instructing his waitstaff.  Something I would have done away from Customer view...Interesting that we were seated comfortably at a table that seats six and two parties of five came in while we were finishing dessert.  The two parties were seated by the Owner/Manager at rectangular tables that normally seat four comfortably with a fifth seat at the end of a table.  They looked cramped and I am not sure if either party was offered our table knowing we were wrapping up...Thus, be mindful of YOUR dining experience....

Will not be going back as there are so many other Italian options in the city.  We really wanted to like this place as it is close to Grandma's..will keep searching....
author: Scott L.

description: Had lunch here. Service was prompt and attentive. The spaghetti carbonara unfortunately was disappointing, a tad too tart...I don't remember this dish ever being cooked with lemon juice. But my friend's fettuccine all'amatriciana (don't remember the exact item name on the menu) was delicious.
author: Lil D.

description: My ravioli (pesto with chicken in a cream sauce) smelled horrible, but tasted good.  I'm really not sure what to make of that, but there it is.  The iced tea was brewed a little too long, but not enough to make it too too bitter.  The service was very decent.
author: Jacob J.

description:
This is a solid Italian restaurant in West Portal.  My family is a frequent visitor and we're never disappointed.  They have great service, quality food and a very home-like quality that makes me always crave the return.  

This is my go to item:

PENNE ALLA CAMPAGNOLA, Penne with sundried tomatoes, broccoli and breast of chicken in a white wine sauce 12.95

The noodles are always a little aldente, the sun dried tomatoes are delicious and slightly tart (just typing it right now makes my mouth water), well cooked through broccoli and large pieces of white chicken.  But, what makes the paste is THE SAUCE right?  Well their sauce is creamy and rich with flavor.  I feel like they could have cooked that for hours to make sure that the sauce is nice and creamy (no wetness) and that every taste is through with the butter, salt, spices and white cream sauce.  

The staff is definitely hustling at their peak hour but they always come with a smile and a full heart to make sure that you enjoy your meal.  Sometimes they will stop just to converse and make small talk with the familiar faces.  I love the family-like feel to this restaurant.

I always leave happy and it's a great restaurant STAPLE to the West Portal area.  I cannot imagine this street without Spiazzo.
author: Sandy L.

description:
The first time I went was with my girlfriend on a Wednesday afternoon. We were just looking for something to eat and this place looked nice so we decided to try it. The waiters were some of the nicest people there and the food was great! 

The second time we went, we invited my family and we all loved it! I ordered the simple Spaghetti Bolognese which was just so perfectly cooked and delicious. My brother had the Pizza Con Salsicce with added mushrooms. It was so good, he finished the whole thing by himself! My girlfriend ordered the Fettuccine Alla Genovese which I practically ate half of it for her because it was just too good. She had to share with my mother's food (I can't remember what she ordered but she loved it!).

Plus, we let the waiter know that it was my mother's birthday and he was really nice! He thanked us for coming there and then surprised her with a slice of cake at the end (I wish I could remember the name of the cake too because we all fought to eat it even when we were full). 

If you're looking for restaurant with great service, a pleasant atmosphere and filling delicious italian food, this is the BEST place in S.F.! We're already planning another visit and hopefully I can get the rest of my family to go!
author: Phillip B.

description:
I've been here couple times now, and I have to say that the food is actually very good. Most recently I had the Penne Al Salmone which had a nice rich flavor and was honestly a huge serving.  The party I was with also ordered bruschetta which was well executed and flavorful. The only downside, and the only reason they did not earn a four star, is because we came with a large party and we had reservations and we showed up on time, yet the restaurant was unable to sit our entire party for over a half hour past our reservation time.
I understand the situation there were a couple of tables lingering well past finishing and paying their check . But I just felt something should've been done. It really threw off our meal. 
But I have to say for a neighborhood restaurant, the food and overall dining experiences is positive, besides the seating problem, the service was excellent. I would recommend this place, just not for large parties.
author: Gary B.

description: Probably the most under-rated great Italian food in the city. Flavors, authenticity and portions are all outstanding. The menu has something for everyone and all ages too. Presentation and service a big thumbs up!
author: Sandy G.

description:
My friends and I ate here for the very first time last weekend on Sunday. It was outstanding. The food was excellent, so was the service. The only drawback was the place was crowded. Yet, the staff was able to find us a spot with no waiting time. 

I had the stuffed red bell pepper. Wow! It was delicious and very filling. It had veal and sausage with a bit of broccoli, cauliflower and green-string beans. Really gratifying and very much unique dish. My friends had seafood and meatballs. They enjoyed their dishes. We all enjoyed the soup and fresh bread. 

Oh and the desserts were wonderful, especially the Tiramusu and the Spumoni cake.
Keep in mind, the place gets full on weekend nights. And, it is a bit pricey. But the food and the service is worth it.
author: Jonathan F.

description:
3.5 stars.  The location isn't central but luckily ez parking.  Great, attentive service.  The foccocia bread was delish - always a plus when the bread is heated.  

He had the FETTUCCINE ALLA GENOVESE, Fettuccine with pesto sauce, wild mushrooms and cherry tomatoes.  It must have been awesome bc the whole dish was gobbled up.  lol!

I enjoyed the RAVIOLI NATURALE, Large ravioli stuffed with ricotta cheese and spinach in a fresh tomato sauce.  Traditional style bc there were more than 2-3 large raviolis on my plate.  Loved the chunks of tomato in the sauce!  Enough garlic for flavor but not overwhelming.
author: Kim S.

description: Food was ok. Seafood soup was delish but lobster pasta was the opposite. Did not like the bread they serve it had a strange texture to it like corn bread but not. Wish they had ciabatta. Service was good.
author: A K.

description:
Went with my neighbor/friend here tonight for an early dinner. It was her birthday a week ago.
SPIAZZO is a nice little Italian restaurant on West Portal. It has a warm atmosphere and seems cozy. 
Upon sitting at our table, we were welcomed with friendly smiles and bread & butter. 
We started with a Salad a spring mix with beets & tomatos in a balsamic vinaigrette.
Then we had a cup of Minestrone soup, which was positively delicious.
For our mains, we split an order of Spaghetti Alla Vongole (spaghetti with fresh clams & garlic, wine sauce in a tomato base) Absolutely the stand out of the evening.  
I had ordered the Scampi Lido (jumbo prawns w/garlic, lemon in a white wine sauce). I really liked my dish, however the prawns seemed just a bit tough. My friend had the chicken breast w/mushrooms in a marinara sauce. She loved it.  We both ordered sides of sauteed vegetables.
We were served by a friendly waiter in a charming and welcoming space.
Great Italian food, comfortable prices. 
Easy parking.
We were stuffed. And very contented.
If your in the area, stop by. You wont be sorry.
author: Janet T.

description:
Extremely disappointed on many dishes!

Bruschetta & beef carpaccio were ok/decent.
My fettucine with shrimp was bland and "fishy" - shrimp & noodles were overcooked.
Green beans were completely soggy! It had the texture of canned green beans - no crunch at all.
Potatoes side dish was mushy and no texture. It was breaking apart when you scoop it.
My gf's penne with chicken dish was very bland! She barely touched it.
The pizza seemed like it's been sitting out. The bottom crust was pretty soft/mushy.
Hubby's chicken parm was lacking, according to him.

Service was fine and the waiter checked in on us from time to time. We had an early dinner so parking wasn't an issue.
author: Freckles H.

description:
I really want to like this place because I'm constantly looking for a good italian restaurant in the neighborhood...but left disappointed.

Food: bland! We ordered to share beef carpaccio, wild mushroom crostini and a caprese salad. The mushroom crostini is decent but the other two seriously lacked taste. For entree i ordered the fettucini genovese. No pesto flavor whatsoever!! I had to pour tons of salt on it in order to make it edible. The other dishes that my party ordered were also just as bland. 

Service was mediocre at best. We did come as a large party. The entrees came out disorganized. People were asked what they ordered and a dish was incorrectly given to the wrong person lots of confusion. A good waiter would never let that happen. Cheese were powdered and not grated which I would expect at this type of restaurants. Water had to be asked to be filled.

I only gave it one extra star because we brought our own birthday cake and they did accommodate with a song and candles (which we forgot to bring). Cake cut and served to us for no additional fee. A little brownie point is that they didn't force us to pay 20% tip because of the size of party like many restaurants do.


-----------

Review #147
author: Jannie Q.

description:
I had seen a LivingSocial coupon for Spiazzo a couple of weeks ago and so decided I'd buy in advance and stop by upon my arrival in San Francisco. In town for a short four days, I've been running around like mad trying to eat as much new food as I possibly could. 

With my coupon in hand we rushed back from Berkeley late in the evening to make our 9:15 reservation. I usually don't like to arrive at restaurants a short time before they close so I was a little uneasy when we were a few minutes late. The place was almost empty; only a few tables finishing up their meals.

Despite the late hour we were greeted with smiles and brought to a table. Our waiter was a wonderful Italian guy with a beautiful accent and all the attributes you could look for in an Italian waiter. Super friendly and extra willing to talk to us about the menu, give recommendations, and describe each dish as it came out (I'm in to food so I love this!).

We showed him the coupon as we ordered and he scanned it without any issue (sometimes staff are really confused with a coupon on an iPhone). He was no less nice or present knowing that we had 40 free dollars to spend. He encouraged us to order as soon as we could since the place was closing. Not pushy at all and he still talked to us about dishes for a while. 

Trying to spend the money we had, we ordered the Bruschetta to start. Unlike other places there were three different kinds; he told us about each. One was the traditional tomato & garlic, one was mushrooms with a pesto base, and the last was an eggplant medley with garlic and spices. All three were superb. I ordered the gnocchi, which were heavenly. Great flavor in the tomato based sauce and plenty of it (I hate dry pasta!) At first the portion looked a little small for the $14 price tag, but then I remembered that this was italian food and a little goes a long way. I ended up taking at least a third home.

My friend got the salmon pasta which I did not try as I don't eat salmon. She said it was wonderful. Some of the best she had had. The salmon was well mixed into the sauce so there were no major chunks. We finished off with Spumoni ice cream cake which was delightful.

By the time we were done it was at least 30 min after they closed. Our original waiter apologized and said that he had to leave but the cook would take care of us.  After he left the service was still wonderful. We wrapped things up and gave them an extra big tip.

4 stars for the food/atmosphere/price.

Outstanding service bumps it up to 5. I highly recommend this place.
author: Connor D.

description:
As I'm visiting family in SF I don't know many places, my brother-in-law suggested we visit Spiazzo after a day at two wineries in Santa Cruz. My family knows how picky I am around food and they all were telling me this is just a local place please don't hold the bar too high. It was packed on Father's day, however, we were seated exactly on time at 6:30 sharp, albeit the table was cramped and right opposite the kitchen. I was so close to the kitchen I could have cooked my own meal. We were at the table long enough to get water and bread, when the hostess came over and offered to move us to a booth that was much better situated. (this was unsolicited and IMHO a class move) Considering how busy it was and I do me crazy busy, our server (an older Italian gentleman) was totally on top of his game. Drink orders were taken, and brought to the table in record time, as if we were the only table in the place.
Our order was taken and the food for five (5) came out in a reasonable time and all together and steaming hot! I had the ravioli with pesto, chicken, sun dried tomatoes and spinach. The plate was well composed and had a huge portion of ravioli and was well seasoned and yummy! Others had a seafood soup with a side of spinach (my vegetarian sister-in-law), my brother-in-law had pasta Calabrese  and he's of Italian decent from Rhode Island and knows his food, he said it was great, my wife had lamb meatballs and risotto, she was pleased (Phew) the little guy had pepperoni pizza (I won't compare pizza on the left coast to the NY pizza I'm used to) The only one to have desert was the little guy (Gelato) I tasted it and my only critique is it was more like ice-cream that gelato.  As an after note, as busy as this place was when I began to taste my meal the entire restaurant came to a hushed silence awaiting a smile or a frown, as I looked up finishing my first bite of ravioli and smiled broadly a sigh of relief could be heard, amid the quiet voices could be heard, WOW! Why isn't Bill a Yelp Elite 15....my question exactly. It must be my shirt.
On the way out I spoke briefly with Giuseppe the proprietor and complimented him on a job well done! I'd like t give 4+ stars.
author: Bill F.

description:
I have been to this nice neighborhood restaurant 4-5 times, and every time I came out satisfied.  In my most recent visit a couple of days ago, my wife and I used a Travelzoo $35 voucher, which enabled us to order an appetizer, two entrees and a dessert. Contrary to what a couple of reviewers claimed, we were NOT given a limited menu for using the voucher. Yes, we could not order the nightly special. But we could order anything from the regular menu, which was perfectly fine with us. 
We ordered the antipasto misto for appetizer ($13.95). This is a very delicious and very substantial dish. We enjoyed it very much. For entrees, we had Scampi Lido (shrimp scampi) and lamb Shank.
