The scampi was excellent both in presentation and in the quality of the prawns which are very tasty. The lamb shank was tasty but a bit dry, not enough sauce. 

For dessert, we had a custard (forgot the name) with nice wine taste.
The service was excellent and we were very satisfied and felt that the Travelzoo voucher was an excellent deal. Even without the voucher, the price is very reasonable. We will definitely be back for both lunches and dinners.

We would rate this a 4.5 star.
author: Tuck W.

description:
EXTRAORDINARY service, great food, food didn't take long to come out = 5 stars.

Service: They go up and beyond what you ask for. The workers are extremely friendly and polite. They make me feel very at home here. The owner is very hands on and visits almost every table to make sure everything is ok. 

Food:
Brodetto Di Vongole- 
The broth is TO.DIE.FOR. We finished the clams and the bread that came with it and we asked the waiter not to take it away so we could dip the rest of our bread in it. The waiter even offered to heat it up if it got cold later on during our meal. Perfect on a cold day. 
Penne Al Salmone - The saucy was very flavorful and creamy and the salmon was moist and fresh.

Luckily we came past 6pm and didn't have to pay for the meters. 

I will be back Spiazzo!
author: Jonina A.

description:
I came here for my daughter's birthday. It was a simple family dinner for her. The service was really nice and the food was really good! I ordered the mushroom pesto fettucine and my boyfriend ordered the seafood spaghetti. 

The only downside was the server didn't sing or do anything special for my daughter even tho I told the restaurant why we were there. But oh well...

Definitely coming back for the food! :)
author: Jean T.

description: Was seated right away, and the service was great! They have a great selection of food. I had their grilled trout, and their creme brulee, and they were both done to perfection. Will definitely come back here more often!
author: Felipe R.

description: Ordered the shrimp and "lobster" pasta. Lobster was imitation crab meat. I asked my server if they use real lobster to which she replies, "I don't know, let me ask the chef." She came back 10 minutes later and tells me her boss told her it's real lobster. I know what real lobster is and what imitation crab meat is. If it ain't lobster don't say it is..
author: Randy H.

description:
The customer service is here is on point! Everyone is friendly, smiling, and checking on you consistently. I was being checked on by everyone my waiter, other waiters, and it was nice to see the manager at the front of the house, to me it showed commitment to the business. Anyways onto the food! The penne al salmone was absolutely mouthwatering upon first sight, and the first bite was absolute heaven. 
The sauce on the penne al salmone had a perfect texture and delightful color. The quantity of salmon was perfect to me, not overkill but not so little the name wouldn't make sense. Definitely try this dish upon going to this excellent establishment.
Speaking of the establishment the ambiance at dinner was magical, especially for a date but also for a nice outing with the family. Good job Spiazzos from a fellow Italian ;)
author: Jessica C.

description:
The service here is amazing!  The food is good too.  My lady and I ordered the clams for an appetizer (get this you will not regret it) and the salmon penne and some pesto fettuccine.  The pastas were good and hearty, but the clams were amazing.  So was the spread for the breads.

Also, the mimosa deal is for Mother's Day only but the staff was so kind as to honor the yelp deal anyway.  That is the stuff quality service is made of!!!
author: Eric C.

description: Food was great... Server could not slow down to bother with us. We made a reservation and still had to wait a half hour for table. Server never once looked at us... He kept rushing away and I had to signal to call him back. The bruschetta is wonderful: two large pieces of tomato bruschetta and two large pieces of mushroom bruschetta. Very fresh and tasty and filling. Do not order unless more than two to share.Asked for Parmesan on the pasta and he put it all over my seafood. Again - not attentive at all. The only thing that made this 3 stars was the food. I had excellent  scallop and shrimp scampi and it was a very generous portion; had to take half home. My husband had the stuffed pepper and reported it delicious and another large portion. So. Eat here just don't expect attentive service.
author: Carol P.

description:
Is Spiazzo disappointing or just disappointing expensive? It's a question worth some debate. The food isn't bad. If your friend cooked you this food for free you'd think they did a good job and you'd be impressed. But this is a place where I spent $45 on entrees, and I was not. 

I had the stuffed pepper and my boyfriend had a seafood pasta dish. The pepper was full of veal and italian sausage, so why was it so gamy? And not just gamy, also kind of sour. It was not gross; in fact it tasted okay. But it was $20+. How'd it get gamy? There is a secret ingrediant in there that *needs* to come out! 

The seafood pasta dish was a little more successful. It had prawns and scallops. It was okay, but the scallops were not tender. My guess is they were previously frozen, and then they were over cooked. I couldn't do better, but I also wouldn't charge myself that mark up! (It was also a special. Did they just get an especially good deal on frozen scallops?)

Our service was good though. Friendly aussie who steered me away from pricier glasses of wine out of what I took to be geniune appreciation for Montepulciano. I appreciate that, I also enjoyed the wine. 

The restaurant does have some cheaper pasta dishes, I'd give them a try.
author: Luke M.

description:
I loved Spiazzo! 

Reminded me of being in Italy again and how much I missed everything there. 

The menu is a standard Italian menu with first and second and entree courses. 

Owners are from Sicily, so their food reflects that. 

Ordered the mixed appetizer platter with prosciutto, salami, mortodella, mozarella, etc...it was really good. Their breadsticks and bread was also amaazing. 

For for my entree, I ordered the scallop and shrimp pasta? LOVED it, but I was already really full from everything else so I didn't get to eat that much of it. 

My brother ordered this stuffed chicken dish which was AMAZING as well and my mom ordered this seafood pizza. 

The seafood pizza had real seafood, like mussels with the shells on the pizza, it was interesting, but good. Didn't make for a good leftover though. 

I would come back again and definitely not eat beforehand.
author: Alison N.

description: Pesto Fettuccini with mushrooms and cherry tomatoes was terrific. Great service and decent price.
author: Ty L.

description:
I've been there twice. I like the service and the friendly italian waiter.
The food is very good every time I've been there.
I loved the homemade Tiramisu!
author: Tina W.

description:
I will forever crave their perfectly cooked (al dente) pasta. Take notes pasta cookers! 

Great service, great food, great atmosphere! 

Ok, so the pros: 
1) they make me exactly what I want even thought it's not on the menu. (Thank you) 

2) they remember my name! Who does that anymore??

3) short wait even with a small dinning room.

4) super affordable.

The list could go on and on. But bottom line...I don't have a con, and it's my favorite pasta I've ever had...from a restaurant (still love yours grandma' ;) )
author: Andrew B.

description: We can down because my boyfriend had a craving for Italian. We were first hesitate because of the bad reviews on yelp but we were pleasantly surprised. He had Tortelloni In Salsa Rosa which was nice and creamy. I had the Lasagna which was tender and creamy and we'll seasoned.
author: Gordon C.

description: Fantastic customer service. They are super nice. And the food is fantastic. The tiramisu is the best I've ever had.
author: Christopher S.

description:
We had a very nice waiter, the atmosphere is good, but the food was only so-so. 

Salads were pretty good, it seemed strange to me that 3 of the 4 had blue cheese in them. I liked the warm cabbage salad but it was pretty heavy with the bacon and blue cheese. Appetizers were a bit more charred than grilled. Pork chop was good if you like food on the sweeter side.

It was a nice evening but we probably won't be coming back.
author: Ashley J.

description:
I've had the Insalata di Mare - the restaurant's delicious seafood salad - several times. It's filled with tender calamari and clams, olives, vegetables, and tossed with a light lemon dressing. Very flavorful. I've not had anything like it in the city's other Italian restaurants. The eggs and spinach soup is lovely and rich. Tastes like your Grandma's soup with lots of fluffy eggs. 

Spiazzo Cucina Italiana is a cozy place in West Portal. Personal, friendly service and very reasonable prices. It's local and top notch. Highly recommended.
author: Suzie C.

description:
Who would have known a quality Italian restaurant would be found in West Portal?  

Yet there it is.  Quiet, dark, and pleasant.  We were impressed with the dishes, which included a superb capellini, an excellent dish of Italian sausage, and a great Etruscan white bean salad.  Red wine for everyone, and desserts as well.  

In retrospect our mother-in-law, who is not impressed by much these days, told our brother-in-law she had been to "an elegant restaurant" that Saturday.
author: David D.

description: Nice Italian restaurant with nice menu with good prices. I had the seafood pizza and it was okay. There was no cheese on it. I would come here again to try something else. It has a decent interior that is not very big.
author: Denise C.

description:
Food was delicious!.... I would definitely go again! 

Very crowded on a Friday night though. 
They were able to seat our party quickly, I believe because our elderly parents could not have stood waiting for very long, luckily we had a reservation. Thank You. 
It took a half an hour to get our drink and dinner orders. The poor waiter was very busy. 
They could have used a few more waiters. 
Once the order was in the salad, soup and dinner came quickly. 

As I said above the food was great. Everyone in our group was very happy with the dinner.
author: Frank H.

description:
Second time here. I ordered the risotto and it was delish. My friends were not a fan of what they ordered. They were saying their dishes were bland. That was surprising to me because I've tried one of the dishes before and it was delish. Maybe the restaurant was having an "off day". 

Service was attentive. I'll be back but I don't think my friends will be.
author: Jo S.

description: Been going here for going on ten years now. I  give 5 stars for the staff and and atmosphere. the food is good too, but to be honest I always order the same half a dozen Items. I only go for lunch; their  lunch menu is priced well and tasty.
author: Jo J.

description:
I was only gonna give Spiazzo 4 stars but I thought it over and decided that they earned the 5th and final star. Yummy (Italian!) food, friendly service, great portions, flexible!

On a whim, I made reservations for Mother's Day dinner, my treat. I'd been here before with friends on a lunch date but I thought Mom would like this place. If she likes Olive Garden, she'd like authentic Italian, right?! The guy who picked up the phone and took my info was really welcoming. There's polite, and then there's reeeeally welcoming. He was the latter.

Fast forward to 2 days later. Parking was pretty easy, considering it was 6pm on West Portal on a Sunday, Mother's Day no less. We parked virtually in front of Spiazzo and walked in to find our table waiting for us. Our waiter had an Italian accent, which really impressed my dad for some reason. I guess being served by SFSU students at Olive Garden doesn't quite cut it for him. I had a special request for a sauce replacement and he was happy to oblige. He kept offering us plates so we could share. We didn't wanna give them more dishes to clean up afterward but he insisted. Everything went smoothly and our water glasses never went past the halfway point.

We were never pressured or asked to order dessert, but we did. We ordered the cannoli and their cappuccino. Again, they were accomodating with any specifications we had. My mom isn't a coffee drinker, but she'll want a cup every once in a while to go with whatever she's eating. We asked for them to make it into a light cappuccino, and they did so happily. Like I said before, great service. It's the kind of service that you remember, and we'll definitely be back.

My parents were so pleased that they doubled the tip.
author: Olivia V.

description:
Every time that we eat here, it is delicious! And it's on West Portal Avenue right next to the Muni Tunnel for bonus points! Quality ingredients, reasonably priced, authentic Italian food not just run of the mill, Americanized cheese covered carbs here. We first ate at Spiazzo's last August on the inaugural eve in our new house before our kitchen was set up. The staff were extremely friendly and hospitable, especially as we were famished and unfamiliar with the menu. The "vibe" or milieu
of this place is very welcoming and positive.
The pizzas are generously sized personal, thin crusted creations with just a few very fresh toppings that don't overwhelm and a light sprinkling of cheese-basically the style of pizza that we had in Europe. The prosciutto, artichoke, and kalamata olive was heavenly. The fuitta de mar included  A LOT of very fresh clams ( still in the shells!), scallops, Calamari, shrimps, and mussels. The sausage pizza came with whole links which were unusually split lengthwise.

I will save you the time and just recommend that you order the mindblowing salmon penne pasta which is served in a creamy Parma Rosa style sauce. Trust.
I can't believe this is so close to our neighborhood.
author: Antoinette S.

description: this is a nice, classy and popular neighborhood restaurant. conveniently located near west portal muni station. good place to go to for a date before or after a movie at the local theater. good service and good variety of italian fare. ordered the tomato basil and mozzarella appetizer, fish and gnocchi entrees. not too heavy or overly filling which is good. nice selection of wine. will be a regular place for me when i'm in the mood for good italian food.
author: p f.

description:
So I like pasta, but I don't like the exercise I have to do later to burn it off. So whenever my boyfriend and I go out, we always order one plate of pasta, and split it in half. 

We both were in the mood for pasta, but a little scared of the two yelp $$. We ordered a pasta plate, salad, and soup. The waiter was very on top of it, he figured out we wanted everything split in two. He took the extra step to split everything in half and serve our plates that way, instead of us awkwardly trying to figure out how to split soup in half. 

I wasn't wowed by the food, but it was alright. I def pass by on a romantic dinner night when I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Sophia G.

description: This Italian restaurant is a change of pace from the kind of Italian restaurants you might find in the Mission/SOMA/Marina districts. Being in a residential area, the clientele is a bit older and less trendy (read: no hipsters in sight). The best description that comes to mind is that it's good honest Italian food and good honest service, for good honest people. I don't think there is a serious attempt at "authentic" Italian cooking here --- it's "American Italian" food. And I'm OK with it! Great selection on the menu, cheap wine, generous portions. I'd eat here often if I didn't live on the other side of the city!
author: Laurent L.

description:
I was going to let Spiazzo slide by not giving it a review but what the hey... I'll do it anyway even though it's probably going to be the most boring review you'll ever read from me.

I came on a friday eve a few weeks ago and there was 1 table open, which was cool. The hostess was very sweet and friendly. I was greeted by the server about 10 minutes later because the place was packed and seemed understaffed. 

My waitress finally took the order and my husband ordered a pizza and I ordered the lemon caper chicken dish with veggies. My husband enjoyed the pizza but wasn't thrilled. I enjoyed my chicken portion of the meal but the mash and veggies were not cooked well and for $17 my meal have better be foodtastic.

So to say the least I was disappointed with my meal as a whole and then we ordered a tiramisu that was nothing but whip fluff and had to give it back. I instead ordered the apple tart and that was the worst dessert ever. I mean how can you go wrong with dessert? It was bland and not sweet and it tasted like I was eating a loaf of crumbling bread.

Overall I'm not impressed one bit with Spiazzo in service. ambiance or food and not sure if I'll return. I don't quite think they deserve 3 stars but I don't think they deserve 2 stars either so I'm keeping it at 3 and I hope things change soon.
author: V W.

description: Got stuck in traffic right before the tunnel. There was a parking space in front of Spiazzo. It was lunch time. Pulled in, went in, and, hey, how did we end up in Italy?? The food was spectacular! My wife had the roasted eggplant panini with olives and mozzarella was off the charts delicious. The accompanying yukon golds, cooked just right. My order of polenta with Italian sausage was served in a spiced-just-right tomato sauce and was succulent, mouthwatering, in a word 'outstanding'. We topped off the meal with a 'best ever' tiramisu, light and dusted with chocolate and a spot of espresso.  Portions were large so we'll have a second chance to enjoy this fine food at home. We will definitely be back real soon!
author: Gary S.

description:
If you enjoy lots of garlic in your food then this is the place for you!

I had the petto di pollo marsala which the server informed me would include a side of potatoes and vegetables. I was expecting sliced roasted potatoes and was surprised when the potatoes turned out to be mashed and heavily "seasoned" with huge pieces of garlic. I've always associated mashed potatoes as being very American so I found it odd that they were being served in an "Italian" restaurant. 

The chicken wasn't anything special and I wasn't surprised when I found pieces of garlic in the marsala sauce too! I mean who wants to accidentally chow down on slivers of garlic?  

The vegetables were decently cooked and I enjoyed them, minus the garlic of course!

What I did like about this restaurant was that at no point did my dinner party feel rushed by our server. We had a dinner reservation for 6 pm and happily chatted away until 8:30 pm when we decided to leave. Our server never gave us the impression that she wanted us to hurry up and leave, even though she had a line of waiting patrons to seat. Thanks for not rushing us out the door!
author: Elena F.

description: The spaghetti calabrese was pretty bland. I have to agree with previous reviewers that the polenta was saltier than I would have liked. The only good about the meal would have had to be the bread and dipping sauce.
author: Denise L.

description:
I first found this place when I lived in SF about 10 years ago. I don't remember what originally brought me there, but I was surprised at how good it was the first time I went. The food and the prices have always been great. A few years back I visited SF with my parents and my sister and I suggested we go there for dinner. Everybody loved it. My parents recently visited SF. I met up with them and my dad wanted to go back. 

The food is great, the servers are friendly, and the prices are still very reasonable. Every time I've eaten there, even on weeknights, it's been busy. I've never had trouble with having to wait for a table, but I can see how that could happen (especially if you have a large party) because it's not a very big restaurant.

I recently tried the Spaghetti Portofino and it was awesome! The sauce was delicious, the scallops were cooked perfectly, and the prawns and scallops were in generous proportions. Usually when you order a pasta dish with prawns you have to hunt for them and pace yourself to avoid eating all three of them at once, but not at this place.

It's not a fancy restaurant, it's just a small place with excellent food, prices, and service.
author: Matthew R.

description:
I used to come here when I was little, and the owner was Don Franco. I don't remember how the service was but the food was always great and we went there pretty often.

We went in for a Mothers Day late lunch and I was completely disappointed. The service was horrible. The waiter kept forgetting what he was doing and was running around like a headless chicken. The before dinner foccacia came and it was soggy at the bottom. It was apparent that the bread had been made possibly several days before and needed to be thawed out but even that wasn't done right.

I will start off with saying that the Antipasto was like a remember it: Delicious but the portion had significantly decreased. 

My dad ordered some veal thing, and got chicken instead. They took it back and the veal came back, but tasteless with watery sauce. 

My mom ordered risotto with sausage, it was dense and rich but with no flavor she couldn't even eat a quarter of it. 

My three siblings ordered the Spaghetti with meat sauce, and for 3 kids who eat like little garbage disposals they refused to continue eating after a few bites.

For writing this negative review I probably did order the best thing: Lasagna. It was decent, filling and didn't need any extra cheese. 

I definitely won't be coming back here. But if you decide to check it out I would suggest ordering the Antipasto, Lasagna, and for dessert Spumoni
author: Viviana M.

description: I ordered Veal scaloppine with mushrooms in marsala. The meat was very tough and difficult to cut through and chew. Nothing exciting about the Marsala or steamed veggies it was served with. Very tasteless, basic and boring. Trust me, we all had better Italian than this.  Service was ok, but I just realized that they overcharged me. They charged me $26 instead of $17.95 like it says on their menu. Should have realized it earlier (this was on Sunday). Oh, well, lesson learned. I would not recommend it to anyone unless your only other option would be Olive Garden. Meh.
author: Laurie P.

description:
The rating is more for the service. I had the spaghetti portofino which is prawns and scallops in a garlic wine sauce. It had great flavor, cooked just right and was just the right amount of food. 

Our server and the hostess were really friendly, attentive and helpful. Overall we had a great experience here and will be back.

Parking isnt very plentiful in the area.
author: Craig I.

description: I've been telling people to come here for over 20 years but I won't be coming here anymore and I will no longer tell others to come here.  I'm disappointed with the manager and his lack of response to a misstep in service.  The manager has always been there to thank me for my patronage at each visit so this was shocking.
author: De G.

description:
Wandering around West Portal, I, my good friend and her almost-boyfriend decided Italian was in the cards.

Stepping into Spiazzo I was struck at how cramped it is. With someone in the aisle it's almost impossible to move past them.

I ended up ordering the clams which were served in the shell and quite tasty, yet smaller than expected. The bread, which looked fresh baked was also quite good, but the butter was served cold to frozen in foil. Foil wrapped can be okay, but frozen is always a no no.

Our waiter, who throughout the evening acted extremely nervous and unsure, finally topped off our irritation with him when he grabbed almost-boyfriend's beer bottle by the lip and then when he saw it was still full put it back on the table.

I hate that. I mean really really hate that. Fingering bottles is never okay in my book.

3 Stars.
author: Meg T.

description: I checked out the menu outside, and there were so many great tasting things that I was convinced to eat here. The food did not disappoint! I had the stracciatella alla romana and spaghetti bolognese. The soup had really good flavor, but I did bite into a tiny bit of egg shell, which was disconcerting. The spaghetti was al dente and had just the right amount of sauce. Service was really good, too!
author: Rachel H.

description:
enjoy my dinner on a Monday night. We were lucky to find a parking spot in front of the restaurant. 
we order the INSALATA Di SPINACI, Baby spinach and sliced red onions with a warm pancetta (italian bacon) and pine nut dressing . I like the light dressing and the red onions are delicious. 
For appetizer ,we order ANTIPASTO MISTO, mixed hors d oeuvres. It has BRUSCHETTA with tomato and mushroom on top, BRODETTO Di VONGOLE, sauteed clams with garlic, white wine and a touch of red pepper flakes served with garlic crostin and I love the white beans. It taste good.
For pasta, i have the PENNE AL SALMONE. I really like the salmon cooked with the tomato sauce. it was really filling and the sauce tastes so good.

 I have the house wine of the night and it tastes good and yummy
author: Isabelle L.

description: Went here on Valentine's day!  The food was absolutely amazing.  I had the ravioli with lobster in it and it was very tasty.  The food didn't come out all at once though, but it's ok! The owner was apologetic and also a very friendly person. Thank you!
author: Adel H.

description:
My boyfriend and I decided to come here for Valentine's Day, and we had a very easy time getting a reservation at a time we wanted. 

Cons:
- Table space was very cramped, especially on the right side of the restaurant. I felt like my boyfriend (who was sitting closer to foot traffic) got bumped, jostled, and reached around by staff and patrons the whole time we were there.
- I loved the antipasto misto, and thought everything on it was fantastic. However, I believe a dish like that is meant to be shared (hence the serving spoon that comes with it), but most of the antipasti were served on one large crostini, which made sharing sort of laborious.
- The creme brulee was very small. When it came out I remember thinking, "We're paying $7 for this??"

Pros:
+ I love any place that respects a reservation. I reserved a table for 7:15pm, and that's exactly when we were seated.
+ The staff here is great. Despite the fact that the place was packed, we got plenty of attention and care. Food and drinks all came out quickly.
+ Their dishes are very large, so they're good for sharing!
+ I really, really enjoy their food! I was having a so-so experience with the Fettucine alla Genovese even though I'd ordered it before and really liked it. I guess last night I just wasn't feeling it so much ...but I got it to go and when I reheated it at home it was AMAZING. It was the perfect post-work lazy dinner.

Overall, I really like this place. I've been coming here for awhile now, and have always left feeling satisfied by the experience. Their service is on point and you get great Italian food for a comfortable price.
author: Rachel A.

description:
I hadn't gone out for Italian in a while so I was hoping for Spiazzo to satisfy a craving.  But sometimes you want something so bad, you're almost bound for an inevitable letdown.

Not so at Spiazzo for me.  Hit it out of the park.

Pizza con Prosciutto e Rocula - Long strips of prosciutto, copious amounts of arugula, with a fresh hint of basil on a thin crust pizza.  This pizza was amazeballs good.  The crust was deliciously dense, but still crunchy, almost like firmer shortbread (versus other thin crusts that sometimes feel like eating a cracker).  Topped off with a splash of EVOO.  Hella good.
Spaghetti Portofino - Relatively simple white wine based pasta done right.  Perfectly cooked scallops. Shrimp was alright, but not messing up scallops goes a long way in my book.

The starter foccaccia bread was maybe a little tougher than usual, but the accompanying roasted pepper sauce made up for that.  Service was very friendly and drink refills were done with regularity.

Cool spot, not too crowded, excellent food.  If the owners had a South Bay expansion, I'd be there all the time.  But unless that happens, West Portal has got itself a nice little gem that I definitely want to go back to.
author: Alan W.

description:
I have walked past this place for the past decade...and I've always ignored it, as it looked pricey to me.  But that was due to being a college student at first and then I just forgot to go in....lol

So, ten years later, I finally had my first meal here.  While it was worth the wait, I could really smack myself for waiting! lol 

Food = delicious. Focaccia with olive oil and balsamic vinegar were delicious, and addicting as a starter.  Pasta was just perfect. 

Tiramisu was not too sweet, moist and I wanted more! Pineapple strawberry cobbler = fail. It was watery inside. No, not syrupy but watery.

Service = friendly and attentive.

Prices = moderate. Worth the prices.

Overall, enjoyable place.  Must return!
author: Fannie S.

description: Everyone had a wonderful time...the service was excellent, our friend dropped a fork and the server was right there with a new one! The food was wonderful...would have given 5 stars if the decor was a bit more elegant with table cloth and flowers on the table but everyone enjoyed the dining experience.
author: Wanda L.

description: We have been to Spiazzo twice. We went there to celebrate a relative's birthday. There were about 9 of us and an elderly person in a wheelchair. The people there were very accommodating. The food was very tasty, good size dish, service was pleasant, and the price was moderate. We would return again for sure.
author: Nga C.

description: Absolutely great!  Service was excellent and very friendly.  The booth was so comfy, food came out quickly, and the wine by the glass pour was healthy.  Had the pilaf special with meatballs and Italian sausage.  Loved it!   Really deserves 4.5 stars, but not an option.  Salad prices seemed a little high.  Caprese salad is my fave,  but the tomatoes were too hard and tasteless, maybe the season.
author: Kathy G.

description:
This place is GREAT!  I organized a dinner gathering for 14 and informed the restaurant that the group was on a dinner break and that we would need to get in and out in an hour.  During the day I learned that the group would grow to 16...I phoned and alerted them - no problem....then 18 showed up ....still no problem.  The tables were set, water poured and they were waiting for us when we arrived.  The service was very efficient and attentive and the food was delicious!

I had never been to this restaurant before and would recommend them based on their highly accommodating attitude, their excellent service and delicious food.  

Thank you Spiazzos!
author: carol e.

description:
This review concerns not the food, which I would evaluate at about 2.5 stars, but a serious flaw in communication among the staff that resulted in a very poor experience for our party. As in some other reviews here, our party intended to use vouchers for the meals - two of them, applied to our party split into two groups (and seated as far apart as you like). We suspected the restaurant may have a problem with this, so we called them in advance and explicitly asked whether it was permitted, and were told it was fine. When we arrived at the restaurant, we were again told it was fine. Only after the food orders had been taken and preparation was underway were we then informed that it was not fine at all, and that they'd only be accepting one voucher. The problem is not the voucher policy, but the fact that the staff told us one thing up front, twice, and then changed their message well after the meals had been ordered. A third of our party left, and despite the sincere efforts of the waiter, the meal's atmosphere was very unpleasant.
We've eaten at this restaurant many times because we live very near it, but the quality of the food is average when compared to other restaurants of its type in San Francisco. It is therefore the small touches and manners that matter the most.
author: David C.

description:
This place, much like Helen Mirren, is an oldie but goodie. 
Located in West Portal, near the Muni station, it is on the easier side to find parking, even on a saturday night, at least compared to friggin downtown SF where hipsters and super whites emerge from their slumber and prowl the streets at night in search of gourmet coffee and eternal Buddha bliss. On a tangent, anyone else bothered by the notion that more and more of my white friends know more about Asian religion and spirituality than say, ooo...actual Asians? Ask a hipster what a chakra is, and he/ she will most likely tell you. ( I won't explain here what it is though..find out yourself if you don't know) Ask a chinese dude in Chinatown and he will think you are trying to pronounce "shark fin" and lead you to an underground place where they still serve this delicacy, damn the rules. 

My dad, the King of Taiwan, brought out the entire clan to this place last night to celebrate my little sister's 25th name day. Of course, to me, she doesn't look a day over 18. We ate like starving Chinese refugees so here is a list of our shame and gluttony:

Salmon Pizza- very good taste. Crust was thin and chewy. Salmon could've been a bit more tender.
Zuppa-something. the seafood and pasta dish in tomato soup base. The soup is the best part, and be smart and ask for more foccacia bread to mop it up.
Seafood combo pasta in white cream sauce. - very generous portions.
three meat combo- italian sausage, chicken palliard, and lamb shank- not bad..the sausage was a bit salty, the chicken a smidge dry and i wish the rack of lamb was cooked medium, but overall, not a bad plate, and worth the value. 
Chicken marsala - classic dish was good, as evident from the person finishing the entire plate and licking it clean.
Tiramisu cake..nice, sweet, but wish it had more rum flavoring. 
Sweet polenta and white chocolate pudding. a very heady and interesting combo- not for everyone, but you should try it at least once.
author: Jerry C.

description:
I got food poisoning after eating here, and was sick for 2 days.  This is the first time I've ever been sick from eating at a restaurant, and unfortunately I am one of those people that avoids things that make them sick.  Even though the chances of getting sick are rare :(

However, the service was great.  The food came out promptly.  If it's worth anything, everyone else in the restaurant seemed to be thoroughly enjoying the food.
author: Lesliegh H.

description:
Let me not talk about the food, the food is excellent. If a good restaurant meant good food, The would have gotten a 5 star rating.
The four star rating is because of service. They took half an hour to serve us our order. It was not the waiters fault, he was doing hes level best. This place needs more waiters. Period.
author: Caroline G.

description: I love this neighborhood trattoria. Every time I visit San Francisco, I visit this gem. Great wine. Great food. Superb service. I hate to even post this review because I may not want my gem of a restaurant to be overcrowded with tourists. But, it's worth the travel time from downtown.
author: Neva G.

description: It is a true gem in the neighborhood, being frequented by older folks who have lived in the area for a while.  We saw lots of families: kids being in their late teens or early 20-s with their parents and older couples without kids. Portions are huge, food is excellent, service is fast and pleasant. On a Saturday night it was very crowded.  I am glad I made reservation for 6pm, and when we came, there wasn't a single table available, with a few people yet waiting  to be seated.  Appetizers: bruschetta, grilled  portabella mushroom, Caprese, and appetizer of layered goat cheese, zucchini and eggplant. Entrees: mushroom risotto and shank of lamb were superb.  Lamb was very tender. Pasta was creamy and saucy. Overall the food was great.  Next time we will definitely share an entree. Without drinks our bill was around $134.  Not bad at all. Place it's not pretentious, any time we need a filling hearty dinner, it's there, and no need to travel far.
author: Dmitry G.

description:
This restaurant was perfect for our situation this weekend. We needed a convenient, mid-range $$ restaurant to take some family out to eat after our daughter's ballet recital. 

I called and made reservations Saturday at 1pm for our party of 7 for 3:30pm. The serving staff was very accommodating for our three kids and brought out one entree right away so our daughter could get to the next show. 

The food was good and the service was excellent, so much so that we returned Sunday to eat there again with other visiting family. Sunday we had four kids, great service, and our out of town guests were very happy with the food and atmosphere. 

We will definitely go back the next time we are in the mood for pasta and/or need to entertain a bigger group on short notice.
author: Luis A.

description:
You'll need a fork, knife, spoon and bib.

The fork: To swirl the spaghetti in the excellent Zuppa Di Pesce (clams, shrimp, calamari, scallops and seasonal fish all in a tomato broth).

The knife: To put the delicious tomato spread on the thick wheat bread that comes on the side.

The spoon: To have the remaining tomato broth after you finish the seafood and spaghetti.

The bib: To wear to make sure you don't get any of the above on your shirt.

Served by a friendly waiter in a charming and welcoming space.

Left very satisfied and happy. And with a clean shirt. Barely.
author: Jason B.

description: I sit down at the table and am served with water that has hair and other funky stuff floating in it. They then put the tableware on the table and the fork had some baked on food stuff on it. I then started eating my lasagna bolognese and it was extremely soft. And by extremely soft, I mean I literally did not and did not need to chew.. I drank it like soup... Undesirable experience. The only good part about this visit was the waiter whom had a pleasing and welcoming attitude.
author: michael l.

description:
Five of us came here on a Wednesday night for dinner.  We arrived at 6:30 and the restaurant was filling up. We were promptly seated and brought  two different types of homemade bread with butter and a delicious tomato spread.  
I had the spinach and ricotta cheese ravioli which was delicious - others in our group had spaghetti with various seafood and all were good! Even though the restaurant was completely packed we never felt rushed to vacate our table while we lingered in conversation after we paid the bill
author: Bumble B.

description:
I've eaten a lot of polenta in my life - most rank in the mediocre category. However, I'm rating Spiazzo's polenta appetizer 5 stars, because honestly? It's the best polenta I've ever eaten. EVER. The grilled cornmeal cake breaks at the touch of your fork. It sits atop a tomato & mushroom sauce that's full of flavor. The mushrooms are tender and work well with the tomato & parmasean sauce. Not to mention a whole clove of grilled garlic is served with the dish. Yeah, a whole clove!The garlic pieces are cooked so that they are so soft you could squeeze out the garlic onto each bite. 

Now if that doesn't convince you to go try it, I don't know what will.
author: Brittany J.

description:
We've eaten at a variety of Italian restaurants in the Bay Area and sadly this is one we won't be re-visiting. Additionally, being part Italian myself and having grandparents that cooked Italian food, I have a particular taste of what I'm looking for with "Italian" food.  I'll go in order of what we ordered for simplicity's sake.

Instead of getting traditional bread and butter when you're seated, they gave you bread and tomato sauce, which I thought was a neat idea, until I tried the tomato sauce.  It was cold like it was just taken out of the refrigerator and tasted generic like it was out of a jar.

The salads we ordered also felt generic and covered in ceasar salad dressing.  

I ordered the tortellini soup for my daughter which was $6.50.  That soup had about (10) tortellini floating in it.  

For my main course I ordered the stuffed red bell pepper dish.  Instead of getting a stuffed red bell pepper, I got 4 meatballs which seemed to have all the ingredients the stuffed red bell pepper was supposed to have.  Not what I ordered however, and they were even slightly burnt on the bottom.  

The wait staff did a good job and were attentive but felt a bit overwhelmed by the amount of tables assigned to them, thus there wasn't a real personal interaction with them.

Overall, friendly staff but subpar Italian food.  This will be our first and only visit.
author: Jason C.

description:
This place really set the bar for my next Italian food venture. The service was prompt and considerate, te food was delicious, and never was there a time when my water and coffee were left empty.

Got the Insalata Caprese and the basil really made the dish come alive in my tongue; shared a plate of sausage risotto and I'm glad it was shared because that was a generously indulgent portion of magical starch; the ravioli with chicken was also good, ravioli were perfectly formed and sauce was neither overly rich nor bland. I wish I stayed for dessert, but I had to leave in a hurry, but I would definitely give this place another go!
author: M Y.

description:
Really exceptional, authentic Italian cuisine.
We made a reservation for twelve people, but only nine of us made it.
The management didn't complain at all. They were very patient and service was top notch!
Very polite, professional and accommodating to everyone at our table.
We had a complicated payment system (most people did not have cash on them), but they just went with it. 

Everyone ordered something different and no one was disappointed. The food arrive hot and pasta was al dente.

I took off one star because of the pizza. It was a case of FORM over FUNCTION, 

Here's what happened. 

I decided on a pizza with my four favorite toppings:
prosciutto, artichokes, mushrooms and olives.
I loved the crust and the flavor. But they organized the toppings in a way that LOOKED good, but did not TASTE right.

In other words, they arranged the prosciutto on one half of the pizza, and the veggies on the other half. Then they cut the pizza into slices so that EACH slice had exactly ONE kind of topping (e.g., all olives, all artichoke, etc.)!
It was a chore to remove the toppings from the gooey cheese in order to rearrange them on to other slices.
I would much prefer a slice of pizza that contained a variety of toppings together on the same slice. I suggest they focus on making the pizza taste good rather than look unique. It's about FUNCTION, not FORM, guys!

Again, aside from the pizza thing, top notch service and excellent food for the money. A great value!
author: Earthling G.

description:
Had a nice lunch on a drizzly SF day with gal pals.  Food was good.  We shared a fresh salad, 4 flavored pizza, pasta with clams.  Everything was tasty and we ate it up.  Waiter was attentive without being overbearing; he filled our water glasses without being asked.  
We found easy meterless parking in the streets surrounding West Portal.
I would return for the pasta and would definitely like to try their other dishes next time.
author: el h.

description:
Came here to try the living social deal. Totally worth it.

Pros:
-very nice waiter, very attentive. The servers refilled our water glasses before they were even half empty! 

-nice environment, has a fine dining hint to it, but still casual

-food was flavorful. I ordered the spaghetti portofino. Four pretty plump shrimps. The veal and half roasted chicken were also good portion sizes and came with good sides. The appetizer (i forgot the name, it was $14) had a lot of variety and the bruschetta was delicious 

Cons:
-the service was too attentive? But that's too picky of me.
-Tiramisu was okay.


Good italian food for what you're paying. I would come back.
author: Glo Y.

description:
We were in SF for a night to visit my daughter who is a student at SFSU and for a show at The Fillmore.  It was a Saturday night around 7:30 p.m. and we ended up at Spiazzo on a fluke, after choosing not to wait 30-40 minutes for Latin American food across the street.  

SERVICE:  We walked in and they seemed pretty busy, but we were seated right away for a table of four,  right in the front near the window.   Perfect.  We were met with friendly, warm and VERY attentive service from the get go and this was consistent throughout our meal.  Their timing was great from refreshing our waters, to taking our order and clearing plates-- the service was neither over-bearing nor did we for a moment feel we'd been forgotten about, which can so often be the case at restaurants, especially on a Saturday night.  

FOOD:  The bread they brought out was so fresh and we LOVED the olive dip that came out with it.  We ordered a Pizza Margherita, the Risotto, Zuppa Di Pesce and two items off of their specials-- an entree and an appetizer, none of which I can remember the names of, at the moment.  Everything came out together shortly after finishing our appetizer.  Everything was absolutely spot on!   Flavorful and fresh.  Unfortunately, we were all too full to have dessert.  Had we not had a show to get to, we would have ordered some desserts to go.  

When I looked at the check, which came to $89.51, I whispered out loud to my family, "That's it?"  I was easily expecting it to come to much more for all that we got and left a nice tip.    

We will definitely return again when we are back in town and craving Italian. We would love to further explore their menu.  We will be sure to give ourselves plenty of time so we can relax into the experience a little more.  We didn't have to tell them we had a show to get to-- their service was so great, but we all agreed it was a place to come back to when we aren't feeling bound to a deadline to get somewhere else.  

I have been lucky in my travels to have eaten in some fabulous restaurants in some great cities-  NYC, Seattle, Portland, L.A. and Minneapolis and have had a yelp account for years, but just never got around to actually posting a review-- mostly just using the site to find restaurants.    This place inspired me to post my first review.  On the food or the service alone I would have easily given 4 stars, but the combination of excellent service and amazing food,  5 stars are very well deserved! 

 Thank you Spiazzo for making our night so enjoyable!
author: Amani Z.

description:
Some really nice food. I had gone on 5/18/2012 around 7:30pm, around graduation occuring at SFSU. I knew it was going to be packed, but thankfully my group got seated in no more than 15 min (after being told it would be about 5). 

Fresh bread brought to the table, a little hard on the bottom, and waters. Waiter asked twice if we had any questions and was giving us appropriate time to think it over. Good variety on the menu, but typical for an Italian restaurant. As a vegetarian, I thought I had a good amount to choose from. 

Ended up ordering the gnocchi and a side of green beans. So delicious!!! Gnocchi was so fresh and soft, not rubbery at all. Good amount as well, but definitely super full once I was nearing the finish line! Wine selection was nice too.

We had waited a little longer than usual, but we knew it would be busy. 

Now, the good part! Deserts were SO GOOD! Between the three of us, we split Zanze's cheesecake, the Spumoni, and the tiramisu. The cheesecake was a must; a local SF bakery and can only be ordered in cakes, so soft and not overpowering. Spumoni was DELICIOUS, pistachio ice cream was on par. Tiramisu was a gracious serving, soft soft soft.

Overall a generous experience. Pricing was decent, not over-priced. Just the right amount for a "nice dinner". The restaurant is fairly small, but the wait usually doesn't take too long. 

$$ w/o wine, $$$ w/ wine
author: Sophie C.

description:
I've been here a few times with different people and I always have a great experience with good food. Great for a date or just a good dinner with friends. 
You MUST get the bruschetta. Wine list can be a bit pricey but delicious. Love the old feel of this place, the food and the service.
author: Lauren J.

description:
Live near the neighborhood, decided to try it through a living social deal. Nothing really stands out on the menu, until you taste it. 

The lasagna bolonese surprised me, thin sheets of pasta impossibly stacked in sauce that was rich, flavorful and slightly tangy. It reminded me of the best lasagna I had in Rome 4 years ago. Not perfect but pretty damn good. 

Entrees are 12 to 15 dollars (even on the dinner menu) and well portioned. You will not leave hungry. This is classic Italian-American cuisine done very well. Don't expect Aquarello, but it blows pasta pomodoro out of the water. 

The wait staff was friendly and patient while we sipped our cappuccino's after our lunch. It was dead at lunch on a Thursday afternoon, but that's the way I like, it nice and quiet.
author: Asa S.

description:
Came here a couple months ago but haven't had a chance to write a review.  A nice neighborhood Italian place.

Huge apps! Goat cheese/eggplant, polenta was delicious, although a bit on the salty side. It had mushrooms and sauce...I thought it was very good. I had the flank steak. my husband had veal. Both good. Dessert--zabaglione and tartufo which we enjoyed.  We also had a bottle of wine. For the amount of food and drink we had, the price was not bad.  A good value.

They have a huge menu! Good service, and unpretentious. Would come back.
author: Rosie S.

description: We had a party of 9 with 4 kids and the hostess, bussers and waiters were so friendly and easygoing. The bread bowl brought first was home-baked - aromas of Grandma's kitchen came to mind. We ordered a variety of dishes and everyone, from the kids eating the cheese pizza to the adults eating large pasta and meat dishes - were gasping at the deep flavors, savory sauces and perfection of the cuts of meat. We finished with a tiramisu that was one of the best we'd  ever had, thick layers of cream, flavors of rum and espresso with powder of chocolate. It was a completely wonderful experience from beginning to end.
author: Christina C.

description: Great food! So so deserts! Good wine list!
author: Wendee K.

description:
I haven't enjoyed eating at an Italian restaurant in a long time and was really craving some pasta.

This restaurant was fantastic and did not disappoint! I loved the small, homey yet elegant atmosphere. 

I really liked the bread and accompanying sauce. I was expecting the usual olive oil/vinegar dressing, but instead the bread came with a zesty, creamy, sweet sauce. Really nice.

The bruschetta was the BEST I've EVER had. YOU MUST TRY THIS DISH! 

The portion sizes were good and the price reasonable for what you get. I had the linguine with clams which was fantastic and the clams were really fresh. Paired it with a lovely Merlot on the suggestion of our waiter.

Just thinking about this place makes me want to go back and try the other dishes!
author: Barbara W.

description:
I didn't think I would be wowed by Spiazzo.  I just wanted to try something new for my birthday.  Considering the neighborhood, I thought i would be paying through the nose.  However, their menu is probably one of the least expensive I've seen for an Italian restaurant.  

We were seated promptly with water and bread.  The lighting was fantastic.  It was romantic, but not too dark.  Actually, it was dark and bright in the right places.  The tabletops were well lit, but all the surrounding areas were dim.  It looked like the plates were glowing!  The staff and owner were extremely nice.  I seriously have never felt so welcome at a fancy restaurant.  

I ordered the penne al salmone and raspberry italian soda.  The italian soda was not too sweet, but had enough syrup.  But check this out! I eat a lot, and my penne order was so big, that I could only eat half.  I'm saving the rest for lunch tomorrow.  I just had to get dessert, so I ordered the creme brulee.  What I liked a lot about this dessert was that it was not too sweet so you can appreciated the custard flavor.  

I definitely will come back.  Great service, awesome ambiance, and delicious food.  Don't hesitate.  Run
author: Lisa X.

description:
Ordered the Fusilli with pesto, mushrooms, and tomatoes. The dish was not bad. The pesto sauce was  rich and the freshly grated Parmesan cheese on top was a nice touch.
Service was fast and friendly and the restaurant was nice and relaxing.
Prices are $12 and up for most entrees but they have a nice selection of pastas, pizzas, and meat entrees on their menu. Portions were big!
Wouldn't mind returning if I am in the West Portal area but would prefer to try a different dish next time
author: Miss H K.

description:
clam was fine. broth was good enough to dunk the bread into and enjoy, a bit on the salty side.  

pizza was terrible. bad bread, cardboard-y feel and poor quality cheese. 

service was good
author: Hannah W.

description:
Cute little neighborhood restaurant! We tried their stuffed eggplant appetizer, their smoked salmon penne and sausage pizza. Everything was pretty good, but nothing really stood out or was particularly memorable.

What I do remember though was the unhelpful hostess. After our waiter, who I think was the owner, took our order, I changed my mind and wanted to switch my dish. So I rushed over to the hostess and told her I wanted to change my order because I wanted to make sure they didn't start making it. The hostess was busying texting on her cell phone and brushed me off telling me to go look for my waiter myself and tell him the change. I had to walk to the back of the restaurant and wait by the entrance to the kitchen till I saw my waiter to tell him to change my order. PET PEEVE: Unhelpful customer service.

Otherwise, our waiter/the owner was helpful and attentive. We enjoyed our dinner, spent about $45, and took home half the pizza. We left satisfied, with the hostess hiding in the back of the restaurant because I scared her with my disapproving stare.
author: Christine L.

description: This is the go-to neighborhood place. My favorite is the lamb chops, perfectly done. You get about two chops on a bed of zucchini and green beans. Strangely, this time it came with two pieces of pounded, flat chicken and Italian sausage. I got a feeling it was late and they were short on lamb chops. Instead of 3 lamb chops, they have you 2 and whatever was leftover in the kitchen. We started with seafood salad. The dressing was way too much (I should have asked for it on the side). It might be too sour for some people. It came with four little clams, calamari, and shrimp, and lettuce. It's a bit underwhelming. The prawns scampi was good size prawns with buttery sauce. Service is always excellent. This must be wine place, because most every table had a glass of wine.
author: Helen L.

description:
We first discovered this place two years ago when we were trying to figure out were to celebrate our two year anniversary. And since then its become one of our favorite spots to dine.

The staff is always friendly and attentive. And the food is delicious and flavorful. 

Try to catch them on weekdays away from the lunch/dinner rush.
author: Shantall E.

description: I still love this place - have been visiting every so often and just recently we had a reservation for 20 and it was a blast!!!! the food came out promptly, the wine never stopped pouring... the food as always, hot and delish... Stuffed eggplant is still made the same beautiful way, order pastas and the chef is always happy to make it to your special order - desserts are terrific as well - most importantly - order great wine and come with good company- you won't be disappointed :)
author: Zayka Z.

description: This is my favorite restaurant in the world, and has been since I moved to West Portal in 2002. I don't live in the neighborhood anymore but basically every time I'm in The City I come to see these guys, as much for the friendly owners as for the food. We always get the ravioli naturale and some other entree, and nothing has ever disappointed, but the fish particularly is always excellent. Spiazzo is where I learned to love red wine, especially Sangiovese ... This restaurant is so important to me for so many reasons. I imagine I'll be eating here until I die. My last meal will end with their tiramisu and glass of Vin Santo.
author: T K.

description:
A very good Italian restaurant in the West Portal Area.  Came here last night due to a Living Social deal.  Service was prompt and friendly, and they provided us with complimentary bread, served with a tomato/basil spread.  We ordered the 3 Mushroom appetizer($10), which was really delicious.  It's sautéed portabello, white, and wild mushrooms served with garlic crostini in a garlicky wine sauce.  Mmm, so good. 

We also got the Spaghetti Portofino ($15), which consisted of 4 shrimp and 9 scallops, cooked in a white wine and garlic sauce.  This too was delicious, as the sauce worked very well with the pasta and the seafood.  Furthermore, I thought they were very generous with the amount of seafood and pasta that they give you.  

Finally, we got the New Zealand Lamb Chops, Chicken Paillard, and Italian Sausage dish ($21), which came with sautéed vegetables. This too, was a large portion, but I thought that the lamb was a tad dry and the chicken was very dry.  The flavor of all 3 meats were ok, as they were seasoned well, but none of them particularly stood out.  

I would go back for the pasta and to try some other dishes.  It helped that we were able to get $20 off due to the Living Social coupon, but the prices here are already decent for good Italian food that's relatively close to the Sunset.
author: Tyler C.

description:
This was a near miss for me; potential, but not quite there.

The atmosphere and service were nice, but the food was hit or miss.  Starting with the bread they brought out -- the white bread was very good, the wheat version was dry, heavy and tasteless.  We shared a sauteed mushroom appetizer, which was fine, nothing special.  The waiter recommended the Ono, and since this may be my favorite fish, I tried it.  The sauce, and the rosemary potatoes and veggies, were pretty good, but the fish was quite a bit overcooked.  Similarly, the zuppe di pesce had a decent flavor sauce, but the seafood was all way overcooked.  i know it's easy to overcook seafood, but....

One thing -- the tables (at least the 2 person table) are pretty small, and lots of the serving dishes are quite large (as you can see in some of these pics).  Our waiter had to repeatedly rearrange the table each time he brought out our food, often moving things to the empty next table while doing so to make room.  Might want to re-think the size of the plates and such.

I may well try again; with a little improvement, this could easily get another star or two.
author: John R.

description: Excellent service but deceptive food sourcing ... Beware.   I have not experienced a fraud as systematic since the subprime crisis of 2008.  Similarly no one will go to jail, no one will be held accountable.   Let me explain.   My girlfriend and I went out for a post-fight dinner.  We thought an Italian dinner would allow for truth and reconciliation.  She ordered the fettuccini lobster.   However instead of lobster it was imitation crab.  The horror, the deception.  (Note my girlfriend is an aficionado of seafood having spent summers commercial fishing with her father.   She is like a young Jacque Cousteau). When she pointed the error out the owner did not acknowledge the culinary fraud perpetrated.   Let me absolutely unequivocal - I shutter to think about the allergic reaction that could have taken place.   The owner should be ashamed as he has tarnished the gastronomic delights of Italy and challenged culinary nirvana.  This west Portal establishment should avoided at all costs.  Todaraba and Shana Tova
author: Anand R.

description:
My friend and I ate dinner here last night and would never return.  Everything we had (salad, this eggplant/goat cheese/red pepper appetizer concoction, and the shrimp/scallop pasta) was utterly mediocre.  And when you live in San Francisco, mediocre is so inexcusable, it merits one star only.

Nothing was seasoned effectively.  Flavors were monochromatic.  The seafood in the pasta had clearly been frozen.  The service was, at least, acceptable.  

With so many other options in this city, don't waste your time at this lackluster joint.
author: Jill T.

description:
YUM.  I am so glad I found this restaurant.  Instead of traveling to North Beach for some tasty pasta, we only have to travel 8 minutes.  Parking can be tricky, but you can find something within 5-10 minutes.  I've been here on 2 seperate ocassions, both times with reservations.  The food comes out within a reasonable time frame, so the wait for a table isn't so bad if you don't have a reservation.

There is a dish that my husband LOVES.  Its the spagetti with shrimp and scallops.  He can't get enough of it.  I've ordered the salmon with penne, which is a bit fishy for me.. (I do like fish but the fish taste was overwhelming)  I ordered the lasagna another time, and it was a bit heavy on the cheese for me.  I ordered a special pizza, I don't recall the name, it had fresh mozz with tomatoes and olives.. now THAT was good.

I expect to be back within a few weeks.. I'll update along the way with what dishes I heart.
author: Alice E.

description: Great food, nice staff, but damn it they couldn't have rushed us any more to get out! I understand it's Christmas Eve, and they want to get home to their families, but we came in an hour before they closed. They got the food to the table really quickly which was fine since we weren't there for a relaxing dinner anyways (luckily!). I may come here again at an earlier time, but I was very put off by the rush to get us out!
author: Aliyah H.

description: Had a surprise dinner there last night for my boyfriend birthday, I just have to say what excellent service we had, don't remember his name but I did tell how great he was, also the food was beyond amazing.. We all we supper impressed with everything. Can't wait to go back and try new dish:)) thanks for making our first experience with you guys a great one....
author: Monica M.

description: Just finished a very nice dinner here.  Son ordered the eggplant appetizer (since they don't have eggplant parm).  Daughter got penne w/ salmon.  Wife got spinach & egg soup and I ordered the pizza w/ calamari, shrimp, clams, scallops & mussels.  We all shared Caesar salad.  Overall we were very pleased with our 1st visit.  The service was attentive and the food came out fairly quickly (the restaurant was about 1/4 full at 6PM Friday night).  Loved the bread with the tomato dipping sauce.  A solid 4, maybe 4+.  Thanks!
author: mike f.

description: Great place. Ten people we all agree food, service, price, well worth eating out. Seafood salads, must try. Pasta cooked to perfection. Will return.
author: Karen H.

description: This place is FABulous! We just had our staff lunch here, as a table of 18, a challenge for any server. I ordered the coffee, and had my cup refilled FIVE times, that says great service to me! The Pollo Marsala was decadent, flavor in every bite. As you'll read in most reviews, this is a very sweet and accomodating staff. The warm bread they serve kept coming, and even though the salad was simple, it was delicious. Big enough for one large party (we took over almost half the restaurant), but I would totally recommend it as date night perfection.
author: Alexis O.

description:
I always call this place "Spazzios" even though I know it's Spiazzo's...is that sacrilegious? 

I'm not sure of my visit count at this point, but I believe I've been here at least 5 times. I've always enjoyed my meals. The servers are always very nice and can have advice if you have questions about any dish or wine. 

The bolognese is always my fall back if I want something sort of basic. I also love the "Spagetti Portofino" -- shrimp in a white wine and garlic sauce.
author: Jennifer P.

description: Really nice staff, and there were not many options at 9 pm on a Tuesday night in West Portal. Seriously, there was nothing open it seemed like besides the irish pub. They welcomed us in, assured us they were open till 10:30, although it felt like they were closed at 10. The bread was stale, sadly all three kinds offered to us. My pasta dish Penne Alla Campagnola, was actually really good- and was suggested by our waiter. My friend's gnocchi was really bland and overwhelmingly dense. She said it was edible, but who wants a large portion of chewy bland dumplings? Anyway if we were in a pinch again, we would go back and both order what I got. Again, super nice staff and the other patrons seemed happy. Maybe it was an off night for the bread and gnocchi?
author: Kassaundra G.

description:
We love this restaurant!  The food is great and we come here at least once a month.  I LOVE the spaghetti bolognese.  The staff is friendly and recognize us everytime we come.

Highly recommended!
author: Marcus L.

description:
Had: 
Seafood salad
Margarita Pizza
Chianti

The good: Pleasant, quiet place for late lunch. Free bread & aioli.

The not-so-good: 

Salad: The menu says the seafood salad comes with a mustard/lemon dressing. That sounds nice & light, doesn't it? It's actually a pretty heavy mayonnaise dressing with maybe a hint of mustard. Didn't taste any lemon at all. We tried to get it with the dressing on the side, but the waiter said that wasn't an option.

The seafood itself is not fresh and rather rubbery. 

Pizza: Dough was fresh. Sauce tasted good. Disappointed they used packaged/shredded  mozzarella instead of fresh.

Overall: If they didn't try to economize with substandard ingredients here & there, the food would match the pricing. I may try a pasta dish sometime in the future but am not inclined to return.
author: Gene G.

description:
Midweek lunch for four adults of varying generations and tastes.  The food was fine but boring - especially for the price.  I would have preferred a much smaller serving of pasta and sauce in exchange for more 'toppings'; my leftover mushroom and peas in cream sauce over spaghetti was greatly improved by the addition of finely chopped string beans, white beans, chopped tomato, a dash of balsamic, and a dash of paprika.

The ambiance was older San Francisco.  The service was polite, and sufficiently speedy.  Our table near the window got plenty of natural lighting.  The noise level was low, though we left before most of the lunch crowd arrived.  The seating was on two fairly comfortable banquets.
author: Peni Soo G.

description: My siblings brought me here for my birthday and I truly had a wonderful time. They made the stuffed eggplant on the appetizer menu to an entrée with my preferred angel hair pasta and my husband likes it too. Despite feeling sooooo full, four of us shared a creme Brulee and a assortment of gelato... of course the "dessert stomach" filled up too. I have to mention our waitress is just so sweet and professional and she made the evening really lovely.
author: Chung T.

description:
I went here for my birthday and they were able to accommodate our party size of about 12 people because we got there early (6 PM). 
The food is good. I ordered the salmon pizza which was delicious.
I was more impressed with the service. They were very attentive and patient, since most of us didn't know what to order. And they didn't charge me extra for bringing a cake.
author: Jessica C.

description: The service is very attentive and friendly, but my pasta with clams, zucchini and cherry tomatoes wasn't delicious or special. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing, but I don't think I'll go back.
author: Susan B.

description:
Pretty disappointing.  Why?

1. papperdelle pasta with sausage special was way too salty. the sauce was decent, but overall, nothing special. 
2. quattro pizza was not very good. it's weird. they don't mix the artichoke, mushroom, olives, and proscuitto.they put all the olives on one slice, all the mushrooms on another, etc. what the? the crust wasn't crispy at all and the bottom of the pizza tasted undercooked or unfinished. 
3. service was okay, but very rushed

Will not be back....
author: Caroline L.

description:
Wonderful meal !!! Great staff. New years eve packed and still was treated like the only couple. Food was great. Price was just a fantastic as the meal. 
T
author: todd r.

description:
Came to Spiazzo on a rainy SF night w/my mom so we could talk. It worked out great as the tables are close together, though the noise level isn't so that you hear everyone else's conversations, too.

Our waiter and bussers provided excellent service. They were on top of everything. Needed more water? They got it before I noticed I was out. Another glass of wine, they asked if we wanted another to pair with the entree. 

Upon sitting down, they brought us basket with very warm, assortment of fresh baked breads. I think it was the rosemary sourdough - amazing! Oh, and they also served it with some sort of roasted red pepper tapanade that was hard to get enough of. Man I sound like a pig. This place does Italian food right! Not heaping portions, but intense and fresh flavors. 

For my entree, I had the angel hair pasta with tomatoes, basil, garlic and a light cream sauce. Even though it was a pretty simple dish, the flavors were incredible. Normally, I have leftovers when I leave a restaurant. Not this time! It was too good. My mom ordered a fish dish which she also raved about. 

It's nice casual dining. Restaurant could have been warmer inside, though maybe that was because it was raining so much? Anyway, will definitely be back during another trip to the city.
author: ciara c.

description: Really yummy ravioli! My husband had the lasagna, which I tried as well; It was good, but not as good as my dish. The bread was very soft (how we prefer it) and came with a tasty dipping sauce - a fun touch. We also had the beef carpaccio, but it was nothing to write home about. Finally, the service was great and the food came out fast. Overall a happy dining experience!
author: Shannon K.

description: I'm not changing my rating since I didn't have a chance to visit the restaurant a second time. But I wanted to point out that after my first review, the owner contacted me to follow up on my experience and I appreciate that management takes time in reading these reviews. It shows that they care and that they are taking steps to make improvements.
author: Elaine C.

description:
I've been here twice with my wife, it's in our favorite little area near our house, West Portal. 

We come here to celebrate special occasions and are never disappointed. 

I've had the TAGLIATA Al BALSAMICO and we like their good wine selection.
author: Ryan D.

description:
What a terrible experience. 
I ordered a $13.50 pretty well known pasta dish known as penne primavera (!) and everything, not exaggerating, on that dish was overcooked. The pasta and broccoli became mush and the chicken was completely devoid of any moisture. This seriously is one of the most simple dishes that any half decent cook shouldn't be even remotely capable of messing up every aspect. 

To make matters worse the service was awful. Our server got half of our group's orders wrong. True the restaurant was filled, but it was filled with people above 60... No offense: but seniors do not require so much attention that the waiter would be completely frazzled when he gets to our table that he couldn't tell the difference between salmon and seafood. 

So we got our dishes and my friend noticed that it was the wrong dish, and the old italian man who i thought was the owner of the restaurant, but i guess he's just some random senior waiter, exclaimed "I can't believe he made the same mistake again", referring to the server who took our orders. 

Thankfully, to the restaurant at least, one of my friends who we were waiting for, but never had the intention of eating, walked into the restaurant and decided to sit down with us. The old man sold him the dish, (my friend usually falls for the sales pitch), and was vague about whether or not we had to pay for their mistake. 

By the time the receipt came, we were all already so disappointed with our meals that we couldn't take any more losses to our dignity. Lo and behold, the incorrect dish was on the bill. It was pouring that day, and we were already late so we paid just the meal prices but no tip. He said he enjoyed the dish so he wasn't unwilling to pay for it.
author: Alan H.

description:
Wandered into Spiazzo last night with Mom after seeing a movie down the street and we had the loveliest time.  The place was hopping but our server was warm, attentive, and accommodating.   

I started with a very tasty salad with pears and walnuts and Mom's homemade minestrone was chunky and flavorful.   Mom's pasta with meat sauce was also delicious and my roast chicken, honestly, was one of the best of the many roast chickens on a plate that I have ordered anywhere--moist and flavorful with a side of mixed veggies I actually ate every scrap of.   For dessert we split a cannoli to die for.

Can't wait to come back and try the pizza.
author: Michelle C.

description: I had the spaghetti and it was a pretty good dinner. Nice tasty sauce and still savoring it now! Definitely will be back.
author: Jim K.

description:
Spazzio's is great. I came here with a large party of 8 and the wait staff was very attentive and professional. 

The food is delicious and reasonably priced. Some of the things we ordered were the: 

PIZZA CON SALSICCE - Personal pizza with about 6 good size slices (could share between 2 people) and each slice had a sausage on it. 

SPAGHETTI PORTOFINO - Great portion size and the sauce was so delicious! Also good portion of scallops. 

SPAGHETTI ALLA VONGOLE - Perfect with the spice and a great portion size. 

The portion size is really good and the service is great. Would definitely recommend this place to Italiano food lovers :)
author: Ashley s.

description:
This Italian place is not bad.  Had the antipasto misto and fettuccine gamberoni.  Tasty.  Antipasto misto contains bites of various appetizers they had and fettucine is well...shrimp fettuccine.  I love the garlic tomato sauce and that they put chili flakes in it.  Nice kick and different from the usual Italian pasta.

For the price you pay, it is pretty good.  Just be sure all your party members are there, or you won't get seated.  Even if your other party members are nearby and looking for parking or walking towards the restaurant, they will not seat you.  Boo...
author: Linda C.

description:
I've been to Spiazzo's a few times.  The service has always been friendly enough, and fairly efficient.  I usually stick with the saltimbocca.

Until my last experience I probably would have given these guys three-stars, but if my last experience had been my only experience they would have gotten 1 star.

I'll say the menu has never been inspiring, it is very run of the mill. But since it was a special occasion I ordered the lamb chops.  As soon as it arrived I knew it was a mistake.  The chops were butchered, they were oddly shaped and extremely thin (extremely) and cooked on both sides.

I cut into it and it was well done.  Lamb should be cooked to medium-rare and if you're in a restaurant and they don't ask you what temperature you want your lamb, you should expect it to be medium rare.

I took one bite and it really was inedible.  I tried to flag my waiter... and then any waiter down.  But every waiter, busser, etc... in the restaurant seemed to be on the other side of the room or in the front, or in any other way NOT looking at our table and I ended up waiting and waiting just to tell someone that this is not what I wanted.

Finally our waiter came back and even though I was flagging him down, and told him the meat was overcooked, he must have mis-heard me because he asked "You want it cooked more?"

I repeated that it was OVERdone and I asked for a menu.  I ended up ordering pasta, thinking it would come out quickly since my friend already had his entree.  It took 15 min and my friend was finished before I got my dinner.

I *might* give them another chance sometime, but not anytime soon.
author: P K.

description:
A friend and I made our first visit today.  We went for dinner, arriving at about 630PM, on a Tuesday night.  It was good to see the place doing decent business for a Tuesday.

We were immediately greeted by a genuinely welcoming host.  The restaurant felt warm and inviting, with good lighting and an open kitchen.

Our waitress was a tall, young lady who said it was her first day on the job.  We wouldn't have guessed it because she was great - attentive and friendly.  A plate of warm focaccia and wheat bread soon arrived at our table, along with glasses of water.

We ordered the Italian sausage and pepperoni pizza as a starter to share.  The pizza gets a solid "A"!  The crust was perfectly thin and crispy/chewy, with a an outside ring/crust that seemed buttery.  The tomato sauce on the pizza could have had more flavor or zest; perhaps it was a simple tomato sauce rather than sauce that was spiked with herbs/spices such as oregano, basil.  There was just the right amount of cheese and topings on it so you get a perfect mouthful with every bite. We definitely would order pizza again here, quite a few other on the menu to try.  It was a good size pizza, a bit too much for two, but perfect for 3 people as an appetizer.

For an entree, we ordered spaghetti and clams in tomato sauce.  Usually you see linguine & clams on menus, done with a white wine and garlic sauce. The spaghetti and clams dish here had outstanding flavor - that really pops in your mouth; we were glad to have a chance to try something different. The deep rich flavor might be from the slices of lightly browned (roasted?) garlic.  We would rate this a solid "A" dish if the spaghetti were more al dente.

The other entree was the fettucini and shrimp in tomato sauce.  This dish was pretty good, with lots of chunky tomatoes in the sauce. However, having tasted the sauce in the clams spaghetti dish, the sauce in this dish seemed muted in comparison :(  The fettucini, however, was near perfectly al dente.  If we order this again, we would ask for the sauce they use for the spaghetti alla vongole dish!

Prices are moderate here, and well worth it given the generous portion size.  We would visit again, it's now one of our favorite top 3 Italian spots in SF!

Parking is pretty easy to find, and free on West Portal if you park after 6PM.
author: Kurt P.

description:
Great service - really outstanding.

Food: overall okay. The spinach salad was good, not out of this world or anything. SPAGHETTI CALABRESE was good. TORTELLONI IN SALSA ROSA was okay. No room for desert.
