author: Mihir M.

description:
The first time I came here, I had an amazing dinner.

Second time around, I had very high expectations for this place.  We ordered the clam appetizer and two pastas.  When the clams came, we were very surprised because the portion was HALF the size of what we remembered from the first visit.  The broth was also very bland.

After I finished off the last clam, I noticed something brown floating in the broth.  I looked closely and my friend poked it with her fork saying confidently, "oh, thats nothing!" Low and behold, when she poked it, the body of a large brown fly was revealed!! 

We both lost our appetites, no longer wanted to stay and eat our entrees. We notified the waiter, who, to our surprise, did not apologize.  He insisted that the fly had flown in while we were eating and that it was not the kitchens fault.  I pointed out that if it had just flown in, the fly would be floating on top of the soup.  Instead, the fly was partially submerged and cooked to a disgusting dark brown color.  He made it seem as if we had planted the dead fly there!  We offered to just pay for the clams and cancel our pastas.  To this, the waiter put on a terribly fake smile and said, no, that's fine, goodbye! goodbye! And shooed us out of the door.

pro: we didnt have to pay for the clams.
author: Michelle W.

description:
Ok service and decor.
Food was good but not special.
author: Ray L.

description:
The food was really great! 
I came with a reservation for 6 people at 8pm. When I showed up at 8pm I had to tell them that we had 2 more people ( my fault). We had to wait 25 minutes for a table then.
I was disappointed about that. I think it would have been about the same wait had I not made reservations at all. That is why I gave 4 stars instead of 5.
author: Dbs B.

description:
This was my second time coming here with my boyfriend, (we are locals), and I now regret that I gave them the "benefit of the doubt," give them a second chance stance. 

Here's my gripe. 1) Food was not pleasant, Olive Garden can do better. 2) Price for food..., cheated. I ordered one of their house specials.,Fettucine with New Zealand Mussels, clams and scallops. I counted 3 New Zealand Mussels, 3 clams and a handful of scallops...not cool....$18.95)  3) For the second time we were here, they didn't bring the espresso when ordered.

This will really make any customer upset. After first trying to explain to the server that is our second time coming here with bad service, (missed espresso) 1st time the server was ridiculously forgetful, there just wasn't much substance in an apology. But this is the icing on the cake, being locals, I wanted to speak to the owner since he/she should be open to feeback about their own establishments. 
After explaining our ordeal, the owner DID NOT CARE! He shrugged his shoulders and turned his head on several occassions! He gave me the perception is that it's ok....other people like it, there will be more....it was insulting! I refer business to other restaurants here in West Portal because it's part of my profession. I WILL NOT PUT MY WORDS/REPUTATION on this establishment. Being a local homeowner, neighborhood places to eat and gather around are extremely important. 

Point blank, skip it, it isn't even worth your hard earned dollar, especially these days....if the owner doesn't care about me as a customer, I sure don't care about your establishment.
author: Linda L.

description:
Dark, wooden paneled walls, in a large, cabin/hunter theme room, this place definitely has the atmosphere of a 1950's business-man's dream come true-- with the food, drinks, and service to match.

The menus is extensive, including port sauce over venison and an entire section of the menu for veal.  There is a bit of a Mediterranean/middle-eastern vib from their chicken dishes and wine list, adding to the uniqueness of the experience. Although casual dress, this is definitely a place to take people you want to impress.  The fact that the place has been around through the 1950's adds to its tourist appeal for relatives/outta towners. It's also definitely one of our favorite nice-date places.

The service is slow, but it fits the atmosphere, so I would recommend you roll with it and just enjoy the evening!!
author: Jaclyn S.

description: This place has been a stand-by for years. Always good service and good food.  When in West Portal check them out.
author: Ngeean x.

description: I ordered the Ossobuco and it was the best I've had.  The waiter was attentive and friendly.  I highly recommend this neighborhood gem.
author: Gary Y.

description: I really loved this place! Pasta and pizza dishes were delicious, service was outstanding--attentive and friendly, decor was comforting and unpretentious. Reminded me of many other neighborhood Italian restaurants I've been to on the east coast and elsewhere. Prices were on point. Great location near the Muni stop in WP. I will definitely go back!
author: Kate P.

description: Read good reviews about this then decided i had to try it out...We started with brushetta and it was tasty, not the best but good. No soup for me today because i wasnT too hungry today but wanted roomfor dessert so onto the main course....Saltimbocca alla Romana. Again tasty but not the best ever. My daughter had the lasagne and she was very satisfied. For dessert she had chocolate gelato and i had Chocolate Pot de Creme....OMG!!! Now that was just awesome! My tongue was pleasantly surprised  by the smoothness and taste extravaganza. Not too sweet just good chocolate yumminess. Needless to say, it was my fav part of the whole meal
author: Roxy L.

description:
Had dinner here last night with my sweetheart for Valentine's Day. I was afraid of how the food would turn out based on the previous reviews, but I'm starting to realize more and more that the places I visit with great reviews usually always turn out bad, and the places with poor ratings always turn out great. Of course, this happened that way again.

The restaurant is small and cozy. The waitress was attentive. The food was much better than I had anticipated and came out very quickly. 

They serve a warm foccacia bread at the beginning of your meal. It comes with some kind of red sauce that I thought was tomato puree, but didn't taste at all like tomato. It was VERY good though! I ate practically the entire plate by myself. 

Next we had the pear and walnut salad. I wasn't too fond of it. The dressing tasted too mayo-ey for me. The pears were good though. :-)

We then had a clam appetizer. I don't recall the name of it, but it was served in a clear broth with 2 bread sticks. Oh man that dish was delish!!! My mouth is watering right now just thinking about it. I hightly recommend anyone visiting Spiazzo to try it!

For my main dish, I ordered the spaghetti portofino. YUM!!!! The spaghetti was cook perfectly. They did not skimp on the shrimp and scallop. The sauce wasn't heavy and didn't overpower the dish. My bf ordered a scallop dish (I don't remember the name of the it) that came with veggies and angel hair pasta. His scallops were wonderfully cooked! It had a nice color and sear to it. And the sauce......YUMMY!! 

I highly recommend this place to anyone. I will definitely be going back there.
author: -Kelb H.

description: Spiazzo's is either excellent or very disappointing. You can order the exact same meal just a few weeks apart and the result isn't remotely similar. We live in the area and hear the same from neighbors who have dined here over the years. Disappointing because the owners are very courteous and provide good service. However there is obviously a consistency issue in the kitchen.
author: Cody L.

description:
This is in our neighborhood and we come here when we want to get something we know we will like. The boys and my Mom decided to come here last night as it was getting pretty late and they wanted Italian food. I didn't care one way or the other.

Although it was 8:15 on a Saturday night, and pretty full, they seated us right away. Mom goes there often enough that everyone who greeted her treated her like family. I was surprised that the owner and wait staff remembered me, even before Mom arrived, but that is just how friendly and warm they are there! 

As people has already mentioned, the service is amazing, and as soon as you are seated, you are greeted with a hello, menus, and the most wonderful home made breads and red pepper tapenade. OMG, it was so yum! 

The boys knew what they wanted right away from having having spotted another diner's dish as they walked to the table...they ordered the penned al salmone. They loved it! These boys are 9 and 11. The older one is a teen but did not join us. Mom ordered off of the dinner speacials, some chicken, pesto ravioli, which she loved. I, needed something with meat, ordered the grilled skirt steak in balsamic vinegar sauce. 

For dessert, the boys ordered creme brule' and some yummy chocolate ice cream cake concoction. They loved their choices and already know what they want to try next time!
author: Laura S.

description:
Came here with my boyfriend and his family the other night.  The family wanted to go somewhere inexpensive and cozy, not some big chain, something "San Francisco" (since Mom and Dad were going to be driving up from Mountain View and wanted to go somewhere that would be easy for them to get it and drive through the whole city.  Brother and his girlfriend live up in laurel Heights but had never been here before) and somewhere where the majority of of party had not been to yet.  So our choice was easy, SPIAZZO'S!!!

i called the night before and made reservations for 7 @ 7:30 on a Friday night.  Not a problem I was told, God I love it when things go my way.  i spent most of the day at work on Friday thinking about what i would get at Spiazzo's that night.  And all that we ordered was delicious and keeping within my high expectations for Spiazzo's.

I had a Ceasar salad to start.  Fresh, crisp lettuce and a tangy flavorful dressing.  Very pleased.  We all shared 2 orders of the Bruschetta.  And I have to say that I had never had this before, BUT I WILL EVERYTIME I COME HERE FROM NOW ON!!  The order comes with 2 traditional bruschetta pieces with tomatos and evoo and baslcamic, but it also comes with 2 mushrooms bruschetta pieces.  THIS WAS WHAT GOT ME!  Absolutely to die for.  I could have ate 2 or 3 more of those, no problem at all.  As my main course I had my staple favorite.  Fettucini con Gamberoni ... Great at usual!!  Plump perfectly cooked prawns and spicy sauce.

My main man got the dinner special chicken imperratore.  This is usually one of his favorites, but this time it came out just a little too cooked.  But he still loved it and licked his plate clean.  Mom had the Chicken Piccatta, which is devoured and raved about.  Dad had some sort of pasta Portofino dish (shirmp and scallops in a light wine sauce) which he also loved.  Littlest brother had one of the pizzas (Ham and artichoke and olives) and I couldn't have gotten a piece if I tried! He loved it!

Finished off with a Creme Bruelle, beautiful!
author: Chelsea C.

description: Came to try this place since my friend said it's one of the best italian places he's tried in the city.  Not the best Italian food I've ever had.  I had the Scampi Lido.  Really big jumbo shrimp, but the sauce was overly salty.  The vegetables that came with it seemed raw.  The rest of my party didn't seem to enjoy their food either.
author: Karen L.

description:
We chose Spiazzo after the Turkish restaurant, Bursa, turned us away from our 8:00 reservation because they were basically overbooked.  No apology, nada.

Spiazzo was also very busy, but sat us within 5 minutes.  Service at Spiazzo was very gracious, very competent and very efficient.:  yes, "very" is the word for our experience at Spiazzo, but in entirely the opposite direction from Bursa.

Our waiter greeted us within minutes of being seated and impressed us with his encyclopedic knowledge of the menu and wine list.  There was brief pause between each course and our meal felt neither rushed nor unduly slow.  

The food was pretty stock Italian-American cuisine, but everything was well prepared and I'd put it on the top shelf for family-style Italian food with extra cudos for creating an extremely comfortable environment.  All the guests looked happy and the place seemed to bring out the best in everybody:  staff and customers.  

Everybody in our party agreed that we would return to Spiazzo again.
author: Scooby S.

description:
Delicious!!
Food was fantastic, service was fast and friendly.
I can't remember what I ordered but I've eaten there twice and loved it both times. I always love trying new things and they kindly helped me pick out something I hadn't tried before. Highly reccomend!
author: Ashim A.

description:
I always order the Fusilli with pesto, but no mushrooms or tomatoes, a Caprese Salad, and either creme brulee or tiramisu for dessert. I'm definitely a fan. 

Spiazzo's is small and cute - I always feel at home in the restaurant. The customer service is excellent. Everyone is so friendly. Spiazzo's is also great for groups. I had my college graduation lunch here with my very large extended family. We celebrated my sister's 22nd birthday here and my 23rd birthday.
author: Jennifer L.

description: This was our first visit to Spiazzo after recently moving into the neighborhood.   It was difficult making a selection as there were so many items, including their specials, that sounded delicious.  We ended up having a really lovely meal and the service was excellent.  Our server was very friendly and attentive.   We will definitely be back soon.
author: jo c.

description:
I grew up in the West Portal neighborhood and have never been disappointed by the restaurants along this street. Of all the years I lived here, I have never visited Spiazzo until tonight. My parents were feeling something European tonight, so we decided to dine somewhere close to home. 

Upon arriving, we were warmly welcomed and immediately seated. Mind you, it's a Saturday evening during prime dinner hours. The restaurant was packed, but the servers were quickly to make adjustments so that we wouldn't have to wait outside in the cold. 

Dinner consisted of two antipasto servings - The Chef's special seafood salad and an assortment of mozzarella, prosciutto, bruschetta, red and green bell peppers, and artichokes. Big portions, enough for four people to share. Nicely seasoned and very filling to start with.

Merlot. Best way to go. My dad also really enjoyed his Pinot. 

My entree tonight was the Chef's special risotto consisting of Italian sausage, mushrooms and pears. Yes, pears. I never would have thought of including sliced pears in risotto, but once I tasted the dish, it made sense. Delicious. I boxed half of my meal to bring home for lunch.

Dessert was tiramisu and a plate of biscotti. The tiramisu was an extremely HUGE portion, especially for the price you're paying. Typically I'd expect a serving of 2'' by 2''. This was more of 4.5'' by 4.5''. Enough for four people to share. Biscotti was good, but very difficult to chew if you didn't have a hot beverage to dip it in. Be sure to order a cappuccino if you decide to order this. 

Overall great service, great food, great prices. Will definitely be coming back again.
author: Teresa Y.

description: Special poached pear app was good, but a little dessert like.   Two pasta dishes were good--we both had vegetarian this night: a gnocchi and a spaghetti.  Excellent service.  We came close to closing and the staff was welcoming.  Would go back to try something else.
author: S.C. S.

description: Classy and romantic.  Good food and very large portions for the price.  Let's be honest, it ain't Little Italy, but for this end of town this is a very nice Italian restaurant.  I will definitely be back.
author: Jordan K.

description: My wife recalls eating her many years ago and I can't recall why we never returned.  This place has been here for ages so it must be decent enough.  Recently, friends had commented that they had a good meal here so we returned.  It was convenient to the West Portal muni station which we needed to use to take downtown to see a show (Avenue Q).  We were a party of 5.  Afterwards, I commented how I remembered why we didn't return.  Like some of the other reviews, the food isn't bad, but it also isn't good or memorable.  It is no better than what we are able to make at home ourselves.  The gnocchi, spaghetti and spaghetti with clams were bland and needed salt.  Our guest ordered tricolore pizza and said it was good.  She couldn't finish it so I tried a slice of the limp pizza.  Now I know she was being polite because it was not very tasty.  I really wanted to like the place because I want to support a local neighborhood eatery.  Granted, the service was good / attentive, but that doesn't make up for the mediocre / average food.
author: Will L.

description: I had my first visit to Spiazzo tonight and it was absolutely wonderful... the cuisine, service and ambiance were all perfect for a reunion with a special friend that I haven't seen in 7 years.
author: DeeDee A.

description:
Came here a few times with friends and it's a great neighborhood italian place, especially if you're craving pasta, but it is a bit pricey.  The portions are well balanced and the bread they give you is usually warm & buttery :) 

They have a great selection of wines and even half bottles to choose from, so that's always a great option. 

I usually get: CAPELLINI AL POMODORO FRESCO, Angel hair pasta with fresh tomato, garlic, olive oil and basil 10.95  but have them add shrimp, the price comes out to about $15 after adding the shrimp, but these aren't just any ol baby shrimp, these are HUGE.  i usually cut them into 3 pieces per shrimp! so the price is worth it. 

The lasagna i've seen is very generous in portion size and also looks super tasty, very cheesy and lots of meat. so that's a good option if you're a major meat person. 

Service is usually pretty quick and attentive, except one time i went and we had to ask for everything at least 2 or 3 times before we got it. Weird. Im sure it was just an off night, although it wasn't very busy. Oh well. 

If you're in the neighborhood, have time to sit and chat during dinner, feeling italian..head over to Spazzo :D
author: Lulu C.

description: I loved the shrimp, scallops, and spaghetti pasta!!! Super good and garlicy!!! Also, the chocolate ice cream cake slice was more than enough for 2 people. and super good!! OMG...the bread they give you while waiting for your food is homemade tasting, soft, warm, and so good!!! Drooling....
author: Natalie J.

description: I really want to give this 4 stars but feel like it is not quite in the league of other fancy schmancy places in the city. It is really 3.5. However if you want reasonably priced, very solid traditional Italian food, served in big pasta-heavy portions with excellent service - and you don't mind a kid friendly environment with somewhat dated decor, then this is your 4-star place. Everything was good with a solid, homemade, comfort feel vibe - gnocchi, polenta, linguini, etc. Nothing flashy or weird or foodie fetishistic. The service is great and they are unobtrusively there in a flash if you need something. Wine list was okay if not mind shattering. Definitely would go back again.
author: p v.

description:
My husband purchased a voucher from Travel Zoo for Spiazzo Ristorante, for $35 he received a voucher with a promotional value of $72.35.  We looked online before going to see what was on their menu and there were two lamb dishes one $22.95 the other $25.95.  The voucher stated we could have two entrees worth $24.95 each.  It also stated you had to call before going, make a reservation and let restaurant know you had a voucher. When we got there the manager/owner, not sure which, gave us a menu which did not have any entrees of a higher amount, certainly no lamb, and he stated the more expensive items were specials of the day and we could not order them.  We honestly feel he had special menus ready for anyone who purchased a voucher!  We were told we could get two entrees, share a salad and share a dessert.  I told him with the entrees on that menu, pastas, personal pizzas and a couple of chicken items our total savings at end of meal would be bout $5.00 not the 50% off as indicated on voucher.  He told us how did we expect him to make any money if he allowed us to purchase the more expensive meals. My husband and I are professionals who own a home in West Portal and eat out about 3 times a week and a few times have used Living Social vouchers and never had any problems.  From my understanding restaurants participate in these promotional offers not to make money but to acquire new customers.

We left, did not care for his attitude and thought he was being dishonest.  We went down the street to the new Restaurant Trattoria de Vittorio, which was outstanding.  We paid full price for meals and a bottle of wine, the money was not the issue it was the principle of it.

Oh yes and when we got home we went online to Spiazzo's website and looked at their regular daily menu, not specials, and both lamb dishes were still on the menu.

I will never set foot in that restaurant again and will tell all our friends neighbors and family what occurred.  I do not think this man's dishonestly to save a few dollars was a good business decision.
author: vicki g.

description: Excellent food. The bruschetta appetizer comes with 3 different toppings. I also had the gnochhi which was amazing. Highly recommend!
author: Shelly W.

description:
I have been here twice with my boyfriend and both times left pleased and full.

We came here just last weekend for my birthday dinner.  The menu has a lot of Italian in it, but you catch on pretty quick. I had a delicious plate of chicken marsala, with perfectly tender chicken and succulent mushrooms in a wonderful marsala wine gravy, with fresh steamed vegetables and mashed potato on the side (with pureed carrot in it to add color); it left me in food coma.  I only had a bite of my boyfriend's lasagna (with layers of cheese, fresh pasta, and bolognese), but I imagine it had similar food coma inducing powers.  Not particularly "adventurous" choices on our part but still wonderful and delicious.  Plus they gave us fresh creamy tiramisu on the house since it was my birthday.

Upshot is: will definitely come back for future date-nights. I'm gonna have the veal scallopini next, it's taunted me each time I've looked at the menu. Or maybe that lasagna.  It all looks so good!
author: Jane D.

description:
When people talk about Noe West, they're not talking about Spiazzo--this is old-guard WP straight out of the 80's (if the bruised-beige walls are any evidence).  Marcello's on Taraval may still be more of a retro experience, but Spiazzo's got a better location and street windows to prove it.

I don't normally get out for Italian food, and then I'm usually pretty stingy with the Yelp stars.  Nevertheless, Spiazzo brings some trademark West Portal modestness and reasonable prices, so I really have nothing much bad to say.  Particularly as I stuck to pizza (the greek-style Montanara) and salad (the Spinaci with Pancetta)--pasta is just too easy to do at home, you know?  The free bread is dry and crumbly (and comes with pre-packaged butter instead of olive oil, yuck), but they make up for it with some of the best tiramisu this side of North Beach.
author: Wes M.

description: Made a reservation for 6:45 p.m. on Christmas Eve, and it was confirmed.  They obviously over booked and were running like crazy.  The food just was okay...everything was over salted.  I realize it is a busy season, but still....We felt rushed and unattended.  Not a very good experience.
author: J G.

description: I came here with my wife and son on the recommendation of our neighbor. I didn't have very high expectations for this place as at first glance it doesn't look like anything different than the other handful of Italian restaurants in the West Portal / Parkside area. However, my wife and I came away impressed. The food was delicious, I had a special on the menu of chicken stuffed ravioli with sun dried tomatoes and mushrooms. It's the best ravioli I've had in a long time.... so tasty. My wife had a dish with large prawns and we each had a a caeser salad. Everything was excellent. The service here is incredible and efficient, our waiter was great. All of the staff are constantly making sure you're taken care of and it makes for an excellent experience. We'll be coming back for sure.
author: Russ N.

description:
Came here last night for dinner with family, made reservations via OpenTable for 7pm for a table of 7. First off, this place is small. There are no big tables, each table is a 4 person booth/table. But they put us in the back in a booth and they tacked on a table so it could accommodate 7 people. Definitely not a good place to come for big parties larger than 8. 

Also, this place is busy on a Monday night! It was pretty packed when we first got there and more and more people kept coming in as the tables were turned over. That must be a good sign that it's this busy on a weeknight. The patrons are more of an older, sophisticated, wine-drinking type of crowd, not your family-type of joint. 

Each table gets a plate of foccaccia-like bread with marinara-like sauce and butter. The bread was delicious, light and fluffy, but not exactly like foccacia-texture. Though I do think it was suppose to be foccaccia. The marinara was cool that they give you a sauce instead of the usual butter, but it didn't taste exactly like just marinara and it was orange... I went with the butter instead. Others in my party liked it, I didn't care for it too much. 

On to the food... every dish that came out looked so yummy and delicious and I don't think anyone had a complaint about the food. They have good size portions especially! And the price is totally reasonable! I ordered the Zuppa di Pesce. I know it says Zuppa in it and it was more of a soup-like item, I just wish it had more pasta and less soup. I guess that would be more of a Tutto di Mare. But either way it was delicious and lots of fresh yummy seafood and the soup broth was so good! My husband's aunt ordered the clams and pasta dish, and the clams are SOO huge! Not your typical linguine and clams item. And it had a lot of pasta with some sort of sauce. My husband ordered the lamb meatballs with risotto, which did not look like risotto. It was rice i swear. But the lamb meatballs were very good, not gamey at all, fluffy with breadcrumbs and also crispy on the outside from searing it. My mother-in-law got the salmon pasta and she raved about how good it was also. So much pasta and salmon mixed into it. My husband's cousin got the ravioli with spinach and chicken I believe and the ravioli were also a large portion size! So you're eating more filling than just the pasta. 

One downside to the place, the service of our waiter. He was definitely italian, but he was ALL over the place. He took the order of my mother-in-law then he walked away to take another table's order. Then he never returned to us until we beckoned another waiter. Then in the middle of taking our large party order, he refilled our bread and sauce! He definitely tried and worked hard, he just seemed very scattered-brain. 

Parking was easy with street parking in front, or maybe we got lucky. But it didn't seem too bad on a weeknight. e
author: Grace L.

description:
Ok first off everyone is so super friendly here!!! Right when you walk in you are greeted (I think by the owner :)) The waiter, owners were very nice to me (female), older people, younger people children...they were great! 

My friend took me to this cute little place and it was a pleasant surprise. 
I will admit I am a pretty picky eater and allergic to several items and they were more than happy to make sure I was able to eat the items I ordered :) and everything was delicious!!!! 

The portions were generous and pretty tasty! I had the gnocchi and my friend had the veggie pizza both of which were excellent (we also got 2 meatballs on the side....yup they will do that for you and they were tasty!) 

Parking is a little rough but we were able to find something with some patience if you can walk I would recommend that. 

I would come here again :) For the great service and even yummier food :)
author: Tick...tick...tock...Clock C.

description: It's been a while since I've eaten here, but it's always been one of our defaults for Italian food.  I always get the fusilli alla genovese here.  The bread flavored with rosemary is pretty good, but I'm not gonna lie, sometimes it does come out a bit cold.  The atmosphere is nice enough to have a low-key date but homey enough that this could be a regular lunch/dinner spot.  The food is delicious and generous enough in portions to bring home a meal for the next day.  Love it.
author: Jenn C.

description: Best Italian restaurant in the Sunset. Food is good and service is excellent. Save room for their dessert.
author: Jessica M.

description: Good prices for the quality of the food and the atmosphere. Great Italian food. Interesting, different menu. You will not be disappointed.
author: Brendan B.

description:
Spiazzo offers quality Italian food.  Open Late!

I arrived at Spiazzo after looking for another char-broiled hamburger joint.  The place was closed but Spiazzo was just around the corner.  Plus I spied Spiazzo on the first pass and wonder if they had service as poor Spiedo in San Mateo.  Then there was the other thing.  You know,, The thing.  The thing I have with Italian food.  I'm generally a sucker for a plate of good pasta set before me.  The lure of Spiazzo was just too much to resist.

When I walked int the door it was already 9:20 PM so I was expecting to hit the pavement pretty quickly.  Instead I was welcomed and told there was plenty of time left.  (First star easily give for staying open late).   The smile and warm greeting set a nice tone.

Since I was alone I wanted a window seat to pass the time watching the other girls passing by.  Spiazzo accommodated my request.  Water and wine soon followed   I was surprised how quickly it came since the place definitely was not empty.  Still being tied mentally to the hamburger lust I was sort of lost for what I wanted to eat.  So a glass of Pinot Noir seemed to be a good middle of the road choice.  Even by the glass the Pinot was good.  Not something I can say for every restaurant.

The table setting is your average mid-scale SF style with cloth napkins  The only negative was a plastic tumble used for the water.  It served the purpose but looked a little cheap next to the wine glass.  Still I can't really complain because everything was clean neat and tidy.

Bread was dropped by the table  Due to the Americanization of Italian eateries butter was brought. (Ack!)  Luckily the people at the table next to me had just left so I was able to steal the olive oil and balsamic.   Which it turns out was better for the bread anyway.  The bread was like a Focaccia bread without the "cia".  The slices as well as the rest of the loaf were extremely dry and brittle.  Had I tried to use the butter the bread would have fallen into crumbs.   The oil and balsamic just made the bread better.  (but still fell apart on the way to my mouth).  The bread's flavor was good though.

I finally gave up on trying to decide on the choice for my meal and decided to go with the ole standby choices of Insalata Caprese (Capri Salad) and  Tortellini Salsa Rosa (tortellini with red Tuscan sauce).   Every "standard" Italian place in Kali generally has these two choices on the menu.  They are generally safe and comfortable dishes with a nice little flavor and a bit of tang.

One pause for a menu note.  Spiazzo 's menu is way too busy!  Like they were trying cram in all things, for all people, at all times of the day.  I suggest splitting off the dinner and lunch menus.  No one likes to read tiny typeface in a darkened window area after the sun goes down.

The waitress, ( Ismini.  such a cool name for a lovely person ) brought the salad quickly.  Overall it was good.  The only problem was with the tomatoes.  The slices were cut too thin for my preference and the color could have also been better.  Especially for a a dish that features raw tomatoes as a visual component.  Otherwise the Insalata Caprese was done right with a good mozzarella and nice leaves of fresh basil.  I already had the oil and balsamic at the table and these top the salad very well.

I finished my salad fairly quickly and the next surprised was the quick arrival of the pasta.  The pasta itself was good.  Cooked to perfection.  The cheese filling of the tortellini tasted great.  The Salsa Rosa was pretty good.  Certainly tasty enough.  Maybe just a bit too separated but that may have been the style the chef wanted.  Ismini presented some pre-grated Parmesan cheese  for topping the dish.  I would have like to have seen it grated at the table for the price charged for the meal.

The last thing I had was a cup of perfect cappuccino.  yes perfect.  Sized nicely.  Fresh made.  Perfect foam.  Excellent taste.   Raw brown sugar at the table.  Perfect temperature.  Perfect texture.  I would stop by again just for the window and a cappuccino.  Being served again by the pleasant Ismini would be nice too!

Meal Price on 2009-05-22:
$ 6.95 - Glass of Pinot Noir
$ 8.95 - Insalata Caprese
$12.95 - Tortellini Salsa Rosa 
$ 2.95 - Cappuccino
$ 3.02 - Tax
$34.82 - Total
$ 6.50 - Tip  (forgot that you don't tip the alcohol)
$41.32 - Grand Total

Value?   If Spiazzo improves the points I have listed above that I would say the value is about average.  If there is no improvement then......

About the location,,, yea you might have a little problem parking.   This is SF people!  A minuscule walk of 150 feet and you are sure to fine a spot.  Muni and cabs are right out front too.

I will give a 3 and 7/16 stars for this visit and recommend Spiazzo as a good place to take a date for a late dinner.  I will actually check off four since they are open late.
author: Chris R.

description:
We didn't plan on coming here, but El Toreador is closed on Mondays and we had a birthday to celebrate so we gave Spiazzo a try. 

The service here is top notch. All of the staff are incredibly friendly and welcoming.

The menu had a decent selection of Italian fare and the prices were about what I've come to expect from a nice restaurant in West Portal. 

We ordered an antipasto, salad, and four main dishes, all of which were great. The gnocchi was especially good. Afterwards they brought us tiramisu for our birthday girl and we had coffees and spumoni. 

Overall a great place to enjoy some authentic Italian food with good friends.
author: Jordan P.

description: After several people recommended this place, we finally tried it out. And we're glad we did. My wife and I typically avoid Italian restaurants given their limited gluten-free options, so we were super excited to learn that they offer gf pasta!  The food was great, and the service wonderful. We were particular impressed when the owner offered to take a fussy baby off the hands of a young couple so they could enjoy their dinner. It's just that kind of place.
author: Natalie N.

description:
Tried Spiazzo on a whim recently and was pleasantly surprised. The pasta was great and the pizza, while I did not try it, looked pretty amazing. 

The atmosphere is so-so, but the service (quick!) and food were great.
author: Dustin E.

description:
Not sure why this place got such high ratings - quite mediocre in my book.

Mescolanza in the Richmond District is a lot better.
author: Ally M.

description:
parking on this part of west portal is kind of tough.  get lucky.

i've been here a few times.  that usually means its pretty good.  

i don't know why i've been here a few times because i must order too much because the price i'm always surprised at the total.  BUT, i never seem to come home with leftovers to eat later...and usually thats a plus for me.

the pasta i ordered was great...i'm giving a general review because for some reason I can't remember the name of the dish i ordered...nor, any other times.  I do know that i've always asked to add chicken to something, that didn't have chicken.

the seating is tight but very elegant looking.  this is more of a date place for me.
author: Bing D.

description: I've been coming here for over ten years, and I continue to return.  The food is great, but the service is better.  If you are in West Portal, give this place a try.  Spiazzo is an example of true Italian hospitality.
author: Gabrielle W.

description: Honestly - service very good - food ok - while the portions were fine - nothing really memorable.  Overall, nice neighborhood spot.
author: Jaci G.

description:
EXCELLENT service.  Not too pricey, $10-15 (20 for the steak) per dish.  Try the lasagna or the tortellini.

Small, cute, homey, and authentic.
author: Kevin F.

description: spinach salad with pancetta is amazing. as is the spaghetti bolognese. service is above average. it's close to home, with no wait. i will come back here again.
author: Jamie L.

description:
the wine and wine recommendations were fantastic, not sure you can get a better server than we had. A tall slender italian gentleman that was just candid, patient and knowledgeable and helped our evening of choices.

the gnocchi, bruschetta and caprese were awesome too...
author: David W.

description: My work brought us here for a Christmas lunch in 2005. I fell in love and have been coming back ever since. If you're looking for an authentic Italian experience this is the place to go. It is also in a very desirable location. Compared to the rest of city (namely North Beach and downtown) parking is not as terrible in West Portal. My favorite dish  is the Petto Di Pollo Al Funghetto. I have also tried the clams and the gnocchi, and although very tasty,  they pale in comparison.
author: Harpreet H.

description:
A nice Italian restaurant that brings something different to the neighborhood. Too often I hear people talking about Italian food to only hear about Olive Garden and Pasta Pomodoro. Blah. And too often do I hear about the pizza joints that serve pasta and and other stuff as well. Well, spiazzos is an Italian restaurant that serves pizza as well.

Favs

Brushetta - four slice of sourdough toast topped with two toppings. The original - tomatoes in a vinagrette. Mushrooms in a pesto dressing. Yum

Petto Di Pollo Al Funghetto - chicken breast with mushrooms in a delicate cream sauce. 

Fusilli Alla Genovese  - corkscrew pasta with pesto sauce, wild mushrooms and a touch of fresh tomato. Fusilli holds the sauce really well

Zuppa Di Pesce  - sauteed mussels, clams small shrimp calamari, scallops and generous pieces of seasonal fish in a light tomato broth served with spaghetti and garlic crostini. A little bit of every kind of seafood.

Nothing is quite overwhelmingly overpriced and there's definitely a warm family vibe.
author: Dennis L.

description: meatballs bready. sauce salty. chicken picatta not very lemony and had about five capers on top. don't know why this place is so crowded - its mediocre and over priced.
author: Joel B.

description: Delicious food and great service! They remember you and warmly welcome you back in. I have now eaten there three times and everything I have ordered is spectacular and very different. I will definitely be back!
author: Jessica F.

description: I would give it a strong 3 1/2 stars. The food is not as good as before but for sure A-OK. Kind of disappointing.  Continues to be a bit inconsistent. The place is clean. The service is excellent. Nice neighborhood restaurant.
author: jane f.

description:
Don't hate me Kristin R. but I am not obsessed with this place. Been here a few times now and everything is good, but nothing is great. 

The service is incredibly fast here. Almost to the point where you wonder if your dish was sitting under a heat lamp. Plus I don't like having to ask for the oil and vinegar, for some reason I think it should just be on the table. 

The waiter/owner is friendly and clearly knows his Italian. Luckily my friend ordered the gnocchi for us as I was afraid to be corrected for saying it wrong. We also ordered one of the pizzas and each item was separated out so none of the slices had any other items on it. Who orders a pizza with 5 toppings on it and wants to eat them one at a time? Not me. So we re-organized it. 

One big plus- they have lots of half bottles of wine. La Crema Pinot Noir is fantastic. Yum!

All in all, the food is good, the people are nice, but it's nothing I'd obsess over. Sorry Kristin R.
author: Ali R.

description: Ended up in West Portal and thought we would grab a bite out there to try something new.  We popped into Spiazzo Caffe - the menu in the window had something that we each liked.  We were not disappointed.  Attentive, friendly and quick service.  Fresh, tasty options and variety.  The Spaghetti Calabrese was fantastic - a whole combo of goodie bits.  We decided that the next time we wanted to "get out of the city", we'd head back to Spiazzo.
author: Mac M.

description:
I really like this place. The staff is very attentive, especially the older waiter who looks more like an owner in an apron.
The bread does in fact come quickly and warm. We ordered the bruschetta which was a little charred but very tasty, and the the mushroom appetizer, also lots of rich flavor. I had the capellini pomodoro. Considering this is just angel hair, tomato, olive oil and basil, I didn't expect much. So imagine my surprise when the party started in my mouth! mm mm mm!
We'll be back!
author: JaM W.

description:
I looove this place. My fiancee and I eat here all the time, maybe 3 times a month. They give you this wonderful warm bread within a minute of sitting down which I could probably fill up on if I didn't know there are massive portions coming. 
I have several favorites:
-linguine with shrimp and scallops in white wine sauce
-spaghetti vongole (lots of mussels)
-whatever their special fresh fish is with lemon sauce. I've had this with salmon, halibut, etc, and it's always delicious. This is one of the pricier options, but so worth it
-chicken with cream sauce and mushrooms
and my fiancee always orders their salmon pizza, which I also this is yummy, but I prefer to have a slice than to eat a whole portion

The caveat is that while many many of their dishes are really tasty, the gnocchi and ravioli are not very exciting. If that is your must have Italian dish, you probably won't be impressed.

That said, order almost anything else, pasta, meat, fish, etc. I've tried most of them and am always super happy when I eat here.

One reason they are deprived of the fifth star is that it's nearly impossible to bring a group of more than five. You'll have to wait because it's a pretty small restaurant.
author: Melly B.

description:
Spiazzo's is my favorite Italian restaurant in San Francisco. There are three things that I love about it and are pretty much the norm; those are: food, service, ambiance.

Food: Excellent. I've been here at least 4 times now and I've always been more than satisfied. If you know anything about me, you'll know that I don't tend to deviate from what I know I like. So, even though I order the same thing every time I go it, it's always exceeding expectations in the taste bud category. My mom always gets the salmon dish which she loves and it looks and smells good to me. 

Service: Excellent. Right when you walk in they have water and bread fresh out of the oven to your table. I have to pace myself to make sure I don't eat too much bread because it is that delicious. They're also super quick and attentive. I hate having to wait forever for the check or my soda refill. They are on it and have been on it every time I've been there. 

They're also flexible...making suggestions and accommodations to give you something you'll really enjoy.

Ambiance: It's cozy and quaint. The wait staff is always speaking Italian and even speaking to its customers with their Italian tongue...mixing English with some Italian flare. 

This place is authentic, yummy and has good prices. Check it out the next time you're in the West Portal area, for sure.
author: Kristin R.

description:
West Portal...if it's 10pm and you aren't drinking in the bars then keep on movin' folks!!

No restaurant will seat you 10 till 10pm in West Portal.  After hopping  from S&G to Fresca we settled on Spiazzo.  They sat us down and told us that though the kitchen was closing but they would be glad to take our order.  The bread was warm and soft and tasty.  The food was okay...the seafood was good and tender.  

Don't go here if you can go to some other neighborhood where the people exist outdoors past 10pm on Friday nights.  I felt like it was 2am and the world had shut me out...

eh...West Portal...you can shove it.  Spiazzo's....you're cool.
author: Jay H.

description:
Pretty good Italian food. My friend Kristin R. LOVES this place. I would go back but noticed a few things....

The neighborhood is cute but parking is not easy on Friday and Saturday nights. All other nights parking is probably cake.

The service is fast - way too fast. I'd like to eat my appetizer before my dinner shows up. Maybe it's just me, but I prefer for my dinner plates not be shoved on the table, barely fitting bc we had 2 minutes to eat our appetizer plate.

The prices are great and there are specials as well. I had the pesto fuscilli - yummy.

Maybe it was just a rough night but I found our owner/waiter to be quite rude. Excuse me? Isn't the customer always right? And since I WAS right (the sauce for the gnocchi dish is NOT listed on the menu) please don't give me attitude - or I'll Yelp about it. Dude, I can read.

Service was pretty good. I had to ask for water twice but our bread was filled up quickly - they have VERY good rosemary, warm, soft bread.

I would probably go back on a less busy night and re-review.
author: Jessica L.

description:
My husband and I have been loyal Spiazzo customers for over 20 years. If you want gourmet Italian food in an unrushed, romantic atmosphere, go somewhere else. If you want unpretentious food in generous proportions at reasonable prices served promptly, Spiazzo will fill the bill. 

This restaurant is very popular with moviegoers (Cinearts at Empire is just down the street), and is always packed and noisy on weekends. You'll have a better experience if you can come on a weekday, when the pace is more leisurely and you might have a chance at getting one of their comfortable upholstered booths. Service here has always been very good. The servers are friendly and efficient.
 
I recommend the following dishes, which have been consistently good over the years: Minestrone (vegetarian), Spaghetti Bolognese (the best I've ever had), Salmon Fantasia, Spaghetti Calabrese (vegetarian), Pollo Piccatina, Chicken Marsala, the grilled Pork Loin and the Pizza Vegetale (If you are a vegan, they'll gladly omit the cheese).  All the pizzas are baked in a wood-fired oven. Occasionally on the specials menu they offer Pappardelle with Lamb Sauce. Don't miss this dish; it's heaven on a plate!

Unless you like tart flavors, I would avoid the fish dishes that are prepared with lemon sauce and capers or artichokes. The kitchen tends to go a little too heavy on the lemon for my taste. I also don't care for the fish dishes that are prepared with spicy tomato sauce; the strong flavor of the sauce overwhelms the delicate taste of fish, and it's tough to find a good wine pairing. 

Some have complained about the Caesar Salad, but I happen to like it. It's a bit small and unpretentious, but has a pleasantly tangy dressing (and no anchovies). Even better is the more generously-sized Insalata Etrusca, with marinated white beans, shaved parmesan and fennel on a bed of mixed greens with a tart balsamic vinaigrette.

For dessert, I highly recommend the sinfully delicious house-made tiramisu or the chocolate pot de creme. I also like the chocolate brownie cake, the spumoni cake and chocolate-dipped biscotti. The cannoli is OK, but it's imported frozen from Italy so it doesn't taste as fresh as a locally-made product.

In 20 years, I've only had to send one dish back -- a fish dish that had an oily "off" taste. The waiter said it was fresh, and I believe him, but it just didn't taste right. No problem, no attitude, they were happy to prepare a different entree for me.

For those who say they've had a bad experience at Spiazzo, all I can say is that either you are awfully hard to please or you must have been there on a rare off night. Spiazzo may not be the trendiest restaurant on the block, but it has a loyal following, and for good reason.
author: Midge A.

description:
Portions: Huge
Prices (esp for lunch): Low
Ambience: Good/ok
Service: Fine
Bread: Tasty rosemary--- mmm.. it arrives to your table WARM... I could eat that stuff all day... 

We went for lunch. Initially we really liked the place, as it reminded us of a good Italian place we had been to in NYC during our last visit.  Quaint, not noisy, the two of us sat in a comfy booth towards the back. 

I ordered the tortellini soup (4.95) and the canneloni lunch (9.95)...also the caesar salad (7.95) and the fusilli with sausage (9.95 or thereabouts.) 

Both arrived REALLY quickly (to our surprise- almost 'too fast'.)-- and my soup was just tepid-hot, with four tortellini floating in the centre. TEPID SOUP is NOT OKAY in my book. Soup should arrive steaming burning hot. Period. Unless it's gazpacho but I hate gazpacho so it's not even an option. The caesar salad looked like it had been made at a Sizzler, just a bunch of tossed romaine shreds doused in cheese and dressing. 

The canelloni were actually OK- of course I was REALLY hungry at the time and I was craving anything warm... it had a good combination of cheese filling and sauce, so I totally ate the whole thing. The fusilli with sausage, however, arrived almost over-cooked and the sauce itself was nothing I couldn't have just made at home.... we were pretty disappointed! 

I don't see this place as a neighborhood gem at all.. perhaps  it is more like that Cheap But Nice Pearl Necklace that Aunt Millie gave you for your birthday when you turned 18.... However, I admit that it seems a lot of the people from the area do like it, and I understand why... large portions, good bread, and relatively low prices.  In other words, a great place to take grandma and grandpa or mom and dad, but for a first date? Oh my goodness-- if you're doing Italian, there are other better options out there..
author: M'ia K.

description:
Nice little cafe with great service and great food.

I've been here w/ my gf and for a couple business luncheons.

The Gnocchi is one of their best dishes!
author: Keith R.

description:
Neighborhood staple for a dependable Italian meal, in a casual atmosphere.

Service is usually good, and fast - making it a prime contender for dinner before seeing a movie at the Empire theater.

Best dishes include the bruschetta, margherita pizza, and the chicken with mushrooms.  The food won't blow you away, but you will leave satisfied.  While hearty, the dishes are never heavy so you won't feel bloated afterwards.

Less crowded for lunch and specials are priced very well.
author: Liz S.

description:
After being in bed with the flu for two weeks, last night, I was finally healthy enough to get out of the house.  I hopped on the M and met my fiance for dinner in West Portal.  We decided to try out Spiazzo.

The ambience was lovely and the service was absolutely excellent.  Unfortunately, the food didn't impress me.  The carpaccio was just dripping in heavy olive oil --way too much!  I ordered the Fusilli alla Genovese --fusilli with wild mushrooms.  The dish was bland and the taste of the mushrooms were just lost.  Steve got the talapia fish special which was much tastier.  We finished with the spumoni cake --which was quite tasty.

I may wander back and try something else, however San Francisco has so many exciting restaurants, it's hard to justify going anywhere mediocre.  

2 glasses of wine, appetizer, 2 soups, 2 entrees & 1 dessert: $80.
author: Amy A.

description:
we've have been here a few times.  food is very tasty; good service; reasonably priced.  
it's a small place so can get a little noisy and crowded but if you go early enough, you can avoid all of that.
author: coonkitty c.

description: We were looking forward to trying out this restaurant since moving to the neighborhood but the whole meal was a disappointment. The sauce on the polenta appetizer was too salty, the polenta itself not crisp as described in the menu. The whole trout was bland and overcooked, the lamb meatballs arrabiata came with the same salty sauce and not spicy as it's supposed to be and the 'risotto' that accompanied the meatballs wasn't risotto, just rice. Portions are good sized and prices a bit lower than their competitor.
author: Lilian C.

description: We stopped by here today, nice little place.  The caprice is good, and we also had a pasta and seafood dish, which was also good.  But it's not a cheap lunch, $35 for lunch for only two people is a little high. (without wine)  Parking is usually an issue here.
author: C J.

description:
Had the Penne al Salmone. It was good for being simple; traditional; NOT exceptional. It was good for the area, and definitely better than P. Pomodoro. 

My companion said the spaghetti & meat sauce was pretty good. Personally,. I thought it looked watery, but she enjoyed it.

Friday night was not a bad wait, and I had my seafood fix. Got in, got out. Nothing notable. It seems like a reliable and reasonably priced pasta place in that area.
author: tim y.

description: My husband and I often drop by for dinner as we live near the neighborhood.  This is a friendly bright welcoming place and the service is attentive.  We had dinner last week and split the insalata Etrusca that was very good and was split for us in the kitchen rather that dealing with it at the table.  My husband had the spaghetti with clams which was great and I had a pizza Margherita which was not -- anemic looking with not enough tomato and undercooked.  My main gripe with this restaurant is the bread which is focaccia bread.  I much prefer regular bread.  However, I am sure many diners have no issue with that.  Overall, I enjoy this restaurant and would have given 4 stars but for the pizza.  Would definitely go back.
author: Vicki B.

description:
I've been going to Spiazzo since I was ten, celebrated every family function there and frequent it for my nicer dates.

I love it!. The portions are generous, the food is DELICIOUS, and for a nice evening out, the prices are not bad at all. The head waiters are also authentic Italians, so if you studied Italian, you can get a little practice in during your meal.

The Salmone Fantasia is in my top five favorite dishes anywhere. Try it, seriously.

I knocked it down one star (I would have done just a half star if it were possible) for being a bit cramped and noisy. A little more attention to ambiance would make it 5-plus!
author: Andrea W.

description: Went there again this weekend and it was as wonderful as ever! Had the scallops & prawns over angel hair pasta. Delicious. My wife's pasta with salmon was excellent and we're looking forward to trying the champagne brunch on Sunday.
author: Andrew B.

description:
After a previous not so great visit, decided to try this spot once again.  This time around they got the order wrong, even though it was not a busy night.  OK, that can happen.  I then specifically requested that they take their time with the correct dish and not rush it, but to my disappointment when the dish arrived, the shrimp tasted like it had been recently unfrozen, and had the briefest interaction possible with the sauce.  

After having left my food nearly untouched, and while waiting for the others to finish, the waiter appears in a flash and after a cursory query, removes my dish in a rush.  Seemed unduly hasty.  The spouse had a pizza and all he could taste was the cheese with not much else to recommend it ---he's had better luck at the neighboring pizzeria.  Come on guys, table linen alone cannot make up for lackluster food and poor service.  With several other good to excellent options in the neighborhood, we will be skipping this spot in the future.
author: ann k.

description: Yummy! Amazing polenta dish. Gluten free pasta was delicious and according to my fellow patron, their homemade raviolis are amazing. The owner is super friendly and takes an active role in the restaurant, which is wonderful to see. The staff was extremely nice too.
author: Jennifer P.

description: I found this place by using an app on my phone for near by food.  I wasn't expecting to find anything spectacular but boy, I was pleasantly surprised! The staff were friendly, kind, and very patient. The food arrived quickly and was delicious! I had a chocolate mouse cake for dessert and it was heavenly! I definitely plan dining there again.
author: Amanda C.

description:
3.5 stars rounded up.

I had dinner here on a recent Sunday evening for the first time in two years.  I had the Etrusca Salad, the Spaghetti Bolognese, and Tiramisu.  The food was just as good as I remembered it from the last time.  One step above Pasta Pomodoro.  The prices are higher than Pasta P, but the quality and portions are commensurate.

Overall, no complaints.  I would definitely come back here for dinner again.
author: Eating Sleeping T.

description: Food was alright, nothing special. The Polenta appetizer was rich & tasty, but I was underwhelmed by the salad and the gnocchi. We were seated in the front window before sundown & it was like sitting in a solarium. They really need to get some shades that actually block the sun. Service was odd. The servers were friendly, but they disappeared frequently. I don't really understand why this place is so popular.
author: Wan T.

description:
i found this italian restaurant when i was a disgruntled olive garden employee years ago. granted, the olive garden is dependable chain food, but really, just drive down the freakin street and upgrade to whole new level for just a few more dollars. I would recommend trying this restaurant if you are somewhere on the Sunset side.

Calabrese, gnocchi and TIRAMISU, oh my god, to die for. oh that tiramisu. sometimes i go pick one up to go. so fresh tasting.
author: Jessica W.

description:
A wonderfully authentic Italian joint with great service and comfortable atmosphere.  A very good deal for the quality and portions.  Absolutely a must visit in West Portal with a fabulous wine selection and huge menu.  I will always go here when in the mood for quality Italian food.

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
author: A H.

description:
DELICIOUS. GOOD PRICING. COMES HANDY!!!
I've only been here two times. But I promise myself to keep coming back. They have huge plates that due to the lusciousness of the food you don't want to finish everything because you wanted to bring home some to  your folks .. haha. enough! cute place, nice italian speaking maitre d' =) and again, goooood food!
author: nice m.

description:
A couple friends and I were craving Italian food last night and decided to stop in for dinner.   It was a great experience:  the food was great!  I had spaghetti and it was *real* spaghetti - not that wimpy angel hair crap that most places throw at you, and the sauce was thick enough to mortar bricks with.

We felt welcomed - which is extra special, 'cause I look like a hillbilly hesher metalhead.  Plus: raspberry sherbert.
author: Jorm ..

description: I just want to thank Spiazzo Ristorante for excellent food and service on my birthday. I had my birthday dinner here with a party of 15. For a large group, they handled it very well. Our server, Cullen I believe, was very nice and attentive. As for the food, I thought my dish was very yummy and everyone else I spoke with really enjoyed their meals as well. The reason I went to Spiazzo was because my first choice restaurant couldn't accommodate that many people but I'm really glad I made the switch. I would definitely  go here again.
author: Mel P.

description: I selected Spiazzo for a Saturday evening birthday celebration for its location (convenient for our plans) and the great reviews.  We arrived at 4:30pm for early supper. The host/waiter was very attentive and accommodating. The menu is extensive so it took some time to decide.  The calamari appetizer was incredible. Our entrees were amazing. The large prawns and scallops served over the pasta were plentiful & cooked perfectly. The duck entrée served over risotto with porcini sauce was also excellent. The portions are big enough to share (but better for left-overs ).... Just save room for the amazing desserts.  Best Tiramusu I have ever had!  Prices are very reasonable given portions and how delicious the food is!  Can't wait to return!
author: MB V.

description: Excellent service, great food and priced right.  Plus the atmosphere is relaxing.
author: Susan T.

description:
Came here for dinner with a friend last night.  Most tables were full so that was a good sign.  The service was attentive, so that's always good too.

I ordered the Pizza Quattro Stagioni: prosciutto, kalamata olives, artichokes, and mushrooms.  Not realizing that "stagioni" means "seasons," I was a bit surprised when I saw the pizza, each quarter covered with only one of the items listed above.  Basically, it was like getting 1/4 artichoke pizza, 1/4 mush pizza, etc.  I was hoping for a bit of a mixture instead.

Nonetheless, the pizza itself was tasty if not a bit too cheesy.  The crust is thin and the cheese thick, so I used a fork/knife method to eat.
author: Naoko M.

description:
One of the best Italian places in this side of town, certainly in West Portal.

I go there a lot for the seafood pasta... you know it's good when the sauce isn't runny and delicately clings to the fork.  Good appetizers.  Desserts are average.

Owner and servers are Italian.  Atmosphere is good.  Would go with groups of 4 or less.  

Only negative is not the food, but the parking.  West Portal is notoriously difficult for finding parking.  Not like the WP I knew growing up.
author: yohs m.

description:
This place really reminds me of one of those family-owned Italian restaurants (is it? I wasn't too sure!).

Whenever I come in, I see the same hosts, two older men, and they've always been extremely friendly to me and my friends.

The food is good. I think the quality is SO much better than Olive Garden and plus, the food tastes a lot more authentic.

The price you pay is definitely worth it. :) Finding parking around West Portal around dinnertime is a bit hard though, so maybe park on one of the side streets and just walk on over.
author: Melissa D.

description: A very pleasant dining experience.  Attentive staff and very good food.  The tomato dipping sauce for the 2 varieties of bread they served was excellent.  The spaghetti bolagnese reminded me of the sauces my maltese friends parents served....yummy and cooked with care.  The lamb shank was also very good.  The dessert selection has some winners in the chocolate pot de creme and the creme brulee.  A solid 4 stars for this restaurant.
author: Doug W.

description:
Looked cute enough from the outside, catchy name and whenever I was in the neighborhood, it seemed to be busy.

Not so impressed with the food. The foccacia bread was served with butter, which I thought was odd. I sampled my friend's spinach salad and it tasted strangely of raw egg. I thought perhaps they were trying to create a modified version of caesar dressing but something just wasn't right. I ordered ravioli as my main course, which the server had confirmed was indeed homemade. The swiss chard was an interesting twist on the typical spinach but it just wasn't enough to make this dish more than just okay.

The hostess and servers were very professional - I just wish the food was as good.
author: Kristi K.

description:
This place is a good example of bad Italian food. Isn't Italian food all about fresh ingredients made to order? The veggies were mush. The gnochi was mush... Indicators that they had been cooked ahead of time. The brushetta was on stale toast. Creme brullee was eggy and the brullee was too hard because it was pretorched. It's like no actual cooking was done, only heating and assembly.

Nice staff, decent atmosphere, but the food just wasn't that good.
author: Sang N.

description:
I agree with Janice D; excellent service, average food.  I took my  grandmother here for her birthday because I didn't want to go to Olive Garden as she suggested.  We had a wild mushroom appetizer, Pasta Portofino (white sauce with scallops and shrimp), risotto with shrimps and tomato sauce, and a stuffed chicken (cheese and prosciutto, I believe).  Everything was tasted so-so.  I actually don't plan on ever returning and I'm kind of wishing that I had gone to Olive Garden instead.  

We did enjoy the wine...I had a glass of Malbec, which was delicious!
author: Dexters Parents p.

description:
Love this place. The atmosphere is very nice, and the staff is very friendly. As with most Italian places, it comes with unlimited amounts of bread. Their bread is very good. It's fluffy and fresh. 

The selection of pasta is good, and their pizzas are excellent as well. I generally get penne or corkscrew pastas. I tried their lasagna once (first time), but I figured out that I'm not really a big fan of it in general.

The place isn't that big, so large groups should get a reservation and prepare to sit tight. My group of friends probably successfully sat 11 people once. But that 1/3 of the place.
author: Sam W.

description: This place fell off a cliff and took a  turn for the worse since last review, not sure what the deal is here, new owner, new kitchen staff, etc..It's too bad because it was really good about a year ago.  Started off with stale bread and things kept getting worse. Root of the problem is simple, they are not serving fresh food, probably several days old. No wonder a previous reviewer got food poisoning.
author: Vince S.

description: Nothing all that special.  The food was A-OK.  Came here with my family when I wasn't hungry, so maybe that's the reason for the three stars.  They have a couple of nice dishes, but nothing special to write yelp about.
author: Bran C.

description:
I really like this place.  The owner is always really friendly when we come, whether it's just my wife and I, or we bring in 8 family members.  They're very accommodating and efficient.  The food is always tasty, though possibly slightly on the oily side (pastas).  The thin pizzas are delicious.

One minor complaint is that recently there has been some upselling, which detracts from the otherwise warm, friendly experience.
author: Tim J.

description: Very Disapointed Indeed !!!!  My  friends and I decided to meet @ spiazzo one of my favorite restaurants in west portal . ! As soon as we sat down ....oh boy ! The cook I think he's name was tony came to our table and had a terrible attitude . Was he drunk ? He was so disrespectful to us . I come to this restaurant all the time  ! The servers are always so attentive and the food is yummy ! This guy's  bad attitude completely ruin our night . I think I'm going to take a long break form this place and hope that he will be gone  by the time I go back . Is to bad.  :  (
author: Matthew C.

description:
A good place to stop by for dinner after a movie. 
My date and I enjoyed an appetizer with eggplant, goat cheese and tomato's. I was hoping the dish would have hothouse tomatoes. No they where just unripe tomato's. The tortellini with ricotta was fresh and flavorful. However, My companions risotto was just OK.  Disappointed by the Wine by the glass list. It was crappy wine by the glass and decent wine by the bottle. Bottle prices are affordable. Very quaint atmosphere and great service.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Don't go here looking for interesting or amazing food. This is an old school place. The kind you can find in any well appointed suburb. That wasn't what warrants the two stars though nor initially was the wait staff. They were very attentive through out the meal. We ordered the Gnocchi, a pizza and started with a salad.  

They split the salad for us and I found a black curly hair in my portion. When called over to let the waiter know. He said "where? well let me..." I was in a bit of disbelief about him wanting to see it but picked it out with my fork while he went on to say "Are you sure it's not just a fiber from the greens or the beans" He said I don't see it and fingered the greens I had pulled aside. My husband and I staring at the hair now on his finger said in unison "It's right there" and he still claimed not to see it. (maybe he just needs new glasses)

Ok I know things like hair, bugs and other unsavory items are in food all the time that we eat and never see and I may just have found a napkin to wad it up into had it been insanely delicious.  To have the waiter even begin to question its where abouts and not just take it away is bad service. On top of all of that they charged us for half the salad because my husband ate his. That's weird.
author: Heather M.

description:
This is a cute comfy little restauraunt in a cute little neighborhood. The staff is family friendly and the food is good. Nothing spectacular but you will always get good italian food and attentive friendly service here. Great place for a relaxed dinner.
Never fails.
author: Jocelyn J.

description:
This is a great Italian restaurant. I feel as though West Portal has many great restaurants. This is one of them. 
Whenever I make the trek out to this area I am always glad i did. This place in particular has a lot of great options. I usually get the pasta bolognese or the penne with salmon. The polenta and bruschetta are also very good as appetizers. I find the portions here rather large and always have left overs. 
Great place.
author: Wes P.

description:
One of my BFF opened the Italian culinary experience door to this restaurant, which now became a place I bring others.   I been back about a dozen times and you know that the abundance of Italian restaurants out there and to have me going back, they must did right by me.  

There is something very cozy about being there, maybe its their great service, ambiance, or maybe the size of the place...felt like home, although my home looks nothing like it.  I take care of my out-of-towners, Xmas group dinners, dates, catching up with friends, and dates there.  I love the place.  

Tips:
It's a fairly busy restaurant, so go early or non-prime times.  And to be fair, I tried almost everything there and find that it's been mostly consistently good.  

Cons: The food is sometimes a little heavy on the salt, I do not like their stuffed pepper (to be honest), and I'm not crazy about their pizzas.  Careful at the door way since it slopes down, I almost slipped couple of times during wet season.

Pros: So I normally order pasta, meat, and fish dishes.  I can tell that lots of fresh ingredients and well executed cooking.  Great prices for the portions too.

This place will remain one of my favorites and I will be back...hopefully soon.
author: Vanna S.

description: It's a nice restaurant but I have a couple complaints.   Five of us went there on a Friday eventing 7pm, it was crowded, everyone's convivial, fine.  To drink I ordered carbonated water (agua com gas).  They brought a glass of sparkling water, not a bottle with a label, and as soon as I drank it, I knew why.  It had a heavy taste of chlorine.  I'm used to drinking filtered water at home, so the chlorine taste was quite distinctive to me.   They must carbonate their own tap water to save costs.   They should at least use filtered water.   Terrible taste, IMO.    Next complaint:  the salad was so drenched in oil it was inedible, really.   The waiter never asked what we wanted on it,  it just came with a ton of oil.  None of us could eat it.  We just left it.  The rest of the food was okay.  One additional note:  not much choice for vegans.  Roasted potatoes and salad, that's about it.  The waiter was polite and efficient (except about asking about the salad dressing) and all the waiters come to your table and sing "Happy Birthday" if it's your birthday, which is fun.  Seven tables got sung to during the hour that we were there.
author: Michael H.

description:
I love this place.  I go there almost everytime something good happens, like a raise or new job, etc...  

The staff is so pleasant and professional.  The food is reasonably priced, and always delicious.  This is a perfect neighborhood!  And the vibe is really good.  I think it's most suitable for people who are at least in their 30s - not a lot of young, obnoxious people.

I wish there were more restaruants like Spiazzo.   [AND NO, I don't work there!]
author: John B.

description:
We used to come here almost every weekend when it first opened. The food was always really tasty. Last weekend, we decided to come here for dinner when we couldn't find any parking in the Sunset and missed our dinner reservations there.

We are always able to find parking in West Portal, and we were seated almost immediately at Spiazzo. Faboo! The place was busy, but the service was quick if a bit lackadaisical.

I did enjoy the pear salad although our waiter offered me freshly ground pepper almost as an afterthought (he remembered when he brought out pepper for the salads at the table next to ours). ,I also ordered the flank steak but was never asked how I wanted it cooked. I prefer my steaks rare, so when it came out with nary a pink spot, I was disappointed. 

My dining companion, however, was really impressed and satisfied with his petrale sole, and I was jealous with how good it looked. . On the plus side, we spent less time dining than we did looking for parking in the Sunset.

Maybe, I just ordered the flank steak on the wrong night, or they don't know how to cook steak (I usually order pasta or seafood). We'll probably go back sometime to give them another chance. I don't know if I would go on a night when they are trying to turn tables as fast as they did that night.
author: Diane A.

description:
I really like this place. It's a family owned place, and the little old Italian man who's the papas of all papas comes out and says hi and greats you and wishes you a good day. he's so cute, I come for him half the time.

The food is very classic Italian food, if you're looking for Americanized Italian food you're probably not going to like this place. But this is good Italian Italian food. I have never been disappointed by this place, and I always try to order something different every time I go here. The staff is very friendly and the service is very good.
author: Casey Z.

description:
Spiazzos reminds me of Olive Garden but with cheaper prices. 

They have pretty good food, wine, and bread (which actually tastes like bread). But as with many italian food joints in the city, it's many not be the place to go if you're looking for something authentic, but for what it is, they do pretty well.
author: Diane N.

description: We love this place!  The service and the food are phenominal.  The pizzas are my favorite.  We go here almost on a weekly basis.
author: Matthew G.

description:
So the other day I felt a little old, so I went to West Portal.  Ah, the Blue Hairs were there to restore my youthfulness.  Nah, I went to meet a friend who was staying at Grandma's in St. Francis Wood (hey-o).  

She took me to Spiazzo.  I liked it.  I had a pasta with sundried tomatoes, broccoli and cream sauce.  Delicious.  My dining partner had a pizza with three toppings, prosciutto, olives, and artichokes.  The house red was good enough for my primitive taste, and the service was fair.  If the average $15 per plate price included, perhaps a glass of wine or a dessert, I'd be a little more satisfied.

I tend to judge an SF restuarant in a very "black-and-white" sort of way: "Would I come all the way to ____  just to eat here?"  If the answer is "yes" then, well, you get the point.  So no.
author: Eric S.

description:
This is a nice neighborhood Italian restaurant. Service was superb. With the extensive menu selections, I was unable to make a decision. Asked the waitress, who had a cute Italian accent, and she suggested I have the rack of lamb. The selection also included a chicken breast, italian sausage, vegetables, and roasted potatoes. The person I was dining with chose to have the chicken breast stuffed with mozzarella and proscuitto, also a recommendation from the waitress.

When the food came, it was definately not lacking any flavor. Every aspect of the dish was memorable. The portions were also a nice healthy size.

Great atmosphere and the prices were definately reasonable.
author: Eric L.

description:
Definitely order the homemade fettuccine, it was delicious, plentiful and tasted fresh. What I mean by that is it isn't over-sauced or dried out so yummy and warm for the heart

I loved the tiramisu! It was not too sweet and light and fluffy like a marshmallow. 

As for parking, you really have to circle at least once since there are always people coming and going. There is also a parking lot about a block away where it is free after six.
author: Thia T.

description: An excellent place for delicious Italian food, beautiful atmosphere, and good service. When our server found out it was my date's birthday, they brought out a luxurious tiramisu.
author: Daine D.

description:
1. Food was decent. Good rosemary bread. Service was impeccable. I'm pretty sure our waitress was watching and waiting for us to sip our water so she could refill our glasses.

2. I agree with one other reviewer about the expediency of the food. It was almost too fast, meaning it was already sitting under a lamp, or they didn't cook it all the way through, which leads me to...

3. My boyfriend and I both got sick. \

This place still gets two stars because I know that sometimes, shit happens in the kitchen, service was great, it's cheap, and the food tasted alright.
author: Sachi T.

description:
I had great food, a nice wine and the Bruschetta with a twist...the Mushroom Bruschetta was very nice, and to me very unique. 
The Tiramisu was a little heavy on the liqueur but I didn't complain...hehe 

I'll return again if I'm in the area.
author: James R.

description: i've been here a few times, i love the bread they give you here. this is one of the reasons why i come back.. the waiter is pretty nice and funny as well.  you can park in the back and walk through tha alley way to get back on west portal. i usually get the tortelloni which is actually a lot for me, but the last time i was here i had the gnocchi, which was ok.. i think i'm going to stick to my tortelloni. we had their tiramisu here before and it was good, but after eating pasta, i would share the tiramisu because it was very filling.
author: Belinda C.

description:
I thought this place was just ok.  I tried the spaghetti calabrese and I thought it was ok.  The risotto was a bit too oily and soggy.  The salmon pizza was way too salty.  It's probably b/c of the capers.
