Service was not bad.  The server was attentive and we kept getting our waters refilled, which was nice.

I tried the apple tartlet for dessert and they must've used super green apple b/c it was super sour.  The crust was ok.

This place gave me mixed feelings.  It's almost perfect, yet they do something to mess it up.  Like the pizza.  It had good cheese and crust, but everything was just too salty.  Same for dessert.  

Pricing is fair.
author: AhLin C.

description:
Very good traditional food.  For kicks, I tried the mushroom appetizer with a variety of them pan fried. Tasty! 

The Saltimbocca alla romana, veal covered in proscuitto and fontina cheese in a marsala sauce was excellent as well. 

Relaxing place with good food, sometimes that is all you need.
author: Jan Michael K.

description: Really good risotto. A little pricey, but hey it's good.
author: Adam L.

description:
I come here because of how home like it feels.
They come out with great food, the service is top notch, and the environment is like a friendly little neighborhood bistro.
The server actually made a mistake, charged my card, and said that it didnt go through and that we should pay with cash. So i went to the bank, came back, and the server said it went through and that he was soo sorry and that our next meal was fee. At this point I was just like whatever, the food was good, the service was pretty compliant, and the dinner was good.
I would probably come here again to redeem my free meal, along with a couple bottles of wine and my GF.
author: Eric A.

description: Super authentic food. Everything is good you can't go wrong. The staff is also very friendly and helpful when choosing your entree. To-go or eat in you can't beat this food!!
author: Kris M.

description:
We came here on a weekday for a friend's birthday. Being the geniuses that we are, no one thought about making reservations for a party of 5 at 7pm on a weekday. Thankfully, the restaurant was not full (usually a bad sign...) and we were seated immediately by a lovely waitress that was very accommodating. Not only did we not make reservations, we had the nerve to bring in a birthday cake and requested them to store it for us while we surprised our friend who worked across the street. I must give them high praises for their friendliness and high-quality customer service.

After a terrible attempt at ambushing our friend, we brought him over to Spiazzo and were again warmly greeted. A charming, older Italian gentleman handed menus to us and made suggestions. From the vibe that I got, he is either the manager or the owner.

We ordered the Penne Al Salmone, Fussilli Allas Genovese, Spaghetti Portofino, Pizza Tricolore, and Pizza Spiazzo. Each dish was extremely hearty and tasty. There was a good amount of salmon in the Penne Al Salmone but it was strange to see the salmon flaked and mixed with the pasta, instead of being served as a whole salmon fillet or even chunks. My friend said the pesto was good, but was rather heavy. She ended up eating barely half the dish. The Spaghetti Portofino came with a few plump, juicy shrimp and fresh, lightly seared scallops. The sauce however seemed really thick and creamy and should have been lighter to allow the fresh seafood to shine. The pizzas were good but not mind-blowing. It had a thin crust and came piping-hot. There was the perfect amount of cheese and the various toppings added the perfect amount of texture and savoriness to the lovely sauce and melty mozzarella.

After we finished the dishes (or rather, the ladies at the table packed their half-finished meals in take-home boxes), we asked the nice Italian gentleman to bring out the cake. As sweet as can be, he brought out the cake and some plates and silverware. Then, he led us in a rousing rendition of Happy Birthday. However he threw us a curveball and began to sing in Italian. It was extremely charming and endearing. I wish he was my uncle, but I will avoid my uncle issues in this post... To make things even better, when the bill came, we were surprisingly not charged a cake-cutting fee, as is standard at most other institutions. We felt obliged to tip generously and thank him profusely. 

Bottom line, the food was good and the service was amazing. If the dishes were lighter and the pizza was more spectacular, it would be receiving five stars from me.

Thank you, old nameless Italian gentleman. We need more of you in this world.
author: Gary L.

description: This place was packed, we were greeted and seated. I asked if there were any flights and the server was very rude, saying we are not that type of place...ok.The special seafood salad was on a bread plate and tasted like frozen fish with a terrible dressing, my seafood stew was ok. A disappointing experience and I will not return.
author: Dee D.

description: I haven't had pasta in a really long time so we headed over here. The service was great and ver attentive, it made the experience wonderful! Dessert was something with wine sauce on it and it was very tasty, I do recommend adding a little bit of nuts to it.
author: Tiff W.

description: Relaxing atmosphere, great service, delectable authentic Italian food and variety of wines to complement each entree and dessert. Will definitely come back!
author: Tia L.

description: I've never had a bad meal at Spiazzo, and the service is embarrassingly good.  Normally I skip desserts at restaurants, but here: Get.  The.  Lava.  Cake.  It's not on the menu, but it's incredible.  Make sure you ask for gelato on top.
author: Franklin G.

description:
SF Food Inspection Rating: 96

Went here for lunch with the bf last week.

Great selection and BIG portions. The service was very good and I definitely want to come back for dinner. 

Their fritattes (sp?) were so flavorful but not greasy. I had a healthy portion of the Penne Manzane, very delicious.
author: Kristina C.

description: My wife and I had two terrible dinners at Spiazzo Ristorante.  She had salmon cooked in foil with vegetables.  The salmon tasted old, the vegetables undercooked, and there was no flavoring.  It was just awlful.  I had chicken with artichokes.  The chicken was beaten and tough with no flavor except covered by a lemon sauce that tasted phony.  My vegetables were overcooked.  We had a 1/2 bottle of Shiraz from Argentina.  It tasted like one day old mediocre wine.  All of this dining for a mere $70 including tip.  Never again, Spiazzo!
author: Tom W.

description: I would have to agree with the other Yelpers...use to come here all the time when I was younger. This was my mom's favorite restaurant...the prices have stayed around the same however the portion size has shrunk.  The food quality has gone down too...what a shame this use to be a great restaurant.
author: Michelle Y.

description:
Eh.  It's decent standard Italian, but there is a much better pasta/pizza place down the street.  Once I figured that out, I rarely go here anymore.

It's not bad, it's just not very good.
author: Alison S.

description:
We had dinner there tonight.  We were looking to try something new in SF after our visit to CA Academy of Sciences.  So we google mapped a random area and picked a place.  The neighborhood is cute with a little theatre and cute shops.

Best bruschetta we have ever had.  I had a pasta and seafood dish, Ellitott had a veggie pizza.  Dinner was good.  We didn't have any wine which may have made it even better.

Given all the over eating lately we didn't indulge in dessert.

Service was great.  Place is cute.  I'd give it a 3.5 if I could.
author: Teresa G.

description: We entered Spiazzo on a Sunday night around 7, and the place was packed. The friendly owner himself showed us to our table and took care of us throughout the night. After munching on whole wheat bread and a red pepper dip, everyones food arrived. Generous portions were served, but only one was not finished. I had the gnocchi, which had classic flavors that left me pleased. It was actually better than the gnocchi that I had in Italy. Last but not least, make sure you save room for dessert. Make sure everyone gets something different, I highly recommend the chocolate truffle.
author: Margo D.

description: Spiazzo is my go-to Italian restaurant in San Francisco. I've been fortunate enough to have traveled to Italy before and every time I bite into Spiazzo's Penne al Salmone, I'm instantly whisked away to the picturesque restaurant along the coast where I first tried this dish. I've never had the made-in-Italy counterparts of other dishes on the menu and therefore can't speak to their authenticity. I can, however, tell you that they are delicious as well. The Spaghetti alla Vongole ranks among the best renditions I've had. The sauce is well-seasoned, brimming with flavor, and with the perfect consistency. I adore the generous use of roasted garlic in the rosso sauce. The clams are also sizable, in contrast to the puny ones I have had on many occasions at other establishments. The service is exceptional. Even during a busy service, the staff are attentive, friendly, and never try to rush you. When you dine here, it's easy to forget that you're a restaurant where the food costs the same as (sometimes even less than) Olive Garden, which I assure you will not taste half as good.
author: Jenny C.

description:
Another one of my parent's neighborhood favorites. We've been coming here for years and the food consistency hasn't gone down, nor have the prices expanded ridiculously. 

Antipasto sampler: bruschette (one tomato, one marinated mushroom), prosciutto, fresh mozz, canellini beans, marinated artichoke hearts, basil-all good, fresh tasting. Decently priced. 

I usually order the penne al salmone: which is a pretty good sized serving of penne with a salmon tomato cream sauce. Not too rich or oversized. Last time there, I got the last order of osso bucco and savored that winey, tomatoey, meaty sucker to the end. The veal was tender and easily fork cut. I've never had a real clunker meal here; everything is fresh, cooked to order and toothy. That being said, I have to mention that the pizza could be better. It's never to the point where I don't want to eat it-but don't come to Spiazzo for the pizza. The crust doesn't quite get that blistered crispiness of a real 500-600 degree oven. If you have small children, steer them towards the spaghetti bolognese and they'll be happy campers. 

My bias also comes from the waiter that used to be employed here who gave me a Hello Kitty notepad when I was 12 or 13, when I admired the one he was using to take orders on. They are also Italian owned and run. That my friends, is a NEIGHBORHOOD restaurant.
author: Alexis W.

description:
This is my favorite Italian restaurant which says a lot since i spend a lot of time in North Beach. It is not at all pricey, the portions are big, the food is flavorful, customer service is wonderful, and its a cute family location.  I have had the majority of appetizers, have absolutely no complaints.  

Every pasta or pizza dish has been huge and full of so much flavor.  Great selection of wines. Desserts are so tasty.

Favorites:
Bruschetta
Tuna Carpaccio
Pear Salad
Chicken Picattino
Gnocchi
Forest Hill Cabernet Sauvignon
author: N S.

description:
My husband and I come here on our date nights and we love it. The staff is always super friendly and I have never had bad food here. I highly recomend the zuppa de pesce (fish/seafood stew)- it truily is amazing...I find myself craving it quite often.
The price isnt bad either.
author: Jynni T.

description:
Tortelloni in Salsa Rosa is my hands down favorite from Spiazzo's! When you first get your plate you may think the portion is too small, but after you eat, it's perfect!!! The flavor is super good!!! 

Sometimes I like to switch it up and the Spaghetti alle Vongole, but I order it with the white sauce!!! 

We always go there for a "work lunch" and co-workers from my work seem to like the omellette dish they have, too!
author: M R.

description:
Spiazzo Cafe has yet to dissapoint me an it has been a many years now.  I started going to the place as a pipmle faced high school student trying to swoon the ladies.

Now I still go back, still get great service and the wait is always manageable.  If you are  looking for good italian food quickly this is the spot to go!
author: Nicholas S.

description:
Excellent neighbourhood italian.  I have been impressed with all of the dishes I have ordered in particular the house made pastas.

The wait staff in general is great and very friendly plus it a restaurant you don't have to worry about bringing kids.
author: Jarlath O.

description: Great place. Really nice atmosphere, the service is good, prices are reasonable. Will definitely come back here!
author: Anya S.

description: always one of my favorite.  Great food, friendly and absolutely clean.  Definitely a must eat place when u are in town.
author: tomcat f.

description: The service was great and the manager was friendly. may my meat lasagna was mostly pasta but my gfs steak was great.
author: Kasra V.

description:
Stopped in here on a whim and found it to be a most pleasant meal.

I ordered the Pollo Alla Parmigiano -- it was the best I can remember having.  The chicken was tender and not overcooked -- I've had this in other places where the chicken had been cooked into submission and might as well have been a rubber-sole from a shoe.

The entree was served with roasted potatoes and sauteed vegetables -- all done perfectly.

The staff was extremely pleasant and attentive.
author: D Z.

description: I'm a native San Franciscan but moved out of the City several years ago and visit family and friends often. Ask any of them what my favorite restaurant is and they'll tell you it's Spiazzo. I love that it's consistent. The food is alway delicious. Alway prepared carefully, fresh, delicious. And I love that it's not too expensive. The house Chianti is terrific and they're not stingy with the pour. I must say I'm also charmed by the real Italian waiters, speaking Italian. The polenta and the pear salads are my favorites, and second would be the lasagna. Yum. Try it and I promise you won't be disappointed.
author: Ann B.

description: I really liked this place!  Went with my mom and 91 year old grandma and everyone loved it.  The service was great and they were awesome with my grandma.  We ordered the antipasto which had roasted peppers, large white beans bruschetta with tomato and a bruschetta with mushroom and pesto.  All of it was awesome!  My pasta bolognese was not only a giant portion but it was good too.  I would definitely come back as their prices and service are refreshing during these hard economic times.  Ooh also major points for being insanely fast!
author: Kirsten M.

description: Love heading to the City. Love finding untried places and finding great food.   For home style - Trattoria food with a restaurant style ambiance, this is a great choice.  I found good quality, tasty, wonderful Italian food for a good price.  This is value.  My son had the Tagliata Gorgonzola.  Tasty.  You could taste the cheese, it wasn't overwhelmed by the pasta.  I had the Calabrese - again comfort food, better than mom's better than most of the tratoria or osterias in Frienze, Siena, Rome, Verona etc..  Is this a top of the line, top priced, nueve - trendy-Italian place.  nope... just great food, great feel, good value, great night out.
author: Michael D.

description: I like this place. It has a very cozy atmosphere, good food (not excellent though), decent wines!! Never had a bad meal here and all portions are hearty!!
author: Blue C.

description: I love coming here with my boyfriend if I have some extra cash. If you really want to go all out this is somewhere you can definitely do that very thing. On the same note that it can be pricey if you stick more to the pastas and pizzas it can be an amazing 2 people just under 25 bucks type of thing. I love their pasta that has a white wine sauce with chicken,sun dried tomatoes, and broccoli.  Haha, cant remember the nice Italian name for it.  Ace really liked the pizza with salmon.  Love the family owned experience and food!
author: Jen S.

description:
Unfortunately the food quality has decreased since the last few times I've eaten here. I don't know if they changed chefs or what, but the pasta I had last night was very mediocre. It was pesto tortellini and the sauce was pretty bland which meant I had to salt it.  It was also kind of creamy which pesto shouldn't be, and the menu didn't mention it being a creamy pesto so that kind of threw it off...also, the portion was less than satisfying; way too small. After I finished, I sopped up the leftover sauce with some bread (something I rarely do at then end of a meal unless I'm still pretty hungry). I don't understand what's with all the skimping.

And this is what really skewed my opinion of Spiazzo's...I ordered my spiazzo favorite- Zabaglione- and it was absolutely terrible.  I don't know if it was old or what, but the recipe was so different from how I remember it being that I almost didn't finish it and I was tempted to send it back.  It was mealy (think cream of wheat texture) and tasted weird. I ate it all because they were busy and I didn't have the energy to complain, but I won't be ordering that again....it's sad to see your menu favorite take a quality nose-dive.
author: L. Renee D.

description:
also came here twice with a teacher. the same teacher, in fact, as the one i went with to Bursa just down the street. don't remember what i had the first time, but i do remember it was good enough that i wanted to return. 

the last time i came, it was right before Christmas 2009. went for lunch and ordered the clam pasta. normally, i'm really afraid to order seafood pasta b/c of unfresh seafood and that awful fishiness that comes with it. i also wasn't too keen on the idea of clams and tomatoes put together. those two things can clash, like salmon and cheese. 

however, i ordered it anyways, and it was GREAT! $12.95 for a huge plate of pasta. it had what us canto ppl call "wok hay" or "wok air." it's a certain... je ne sais quoi (wow, i had to google how to spell that....) that comes with great chinese food, from being kissed by the flames of a powerful stove. anyways, the tomato sauce was and refreshing, but still felt hearty and stewed. the clams were nothing short of excellence.  they were all in their shells which means they're fresh, right? spiazzo also gave me a plate just for the shells, which is a nice touch.

the people that work here, as ppl have mentioned, are authentically italian, making it seem very homey and cute. very unlike a pomodoro, even if it has a tomato in its logo. i'm coming back! love this place!

i'm really happy that west portal has so many great places to eat. too bad parking is awful. there was actually a study made on the "true price" of parking here a decade or so ago - found about it while working at a transportation research group, and i loved that it brought me home. :)
author: Melissa C.

description: I'll start with the positive...our server was extremely nice and very attentive. That makes it harder for me to write this review...but, to be true to Yelp, I must. From beginning to end, the food was extremely average. It started with the bread, which I think was baked in-house, but didn't seem fresh at all...and butter wrapped in foil just doesn't cut it at this level of restaurant. The tortellini soup was bland chicken broth with average cheese tortellini and everything that followed was along those same lines. Bottom line...this was well disguised mid-level comfort food.
author: Janet D.

description: Great Caesar salad and WONDERFUL spaghetti with mushrooms, peas and light cream sauce. And great service too!
author: Nancy N.

description: Came here on a Saturday night for friend's birthday. Wouldn't suggest this place for a group over 4 since the layout of the place isn't really suited for extended tables without making the aisle awkward. Tried the Risotto on the special's list. Not overly impressed with the entree, probably because it had too much of a white wine aftertaste and took me twice as long to finish my entree since it was still piping hot 20 mins into eating it so I was last to finish in my group. The positive's I can say about this place would be waiter service and their bread.
author: Steven C.

description: I have been here three times now and the food was edible, but I can't say that it is memorable or that I have ever craved the cuisine here. More out of convenience, I have stopped in. Same for tonight, but I doubt that I will ever stop in again. The waiter said, "I will get to you" in a dismissive tone when I signaled him after waiting a reasonable time for my requested oil and balsamic. He also pushed the vino, but when I declined, offered lemon for my water, but never brought it. Overall, these hurried male staff seem more interested in the diner's money versus their culinary satisfaction. I will skip this place in the future, and will not recommend it.
author: Eileen M.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants. The menu is extensive and every dish I have tried is fantastic. We have many of our family celebrations at Spiazzo and they are always completely accommodating. You never feel rushed and the service is very attentive.  The ambiance is very relaxing. It is a real treat to have a meal at Spiazzo.
author: Julia S.

description:
The New Zealand mussel risotto on New Year's Eve was just OK. I've made creamier risottos myself, and I thought the tomato was a bit too tart. For dessert, I had the strawberry zablagione--my first time trying it, and I enjoyed it, though the alcohol was too strong. 

I saw what my friends ordered, and a lot of the dishes look like cafeteria food. They need to work on that.
author: Michael F.

description: My wife and I have been going to Spiazzo Ristorante for over 12 years and have never been disappointed.  The food is always excellent, the wait staff friendly, and the ambiance pleasant and clean without pretension.  Their spaghetti bolenase (not sure of spelling) is the best I've ever had.  It always a real treat when we visit Spiazzos.
author: A C.

description: Overall, I thought the exprience was good. Had good waiters, wasnt crowed so we got a seat right away for 4. Good soup and food, but didnt have big servings and was a little pricy. The food again was very well cooked and full of flavor. Nice place to go on those nights where you want to go for good food and ice cream after dinner.
author: Travis G.

description: Cute Italian restaurant with good prices and delicious food.  It's also kind of refreshing to go to a neighborhood where parking isn't really an issue.
author: Rebecca G.

description: I can never decide btw. the spicy sausage pizza and the lamb -- both are frickin out of this world ! whew, I had to curse to proclaim my love for this Eden. I would also consider surrendering an ovum for their magnificent grilled portobello. and maybe a lesser-used vital organ for that fantabulous polenta appetizer. this is WP's gem !
author: Prima D.

description: This is a diamond in the rough. Quaint little Italian cafe with interesting and "not run of the mill". Salmon with penne pasta, mmmmmmmgood. Its a small place but never really hard to get a table. And right down the street from West Portal muni station...party on.
author: Erin F.

description: This has become our standby. It is always good and so far we have always been seated right away. I still haven't gotten a seat at Roti next door. The food is consistently good. I recommend pasta dishes.
author: Stephen W.

description:
I was in the West Portal area the other night and hankerin' for some Italian food when I spotted this place. When we walked in, I noticed right away that the restaurant was packed. Always a good sign in my eyes. Everyone was extremely busy, but they quickly cleared a table and seated me and my companion. Warm bread and water were quickly brought to our table. We had just enough time to peruse the menu before the waitress came over to take our orders. We asked what the restaurant was known for (as is our custom) and the waitress quickly apologized and said it was her first night. She had come in for training and the restaurant was so busy that the just set her free to get started. Nothing like diving right in. We ordered the Portabello and Spinach salad to share for a first course and Gnocchi and Lamb Risotto for our main courses. Even though the place was busy, our salad came very quickly. The flavors were great. The portabello was meaty and grilled to perfection and the dressing was made from what tasted like a very good balsamic vinegar. The spinach was fresh and crunchy. Thumbs up for this dish. The main courses came not too long after. The Gnocchi was very good. They were firm, but not too heavy, and served in a tomato sauce with prosciutto and mushrooms. The Lamb Risotto had an earthy flavor (due to the presence of much nutmeg) which I love. The only drawback was that it was slightly over salted. The portions were huge with enough left over for 2 lunches the next day. All in all a great experience.
On a funny side note, the couple sitting next to us were quite a floor show. Obviously drunk from too much wine, the woman kept getting louder and louder. Nothing the server did was good enough for her as she chastised her for "not having enough fun with the Parmesan cheese." When her entree came (some kind of chicken with a white sauce) she took one bite and called over the server. "Does this sauce have flour in it? I specifically requested the sauce to have no flour in it." Now - I don't know about you guys - but I've never seen a white sauce made without flour, at least not in your average Italian restaurant. Now, I understand that some people have serious food allergies and to that I am very sympathetic. However, this woman had been eating foccacia by the fistfuls earlier. Hello? Bread is made from FLOUR! Anyway, I guess you had to be there.
If you are in West Portal, check this place out.
author: Jamie M.

description: Spiazzo is great for a decently priced, tasty, Italian meal. 2 entrees and a bottle of wine will only set you back about $40. Every meal comes with bread and a delicious tomato spread. Love this place!
author: Linnea B.

description: I really like this place--  nice upscale atmostphere without the higher prices and decent wine selection.   Lots of locals frequent this place which is always a good sign.  Pasta dishes ranged from $13-$16~  they also serve pizzas and heartier dishes with chicken and beef.  I had the fusilli corkscrew pasta with pesto and wild mushrooms along with a salad.  I also tried their tiramisu  which was light but delicious.  Our waitress was nice, polite and attentive.  Location is convenient without having to look too hard for parking.  Good for groups or a date.
author: Vickie Y.

description: For a neighborhood SF restaurant, Spiazzo offers good, quality food at reasonable prices along with friendly and attentive service.  We went on a recent Sat evening (party of 4) and each of us had a different entree: pasta...a couple of chicken dishes...stuffed pepper...and we were all very pleased with the outcome and would return.  It was a refreshing change from some of our experiences at recent, high-end destination restaurants where the food and service does not meet all the hype.  It is always good to have a "Spiazzo" in the 'hood!
author: Paul L.

description: The waiters are sooo sweet.  My creatures are pretty rambunctious, and they weren't mean about it.  The bruschetta rocks.  The bread is pretty yummy.  I like the stuffed pasta thingies, cannolini.  I always get them confused with cannoli.  Please don't hate me for getting cannollini and cannoli mixed up.  I love them both, heheh.  The sausage pasta is yummy, and we love their spaghetti and meatballs.  We usually go at lunch, but it does get quite crowded.  Not cheap, but, you don't feel cheated.
author: brenda b.

description: Yummy!  This is a somewhat casual restaurant however, you do have cloth napkins and stemware at the table and real adult servers.  Bread comes with butter or an even better tomato-based light  spread.  The menu covers shrimp, fish, scallops, veal, lamb, steak, and all looked great at our surrounding tables.  We came early on a Saturday evening and had pleasant and attentive service.  We enjoyed shrimp, scallops, chicken, and the ravioli.  The side veggies are fresh and lightly done.  The pasta has excellent texture, scallops and shrimp were perfectly done (fresh and not overcooked).  For its' genre (somewhat casual Italian with a full and fresh menu) they get 5 stars.
author: John M.

description:
The food here is pretty good.  There is a wide range of prices with inexpensive pasta and pizza.

The place is small and they really pack you in, so the place feels cramped when crowded.  The wait staff is very professional.

I like this place more than the sum of its parts would indicate.  It's a nice neighborhood place.
author: William W.

description:
3 stars for seating us at a moment's notice for a party of 10. the staff were awesome if moving a little slow, but that's forgive-able on a saturday night in west portal with a party our size.

after our non-profit event, we were starving (some of us ate less than half of a 6-inch subway sandwich all day because of our hectic schedules) and wanted something hot and yummy with lots of good vino. 

the food was all right. i have problems going to italian restaurants these days because i think i make italian dishes better; fresh, from scratch, at home with good olive oil and better ingredients.

i ordered a baked eggplant stuffed with meat and cheese to start. the eggplant was good if a little tough around the skin (they should have fire roasted it first to make it more palatable), but the tomato sauce surrounding it tasted straight out of a tin with no spices. then, for my main, i ordered the zuppa di pesce, something akin to a cioppino, but with a few strands of spaghetti and a pureed tomato base. again, i felt like the dish lacked complexity and flavor. not enough oregano and bay, too much basil. 

i don't think much of the scooby gang minded since we were really happy to just have a table with hot, comfort-style food placed in front of us after a grueling day. and on nights like these, it's not about the food, but about the warmth of the company and from the satisfaction of knowing that months of hard work paid off.
author: May T.

description: I love Spiazzo! It's one of my favorite places to eat. They have great food , and great service. The only bad thing is parking is awfully hard to find.
author: Raymond T.

description: I love this place, I've taken my parents when they are in from out of town and my husband and I love to go there on our nights out.  Why?  Because the food is consistently good (no, not blow your mind fabulous, but really good), it is casual (no need to dress up, a plus in our book), and the nicest staff, and fantastic service!
author: Nica W.

description: Went here for dinner on new years eve and the staff was very friendly and gave us a table with no reservations and no wait. The food was very good and the portions were perfect.... Not too big and not too small. The only downside to the restaurant was that everything seemed a little too rushed. We started and finished our dinner in less than an hour... from the salad to the dessert. The dessert was ok, nothing mind blowing. The creme brulee was too hot and the ricotta cheesecake was alright.....I've had better. But all in all it was a very nice restaurant with a good ambiance. I would go back here again...great little spot!!!!!
author: Niki F.

description: Recession Bomession! We ended up here late on a week night after being rejected by 3 other restaurants on the same street. The Spiazzo waitstaff ushered us in warmly, assured us they were in no rush and peppered us with attention throughout our meal. The food was remarkable, especially considering the crazy food allergies we have to work around. Well done!
author: Apple W.

description: I have been coming here for years, and have never had bad food or bad service. The staff is so friendly and very helpful for fickle customers. Good Italian at a good price is hard to come by, but not here at Spiazzo!
author: Martina B.

description:
I haven't been to many Italian restaurants, but this one is one of the best I've been to.  They have pretty decent food.  And they are very friendly!

I feel like this restaurant is one of those restaurants where they make you feel like a baller even though you really aren't one and they know you aren't one.  It has a feel of a really expensive, luxurious, wear-a-suit, place, but you can go there in shorts and a tank top and they wouldn't blink an eye.  It really is just a mid-scale restaurant made to look fancy.

I recommend the Spaghetti Portofino.  It's one of those dishes on the menu that seems to be more expensive than it really is.  

So if you're a poser and you want to impress a date and take her to a fancy restaurant, but you're poor like me, take her here!
author: SAS Z.

description: This place is not very good. On their pizza, they cut the sausage lengthwise. It looks really unappetizing. Go to Roti or Fresca if you are in the neighborhood, not here.
author: O K.

description: We went there at almost 10p and the place was still alive like it was a lunch crowd.  We were seated right away and the staff was pretty attentive, checking in often.  This place is definitely NOT shy on the wine; by the glass or in the food.  Chi had the veal with a house pour of merlot and I had the chicken marsala with the garlic mashed potatos and garden veggies but I don't know who was more buzzed at the end of the meal.  The prices can be a little high for the entrees but the portions are big enough to justify the cost and the service makes up for it.  The only down side is the parking on W Portal but I would go back.
author: Myke Y.

description:
I've liked this place for years, especially the sauce on their ravioli.

Only (minor) complaint might be that even if they're not super busy you sometimes get the feeling that they're trying to rush you out.

But, it's good food,and they're pretty quick to serve the food - so overall would recommend it.
author: dontdoit d.

description: service was ok...the server and runner was polite and pleasant. the food, however, was unacceptable. i was very disappointed with the food. my companion's pasta and my pasta was mushy, underseasoned, and just plain bland . there is no excuse for an italian restaurant to not understand the concept of al dente pasta. i have been wanting to try this restaurant for a while, but unfortunately i do not plan on returning again.
author: Robbie R.

description: This place smells like garlic-y goodness.  Eating here was truly a pleasure.   I loved that fact that they brought focaccia bread to the table instead of your typical roll or french bread.  I got the pesto and it was very fresh and delicious.
author: Julia E.

description:
i am from san jose and my husband and i decided to catch a movie at century 9 with friends who live in the city.  we were gonna make a night out of it by eating dinner at espetus, a brazilian steakhouse known for their never ending slabs of meat on sticks. despite my efforts, my husband and i left later than anticipated and got to our friends place arounr 9:30pm, trying to catch an 11:15pm premier showing of ocean's 13. 

we decided to eat at spiazzo because its location was convenient (our friends lived right on w. portal).. the staff (from hostess to waiter) was very friendly and welcoming. we got a table for 4 right away and  the bread was warm, butter soft.  i am very simple when it comes to italian (i always order spaghetti with meatballs... you can never get THAT wrong!) and my husband ordered the spicy sausage pizza. our food came out RIGHT away. i was a little put off by the color of the sauce they had in my plate as well as the added peas. i hadent eaten since 2pm that afternoon and was starved beyond belief so i ate it anyway.

-- couldnt have been more wrong. it was DELICIOUS! my husband, who is a BIG pizza fanatic, was very happy with his food selection as well. 

spiazzo is a very quaint italian cafe with a very well priced menu. their portions were HUGE and delicious! and their lemonade and italian soda were great!
author: PauLine R.

description: I love Spiazzo! My boyfriend and I went there to grab some dinner before a movie at the local theater. Even though it was busy, they seated us right away, and brought us bread and an appetizer quickly. They took our orders and we received our food within 10 minutes I think. Very friendly service, looks upscale but the prices are right, big portions, great food...I will definitely keep going back.
author: Lisa N.

description: Been here sporadically a few times before. Service is decent, but the food  was an extreme disappointment. Maybe it was because it was a late dinner on a Sunday and no one wanted to be working, but very, VERY disappointed. Minestrone soup tasted like lentil and kale soup-bleh, pizza was a very watery and a soggy mess, the chicken parm was ok, but hey how can you screw up chicken parm? I do enjoy olives, but not in the mashed potatoes; it's too overpowering. Skip it and go someplace where the food is SOOOOO much better for the price you pay.
author: Max C.

description: Had dinner there once with my Aunt and cousin, the service was kind of being rushed. The bread was fresh and very tasty. We all decided to have the same dish, so we ordered a tuna topped with prawns; mine taste alright but my aunt said hers is not that fresh. We ask our waiter about it, minutes later someone explained the it might be because the tuna was overcooked. Maybe... gave them a three star for they offer to serve us a new dish. I still think I will eat there again though. Maybe I'll order different kind of dish...
author: Bernard V.

description: Service was good and the trout was fresh and delicious. Nice casual setting great for families. Will go there again.
author: david w.

description: Being Italian, I'm very critical of Italian food, but this place is delightful!  I first when there with a group of my girls for a nice dinner when we were in college and then years later I took my Italian mother there and she was amazed by the delicious and fresh the pesto sauce she had on her pasta.  I recently took my always hungry boyfriend there and he loved this place too.  I usually order a special there, but there are so many wonderful choices, it's really hard to choose!  The bruschetta is also really, really tasty and includes olives.  I've never had room for dessert, but the selections look really authentic and I'm sure they are amazing as well.
author: Danielle H.

description: I had a fantastic dinner at Spiazzo last night. I was kinda skeptical while I was skipping through the restaurants on west portal strip however the whole dining experience turned out to be out of this world. It looks pretty dark and not very welcoming outside but the table tops are nicely lit and napkins are precisely ironed. My friend and I ordered the spring mix salad to share and by the time they arrived we were amazed that our split portions were very generously filled with crispy greens. The dressing was light and satisfactory. Then I ordered the house special Pollo Arrosto the half rotisserie chicken and it was cooked to perfection. I loved the half baked-half fried potatoes and steamed veggies accompanied by huge portion. For $15.95, my portion was enormous and it got me full. My friends $11.95 angel hair pasta with fresh garden tomato sauce was to die for. He couldnt finish his portion cause it was gigantic. The wine by the glass was real bargain and they were fat splashes. The staff was extremely friendly and they were on top of their game with cleaning and serving on a timely manner. I will go back to this soon. :)
author: Emre T.

description: Been going to Spiazzo for many years, and it used to be very good, but after my last 2 experiences, I won't be going back. The service is still excellent and friendly, but the food is nothing like it was when this place opened in the 90s. Had to send back the salad (it was literally frozen) and the sauce on the chicken tasted like Campbell's cream of mushroom with heavy cream and lots of salt added. What used to be great grilled veggies now are like the overcooked kind you'd see in a cafeteria steam table. Too bad, this place used to be one of the best on West Portal.
author: Laura R.

description: A cute restaurant hidden in a cute neighborhood. Came here on Saturday evening with the bf and his mom before she was to depart back to Indiana.  There was definitely a warm, inviitng feeling to this place and it also helps that their food is good.  I got the gnocchi which was really good, I was more than happy not to finish it because it meant I had leftovers and it was just as good eating it the second time around.  The Bf had the chicken breast with artichoke hearts, capers in a lemon white wine sauce and his mom got the same thing only with salmon which was one of the specials of the day.  They both raved about their dishes, particularly the white wine sauce.  We were too stuffed for dessert.  The service was really great, everyone there was extremely friendly and accomodating.
author: Alana A.

description: Good Eats  The service is friendly and prompt.  The only complaint i have is that the parking is tough!  But hay, it's not as bad as most other SF neighborhoods.  Try the Bruschetta garlic bread, you won't be disappointed!
author: Dan D.

description:
Lets see...

Wait for your waiter too long...

Waiter says nothing and just stands there waiting for you order pen in hand...

Food comes too fast...

Before appetizer if finished it is removed to make room for main course...

Main course are WAY over oiled and buttered....all dishes taste the same, buttery/oily, salty and too garlicky...

Before EVERY ONE is done, plates are removed...

Pizza is turned upside down in our to-go container, basically ruining it...

Overpriced....

Other than that, I loved it.

Avoid this fake Italian 'restaurant'.
author: l p.

description: Solid, consistent, good food in a warm neighborhood atmosphere. Lovely waitress who completely understands customer service. Will definitely go back!
author: andrea r.

description: A very cute place with warm, friendly service. You could tell that our waiter really knew what he was doing, which is always great. I also enjoyed the fact that the service was not rushed, yet still efficient. The food was very good. The soft warm bread kept coming and our entrees were large and delicious. I would've liked to have tried a dessert but we were on our way to meet up with friends. Prices are reasonable. We'll be back.
author: Betsy W.

description:
So I live in the Inner Richmond, and as such don't really have much cause to go out to eat in West Portal, but I'm now glad that I have.  Spiazzo Caffe is a very good place to enjoy a great, inexpensive meal out with friends.  The staff was very pleasent, and even though our waiter had a VERY thick Italian accent (none of the four people in our party could quite understand everything that he said) he was able to take our orders and give recommendations with very little difficulty.  My wife ordered the Minnestroni while I tried the Saltimbocca Alla Romana, which is veal with Prosciutto and cheese in a wonderful sauce served with vegetable and garlic mashed potatoes.  Our food came incredible fast and the waiters were very attentive.  I loved the food.  It wasn't the best veal I've ever had, but it more than did the trick for $16.  My wife also enjoed the soup, and claimed it was the yummiest she's had.
Overall I recommend Spiazzo Cafee to anyone interested in a good meal in a neat location for very little money.    I know that I'll be back!
author: Jason d.

description:
the bruschetta is the best!!!!!!!!!! i could go into detail, but this sums it up and probably answers your questions about the place:

great food, consistently delicious.

always great service, wait for food isnt long either no matter how busy they are.

main courses run at $12-15 so id say a bit expensive for pasta.

parking is always hard to find at west portal no matter what time it is.

ive been coming here for years and will be for years to come!
author: Raye T.

description: it was Friday night and we were driving through the neighborhood. Well, the wine, ambiance, and service was good.  However, the food was terrible--the worst linguine with clams that I've ever tasted.  Hot pepper burnt my soft palate and the rest of dish was overkill.   My husband had the most simple dish imaginable: pasta pomodoro.  The angel hair pasta was overcooked and the dish tasted muddy. How could a chef destroy a dish that has only olive oil, garlic, pasta, and perhaps parsley??!  Is there a real Italian cooking there?  Did the chef have any formal training? Maybe we just came on a bad night?  Go somewhere else for your Italian fix, my friends!
author: Margery N.

description: I could cook better pasta.  The sauce was blah, I've had better canned.  When I went, there was no one there.    The bread they serve is dry, crumbly and very bland.  They serve it with packets of butter; last time I checked seasoned olive oil, blasalmic vinegar and and sea salt did wonders for bland, dry bread.  The place is small and the kitchen is open, so it can be seen by the guests.  Not such a good idea when the restaurant is clearly using canned goods to create their meals.  This is San Francisco, a huge foodie city! Even hole in the wall pizza parlors use fresh ingredients!!!! This place is overpriced for what they serve.  Take my advice, go to a different Italian restaurant, you will eat better and your wallet will thank you!
author: Katii S.

description: Spiazzo's should serve warm crusty french bread, not the bread they offer. I had the Insalata Misto. The tomato should have been a ripe vine tomato not an under ripe tomato. I had sand in my Clam Spagetti.
author: char l.

description: i had dinner here tonight, it was pretty bad. they really failed at salad dressing, and everything else was kinda hardly mediocre. Except the last time i went i had a killer slice of spumoni gelato cake that was really excellent, nobody else was into getting dessert tonight. i think they were all dying to get away from the creepy waiters who are always hovering in your bubble for some reason even though you already told them that everything was "great" and you dont want a glass of wine "no!".......................
author: lori r.

description: I've been here several times and have not been disappointed. The service is pretty good and the atmosphere is warm and inviting. The food is pretty traditional not like the stuff you would get at the Olive Garden. There isn't one dish that stands out, everything is pretty good.
author: Diane M.

description: Very friendly and excellent service.  They don't hover around or  talk to you too much like some other places we've been.  They let you eat but quick to help.  Good food.  Its one of our go-to places = always reliable.
author: Alex E.

description:
not really a place for a gaggle of college aged girls.  this place is pretty small, and most of the patrons uptight.  at first the waiters were kind of cold to us, but soon warmed up and showed us the respect we deserved! 

i had the gnocchi, it was okay, the sauce was not my favorite. too much.

decently priced, probably best for an adult date or something?
author: Rebecca V.

description: Awful, overcooked then undercooked food, service terrible, weird looking food, really cold inside as well.
author: Sailing A.

description:
average food with decent prices.  it felt like i was being served by one of my old school teachers... didnt seem like he wanted us there.  

i got the bellpepper stuffed with meats... it tasted like meat but consistancy was like tody.  my friend got pasta with lamb... that was actually prettty good.  and my other friend got chicken with mushroom sauce...  the sauce was a little too sweet.  maybe its the asian in me but i wanted to throw some chilie sauce on it.   

we also got the carpaccio... for 8 bucks.. it really really REALLY wanst worth it.  

dont have anyting to complain about though... i bought coupons from restuarant.com... $25 for $3 bucks...  3 $17 dishes + $8 appetizer + 16 tax/tip -25 = 48 for three people. not that bad.. but i probabyl wont come back. theres so many better italian places in the city
author: Doug ..

description: Not very good.. food was below average & believe the other reviewers Olive Garden is better. It's too bad, the only plus side was that the employees there seemed extremely nice & were very friendly. One dish I did order that was better than the rest..was the Saltimbocca Alla Romana- veal scaloppine topped with prosciutto, fontina cheese, fresh sage in marsala sauce. Overall I would reccomend trying a different italian ristorante. This place is pretty expensive also.
author: San X.

description: Spiazzo is all about Italy; there's a feel of "old-world" ambiance in this restaurant just steps from West Portal's MUNI station. It couldn't be better in North Beach. The menu: interesting and always available changing special; selection of wines: broad; waitstaff: friendly, knowledgeable and authentic; food: remarkably well prepared and presented. A co-worker, with family in Italy, said it was as close to home as he's experienced. My favorite used to be: steamed mussels and clams followed by Penne al Salmone.   I've now grown to love the white bean salad (the Insalata Etrusca) and skipping around the menu now to try everything.  My husband loves lasagne (which they now have on the menu), but he's growing to learn to try the other things on Spiazzo's menu because they are wonderful as well.  The pizza that I've had from the authentic pizza oven has been fresh and inspired.  When you go, expect a different experience: you won't be rushed.  Our experiences have always been amazing whether it's just the two of us or when we've gone with groups.  My only disappointment over the years was when they dropped mussels from the menu.  This is a place we go back to over and over again!
author: Jeff S.

description:
So all these people on yelp think they know what they are talking about anyone who gave this place more than one star doesn't have a clue.
I am in the gourmet food business I travel to Italy often, bottom line is I know good food. This is the equivalent of shit on a plate. It was the worst food I have ever had, i wont even say Italian because to compare the two would be disrespectful to the Italian culture. I am Italian American and this is a shame. I had the veal i took one bite and could not take another. I lived in the west portal neighborhood my whole life and why people support this place baffles me. If you have any kind of palate don't go to this place.
author: d m.

description: Found this place on Yelp and decided to give it a try as it's pretty close to where we live.  The service was fantastic!  Food was also good.  Portions were very generous.  Prices were in line.  If someone asked me if this place is good, would I say yes?  For sure.  If someone asked me if I wanted to go back vs. trying another Italian place in SF?  Ehhh, maybe not.
author: Gina R.

description: I'm sure they're nice people but...the cesar salad was 'eh' at best, the pizza was undercooked and too doughy, chewy for my taste. The service - I felt very rushed - we ate as fast as we could and it didn't seem to be fast enough for the staff.
author: Matt B.

description: Very friendly service, good rosemary bread, the caprese tomatoes weren't as ripe as they should have been, and my spaghetti was about average.
author: Julie M.

description: I have been coming here for 2 years- great food, ambiance and service. I can't give 5 stars only because of my loyalty to Pazzia's.
author: Julie H.

description: i really enjoyed this place. I came with family and i thought the service was wonderful. The food was pretty good if you enjoy pastas. It certainly is a huge step above those olive gardens. Prices are moderate. Not expensive and certainly not cheap. But i am hooked and this i would call a nice homely place to be on any evening.
author: Brian Y.

description: Spiazzo Cafe is a great place for affordable yet upscale Italian cuisine.  The ambiance is typical of a fancy Italian restaurant.  I'd suggest an order of the Spaghetti Calabresee.
author: Benjamin F.

description: I stumbled upon this place about a year ago and love it. It's very neighborhood, which I like a lot. The portions are huge and the prices are reasonable for what you get. I love the cesar salad and the polenta with the roasted garlic....yummmmmmmmmmm!
author: Pearl R.

description: Sometimes, you just want good, basic Italian food like your grandma used to make.  The kind with red and white checked table cloths where you don't have to be embarrassed to take your kids and you can leave Dr. Atkins at the door.  Spiazzo is it.  Savor the tangy homemade tomato sauce and good fresh rustic bread with a glass of Chianti.  The raviolis were great and the eggplant appetizers was nice and hearty.  And the dessert menu is as it should be.
author: Laura C.

description:
It is a good place for dinner, i have been here couple times but I am still really like this place. 
My fav order Portabella salad which lists on special menu.
author: mich W.

description: THE favorite Italian for my wife and me when we want great food, service, and atmosphere.  Especially the service!
author: Randal H.

description:
Really nice servers, Really marginal food.  Tried a number of dishes, and nothing registered as above average.  

Don't think we'll be returning any time soon.
author: Kirk P.

description: we have done lunch and dinner.  Neither was a disappointment.  Service was good and parking is a challengel.  We brought our own wine, the waiter was wonderful.  We always tip for the cost of the wine.  The food is really delicious.  We will be back again and again.
author: nina l.

description: my favorite dish here is the zuppa di pesce -- tomato broth with tons of baby shrimp and scallops.   the roast pork loin is scrum-de-li-ishus too, not dry at all.  i really have to start ordering something other than the usual zuppa, especially since the menu is so extensive.
author: iGab C.

description: Love this place.  Been eating here for eight years.  When the owner is the one that takes your order, for nine people, and doesn't need to write anything down - you are on track.
author: Inspector G.

description: We had been to Spiazzo a couple of times before and enjoyed it.  However, tonight we realized that at the core of this business is dishonesty.  We arrived a little after 7 with no reservation.  The restaurant was full.  We put our name in with the hostess that was clearly in training.  She said it would be five minutes.  We gladly waited and witnessed a single diner come in after us and ask for a table and then a couple who were appeared to be regulars also ask the wait for a table.  Both definitely had no reservations because we heard the exchange.  We waited outside while the woman who seemed to be the regular hostess had some discussion with the trainee as a two top table became available and they seated the single diner.  Then a booth opened up and they seated the regulars.  I asked as to when we might be seated and why the diners who arrived behind us  were seated ahead of us and was told by the trainee that they had reservations.  Clearly a lie.  This in of itself, while disturbing, wouldn't prompt me to write this--it gets better.  Once we were seated--next to the single diner that took our table--I heard him order a half bottle of Pinot Noir by its name.  The waiter returned with a bottle of a different winery.  The diner noticed the difference and asked about the discrepancy.  The waiter said "this is your Pinot Noir".  The diner repeated that this was not the one he ordered and the waiter said "oh, we don't have that one, we have this one".  The waiter obviously intended to try to put one over on that man rather than explain that the one he chose was not available.  These two incidents in one visit indicate to me that the management runs their business in this way and I can't support anyone like that.
author: Greg C.

description: love this place! come here all the time. inexpensive for italian, like 13 bucks a plate. i love the penne alla campognola (tastes hella good reheated in a microwave too for some reason). the penne al salmone is delicious too! nice and small in setting too which is nice. i just really like this place.
author: Meegs P.

description: my neighbor recommended that i come here because they had really good food and service, and she was right.  thanks nancy!  we had a birthday party here once, and the waiter was so nice and accomodating.  everyone loved their dish.  i like their fusilli alla genovese, capellini and minestrone soup - they are pretty generous with the parmesan which is freshly grated at your table.  i would definitely go back to try something new.
author: Paulina C.

description: Average food. Prompt service. Parking difficult. Next door to a great wine store!
author: Craig M.

description: Consistently good food and service.  They're usually crowded so reservations help.  I've also felt a bit rushed at times but this is still one of my favorite restaurants in West Portal.
author: Barry K.

description: I've been here once, thought it was good...well actually...I loved mine, I can't remember exactly what I got because it was a few months ago, but it was fresh pasta which was nice.  I'll go back and try again definitely,
author: J C.

description:
Went here when not too hungry so didn't have a full meal but what we did have was great.  I had raviolini stuffed with lobster.  Excellent really fresh pasta flavor came through even though there was a bit too much sauce, I felt.  Real lobster inside and a lot of bay scallops on top.  Excellent service, by the way.  Companion had a secondo, a california sea bass dish where the fish was perfectly cooked and fresh, excellent texture and
flavor.  I also had a cannolo for desert - it wasn't on the menu but was a special.  Now, the cannolo itself was just perfect but it came with some kind of whipped cream and chocolate sauce which I don't think is very authentic.  My companion didn't care for the after-dinner wine she ordered so the waiter just took it back and didn't charge us.  We had a nice table right by the window and I recommend this because the rest of the space is kind of small.  This place is truly superb and we can't wait to go back.
author: Mizu H.

description: Spiazzo's is always our "last minute where should we go for something really good and tasty" location, and unfortunately this last visit was a HUGE disappointment.  I'm not sure if it was due to the fact that we had a new server who was great at giving smiles but nothing more.  Our 5 year old wanted bread and cheese, and asked for it politely as well and nothing came. After a couple of rounds, we had to remind our server of our request.  I ordered my usual, the Fusilio Genovese (fusili with pesto and wild mushrooms) and have always been pleased with it.  However, it lacked taste and with the help of salt, pepper and parmesan, I was able to save it, barely.  The Garretto special (braised lamb shank) was returned by my husband who stated that it was dry and chewy.  Of course as one can expect, after you complain, you get the dirty looks from the kitchen, which is what I received for the rest of the night.  The second Garretto came out and it was much better but by now the service sucked so bad, its no longer a choice on my "Let's go to Spiazzo" list.
author: T C.

description: I love this place. The food is good. The service is good. The staff is friendly and attentive. The price is very reasonable. They try to accomodate everyone who comes to the door with or without a reservation. My favorite dish isn't on the menu anymore. BUt the portabello alla griglia salad is delicious. The chocolate pot de creme amazing and the pollo arrosto tasty. I miss the medaglione de maile all griglia. Maybe it will be on the specials menu in the future. Oh and the special of flank steak with gorgonzola- orgasmic but really really rich.
author: Kat F.

description: YUM.  The rigatoni is super and the service is good.  The ravioli is delicious and you can even get an organic salad.  A good place for a mid-week date with your honey!
author: Stephanie E.

description: Very classic Italian fare, but nothing special.  I would like to give 3 stars because the service was friendly and the ambiance is nice, but I can't get past the mediocre food.  I might return, but its not my first choice.
author: S E.

description: I'm giving this restaurant three stars based strictly on the service alone.  We had a wonderful waitress and our service was fabulous.  As for the food, I have had better Italian food and I make better Italian food at home.  The bread was a touch dry and would have tasted much better if we had been given a little olive oil to dip it in.  I ordered the Insalata Etrusca which would have been good had it not been oversaturated with balsamic vinegar, unfortunately.  As for the main course, I tried the Tortolloni in Salsa Rosa and though the tortolloni were cooked properly--al dente--the sauce tasted a little bit too much like Campbell's Tomato Soup mixed with cream which was disappointing and the pieces of Italian parsley sprinkled on top were not chopped in small enough pieces.  As for the atmosphere, the tables are well-placed, the lighting is perfect and the decor is very nice.  I may revisit this restaurant at some point in time and try another selection (including one of their desserts which looked wonderful) but with all the great restaurants in the San Francisco Bay Area, I usually don't find myself going back unless I had a fantastic initial experience.  This just wasn't one of them.
author: Rabbit B.

description:
this is one of my favorite restaurants in the city. actually one of my favs anywhere. my mom and i eat here probably once a month, if not more. everything is great, they make amazing sauces. and i love the garlic veggies and flavorful potatoes. the mushroom appetizer is amazing. i love the salads. favorite dishes are: the flake steak (best balsalmic sauce  EVER), the breaded prawns (again, sauce is fantastic, i wanted to lick the plate), the half chicken (moistest and most flavorful chicken i've ever ever ever had), saltimbocca (yummy yummy yummy, sinful), gnocchi (best around). pretty much everything ive tried, i've LOVED. their chocolate pot de creme is delicious and creme brulee is awesome. 

the staff is super nice and always talkative and genuine. very relaxed feel. this place is the best!!
author: Alison W.

description: This place used to be really good, but its gradually become what it is today...mediocre.
author: noah f.

description: Decent Italian, I've been there twice and the service is pretty good, even on a Friday night. The food comes very very fast, which is the problem-I got the feeling that they wanted us out right away. When it's a busy night I guess they like to feed 'em and leave 'em. We got the check and the waiter stayed a foot away waiting to take the payment. I don't care how many people are waiting to get in, I don't like to feel rushed. I'm hoping for better next time.
author: Mandi A.

description: This is one of our favorite restaurants in West Portal. They have consistently good food and they treat their customers very well!
author: Joan M.

description: We  had been coming here regularly for over 10 years, and have always loved the food and ambiance.  We just went back to Spiazzo after a break of at least 9 months, and were terribly disappointed.  It seemed as though the ownership changed or something essential changed: my favorite salad (pears/gorgonzola/walnuts) which I ALWAYS got, was now without any flavor, the dressing watery and bland, and the salad bitter.  The spaghetti used to be flavorful and rich and now it was without any flavor at all!!!  The bread was stale (always served with butter, but these days I would think a real Italian restaurant would put olive oil on the table with small dishes for pouring...).  The mixed-antipasti dish was not very good at all, expensive....and had two slices of bruchetta (mushrooms on one slice was cold as if from refrigerator), some beans, some roasted peppers (a bit slimy and soft) two tiny and thin pieces of ham and a few other veggies. Finally, the whole meal went so fast with dishes coming quickly and taken away the second we put down our forks.  Not so relaxing as usual.  I wouldn't recommend Spiazzo.....and this is after years of our recommendations.
author: andrea h.
